loans.name: Iyiola

texts.en:
Iyiola is 35 years old and married with five children. Her eldest child is in primary school.

Iyiola sells palm and groundnut oil in both the wholesale and retail markets. She has been in this business since 2004.

Iyiola needs a loan of N99,000 so she can buy more palm and groundnut oil to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more groundnut and palm oil to sell

loans.name: Naseem Akhtar M. Din Group

texts.en:
Naseem akhtar baji is a 53 year old married lady who has lived in Pakpattan, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Pakpattan city is famous for its shrine places. People come to this city to visit the shrine places to make wishes. Her husband's name is M. D., who has been a ticket checker for the Railway for the past 30 years. Naseem baji is a mother of four kids: three sons and one daughter. All of her kids are getting their education from a school located near to their house. Naseem baji and her husband have a dream to see their children do well, and for that dream they work hard. She sews clothes by taking orders from her neighbors, both day and night. She is a highly determined lady who wants to achieve her dream. She is applying for a loan to buy another sewing machine because her old machine is starting to have problems. 

She is a group leader of some more women of her locale. Abida parveen baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes. Jannat baji and Sumera baji each want a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. Saima baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.  

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another sewing machine for sewing clothes.

loans.name: Daysi

texts.es: Daysi tiene 32 años, vive con su madre y sus hermanos en L. casa propia D. sus padres. Se dedica a L. atención D. su tienda que instaló hace 10 años donD. elL. vive, comenzó con poca mercadería y desD. entonces no ha dejado D. trabajar en su propia fuente ingreso, que le ha permitido solventar su gastos durante años. Su horario es D. corrido, cada semana va al mercado mayorista para adquirir mercadería, anotando lo que hace falta para sus ventas. Lo que a Daysi le agrada D. su trabajo es el hecho D. estar en contactos con sus clientes, por lo que siempre da ese calor humano en L. atención que dispone. A fututo desea mejorar su tienda y ubicarL. en el centro D. L. ciudad o en una zona más comercial para hacer crecer su negocio. Es L. cuarta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, elL. es una D. las socias que inculca entre los demás L. responsabilidad y L. asistencia puntual a las reuniones, se siente a gusto D. poder compartir un espacio D. su tiempo en las reuniones con sus compañeros. El dinero solicitado es para invertir en L. compra D. mercadería y para un nuevo negocio D. fotocopias que iniciará junto a su hermano, para eso Daysi utilizará L. mitad del préstamo en este proyecto D. negocio.
texts.en:
Daysi is 32 years old and lives with her brothers and her parents in her parents house. She works at a shop she set up ten years ago in the house. Starting with very little merchandise, she has continued to work to maintain her income, enabling her to cover her costs throughout the years. She runs a busy schedule, every week she goes to the wholesale markets to buy merchandise, keeping track of what she needs in her inventory. What Daysi appreciates about her work is that she gets to interact with all of her customers, providing good and friendly service to each one. In the future, she would like to expand her store and have a location in the center of the city, or in a zone which is more commercial so that she can grow her business. This is her 4th loan with MFP. As a member of the bank, Daysi is responsible, attends the meetings on time, and likes to be able to share time with other members of the bank. The money requested will be used to purchase merchandise for her store, and also for a new business in photocopying that she and her brother are starting. Daysi will use half the money for the new business.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store, and help fund a new photocopying business as well.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther L. sells charcoal and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Esther is 35 years old and is married.  Her husband is a teacher. She has four children who go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a car to transport the charcoal. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy a car to transport the charcoal

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita S. is a 54-year-old mother of four. She lives in a beautiful village in the town of Hamtic, Antique, Philippines, where most people earn their livelihood through fishing and farming. Nenita is new in town, because she lived in her own city before she decided to permanently settle here in Hamtic. She started her variety store to serve her neighbors with an initial capital of Php 3,000. The income earned from her business was used to finance her children's education. She applied for this loan to buy food and beverages to maintain her variety store. She hopes that in the future, she could establish a bigger grocery, and she hopes to send her other children to a university.

loans.use: To buy food and beverages for variety store.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita E. is a 52-year-old married mother of three sons who lives in Tobias Fornier, Antique Province. Most locals still call Tobias Fornier "Dao" which was the city's name before it was renamed after a popular local political leader. Amelita's husband Mario is a bus conductor. Her oldest son is 18 and attends college; the other two are in high school.

Amelita plans to use the proceeds of this loan to buy rice, fish, and vegetables such as onion and garlic for resale at market. She has been selling foodstuffs at market for about 10 years, and uses her income to support the educational needs of her sons.

Amelita hopes that all of her sons will grow up to have stable jobs. She would like to live in a more comfortable house, and have a stall at market from which to sell her goods.

loans.use: To buy rice, fish, and vegetables for resale at market.

loans.name: Hassana

texts.en:
Hassana Y. is married with 2 children and has received no formal education. For 6 years, Hassana has worked as a petty trader, selling cooked food such as rice balls, banku and fufu, at Siwdo in Cape Coast. While Hassana works as a petty trader, her husband is employed as a phone seller.

Hassana uses her income to pay for her children’s food and books. She will use the loan to purchase additional ingredients for preparation of the food to sell and with the new profits from her expanded business, Hassana plans to buy land.

loans.use: purchase additional ingredients for preparation of cooked food

loans.name: Kyarwabuyamba A Ahebwa Margaret Group

texts.en: A. Margaret is a 32-year-old married woman with five children, all schooling. She has been selling new clothes for over 2 years. She is using the loan to purchase clothes for ladies, gentlemen, abd children. She is a hard-working business lady whose dream is to purchase a plot of land and construct a residential house.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for ladies, gentlemen, and children

loans.name: Jemilly

texts.en:
Jemilly B. is from the village of Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 41 years old. Jemilly is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Jemilly sells a variety of bananas in the local community. She also sells firewood. Jemilly has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jemilly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jemilly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jemilly is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Jemilly from HSPFI. 

"I plan to use the additional revenue generated from my business to supplement the income of my family and to support the educational needs of my children," she answered during the interview of HSPFI Kiva staff.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie H. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 28 years old. Melanie is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Melanie owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Melanie is just starting this business.

In 2004, Melanie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Melanie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Melanie is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Melanie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María  vive en el sector de Zhidmad, a cinco minutos de la comunidad de Santa Ana, en la provincia del Azuay, su clima es variado al igual que la ciudad de Cuenca,  la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura, María tiene 32 años de edad de estado civil casada, tiene cuatro hijos de 10, 8, 4, 2 años de edad, los tres primeros hijos estudian en la escuela de Santa Ana, vive en casa propia, su esposo trabaja en la construcción de casas (albañil), de lunes a viernes con el horario de 8 AM. a 16PM. María se traslada a la ciudad de Cuenca para trabajar en quehaceres domésticos, sus pequeños hijos se quedan en casa en compañía de la abuelita de su esposo que tiene 80 años, y vive con ellos, al llegar a casa por la tarde se dedica a velar por sus hijos y dar de alimentar a sus animales que tiene.
En su propiedad tiene cuatro reses preñadas, chanchos que cría para la venta, gallinas, y unos cuantos cuyes para consumo doméstico; Con el préstamo de 1100 dólares que solicitó piensa comprar pollos de cría, alimentación(balanceado), y lo que haga falta para el negocio, así también buscar ayuda para que le asesoren en este proyecto.
María es socia de la Fundación espoir hace cinco años, ya anteriormente a realizado algunos créditos y está muy agradecida con espoir por el apoyo que le está brindando.
La meta que tiene en su vida es llegar a comprarse un carro (camioneta) para poder distribuir personalmente los pollos en diferentes lugares de la ciudad.
texts.en:
María lives in the area of Zhidmad, five minutes from the community of Santa Ana, in the province of Azuay. The climate is varied as in the town of Cuenca and the majority of the inhabitants are farmers. María is 32 years old, married with four children, 10, 8, 4, and 2 years old, the three oldest attend the school of Santa Ana. She lives in her own house, her husband works in construction (builder), Monday through Friday from 8 am to 4 pm. María commutes to the town of Cuenca to work in housekeeping. Her young children stay at home with her husband's grandmother who is 80 years old and lives with them. When María returns in the afternoon she looks after her children and feeds her animals.

On their property they have four pregnant heads of cattle, pigs she raises to be sold, hens, and a few guinea pigs for domestic consumption. With the loan of US$1100 requested she will buy chickens to be raised, food (balanced) and other necessities for the business as well as search for consultancy with this project. María has been a partner of the "Fundación Espoir" for five years, she has had previous loans and is very grateful to Espoir for the support being offered. It is her goal to be able to buy a vehicle (pick-up truck) in order to distribute the chickens herself to different places of the town.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens, food (balanced) etc. for business.

loans.name: Natasha

texts.en:
Natasha E. is 31 years old and lives in the town of Lalovaea B. She is married and has three school-aged children. Her main source of income comes primarily from selling fried foods in the local community. Natasha has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 300 WST a month.

In 2009, Natasha joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and to increase her ability to engage in business activities. Natasha is requesting her first loan from SPBD. She hopes to obtain a loan of 1,000 WST, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. Natasha plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive, and self-esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lailanie

texts.en:
Lailanie is already 35 years old. She and her family live in the village of Sitio Anguapan Tumauini, Isabela. She and her husband were blessed with four children. Two of her children are already in high school while two are in grade school. Lailanie has been helping her husband in their agriculture business by retailing rice in their village. In this way, she generates an income which is quite beneficial to provide the school allowance of their children. The couple are helping one another to achieve their goals in life. They are hoping that each one of them will be fairly benefited through their sacrifices in giving them a good future.

Lailanie is again requesting a loan amounting to PHP 4,000 to further improve her rice retailing business. She is planning to buy sacks of rice and to have a lot of stock to able meet the needs of her customers in their village thus increasing her daily income. She is hoping for the loan request to be granted soon.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Basita

texts.es:
La señora Basita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Picota”, Distrito de Picota, Provincia de Picota, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 37 años y es madre de 02 hijos, 01 que aun dependen de ella.

Su fuerza  y anhelo de sacar adelante a sus hijos y seguir generando sus propios ingresos le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio, se encuentra ubicado en su misma casa en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado para atender a sus clientes. Las ganancias que genera a diario, la ayuda al ingreso económico  en su familia. 

Desde su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes y hoy en la actualidad tiene clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su casa a comprar y es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Basita, se siente con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando, y prepararse para hacer frente a las adversidades de la vida  y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Ms. Basita belongs to the communal bank “Picota,” in the District of Picota, Picota Province, Department of San Martin. She is single, 38 years old and is a mother of 2 children, one that is dependent on her. Her strength and desire to bring up her children and to generate her own income motivated her to start her own business. Her business is located in her house and is very well equipped to serve her customers. The revenue that she generates daily helps with the financial income of her family. From its inception to date the business has been gaining customers and currently has regular customers who come to the house daily to make purchases and it is she who personally attends to them with her characteristic charm.

With this loan of 3,000.00 PEN she will buy bags of rice and sugar, packaged noodles, canned fish, cartons of milk, crates of eggs, and personal hygiene products to continue giving her customers the best attention.

Basita feels very strongly about continuing to work and prepared to face the adversities of life. She thanks the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping women like her to have opportunities to develop in the environment where they are coping.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy groceries and increase her stock

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly U. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 59 years old. Nelly is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Nelly owns & operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of food products in the local community. Nelly is just starting this business.

In 2009, Nelly joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelly is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Nelly from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Chap

texts.en: Chap P. is a 55-year-old local farmer and a widow with three children. Two of them are married and live separately and the third one is a student. To earn a living, Chap P. grows rice on her own small farmland. In the past, she paid much money to plow the farmland because she does not have enough farm supplies. Therefore, she is applying for a loan to buy a cow, which she will use to help plow her land.

loans.use: To buy a cow for plowing

loans.name: José Mario

texts.es: José Mario B. residente del departamento de La Libertad vive a su junt esposa. José tiene un pequeño carro de carga en el cual hace sus negocios todos los días, el se dedica a la compra y recolección de materiales es, decir chatarra, la cual el luego distribuye y ofrece a diferentes fabricas que reúsan cierto tipos de materiales, ahora el solicita de un crédito para comprar plástico, ya que muchos de sus potenciales clientes le piden este tipo de material.
texts.en:
José Mario B. lives with his wife in the Department of La Libertad. Jose has a small cargo vehicle, which he uses for his daily work. He purchases and collects recycled materials, which he then distributes and offers to different factories that reuse certain types of materials. The requested loan will be used to buy plastic, since this material is requested by many of his potential customers.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy recycled plastic to resell

loans.name: Linda Group

texts.es:
El grupo Linda está integrado por tres mujeres luchadoras, trabajadoras y con mucho deseos de auto superarse ellas son Marcia del Rosario R. Núñez quien tiene una pequeña venta, Rosa Argentina R. vende ropa y frijoles cocidos, Patricia E. comercializa con ropa y cosméticos y Katherine L. L. tiene una pequeña pulpería. 

Ellas ocuparan el préstamo en sus respectivos negocios aprovechando esta temporada navideña.
texts.en:
The Linda Group consists of three strong-willed, hardworking women who have a great desire for self-improvement. They are Marcia del Rosario R. Núñez who has a small retail store, Rosa Argentina R. who sells clothing and cooked beans, Patricia E. who sells clothing and cosmetics, and Katherine L. L. who operates a small grocery store.

They will use the loan for their respective businesses so that they can take advantage of the Christmas season.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to purchase merchandise for the Christmas season

loans.name: Allah Yaguba Group Of Mukono

texts.en: Sarah N. is 23 years old and the leader of her group in Mukono. She is married and has one child, who is still a baby. Sarah sells secondhand shoes and has been doing so for two years. From this business, she is able to generate 50,000 USH per week. She would like to use her loan of 300,000 USH to purchase more shoes and boost business.  Her dream is to one day be able to afford a house for her family.

loans.use: More Secondhand Shoes

loans.name: Gina's Group

texts.en:
Gina S. is from the village of Zone 3. She is 39 years old and the group leader of a 5-member ASKI loan group. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Gina S..

Gina is married and has three adult children. Gina has operated a general store as her main source of income for over ten years. Her business generates approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Gina joined ASKI to access their financial services and an effort to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Gina is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first ASKI loan. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Rene

texts.en: Rene, 34, lives in Banga, South Cotabato, and has a rice farming business. He devotes his time to working in his 1 hectare rice field. He heard that Community Economic Ventures, Inc. offers financial support to entrepreneurs like him and he joined in June, 2008. His business is continually growing and now he is requesting a loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). This money will help sustain his business with a low interest charge.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie B. is from the village of Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 53 years old. Elsie is married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Elsie operates a service-based business, providing transportation for passengers in her community. Elsie has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $75 a month from this activity.

In 2009, Elsie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Elsie is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to further develop her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Vida Luz

texts.es: Vida Luz tiene 32 años, por lo que su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de video juegos. Este no es el primer financiamiento que realiza con Fundación León 2000, por lo que es una mujer muy alegre y dinámica por lo que está muy contenta con esta experiencia. Ella siempre se ha preocupado por sacar adelante a su negocio pues ella hace todo lo posible para mantener a sus 2 hijos que son lo más importantes para ella. Actualmente ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de ciertos artículos que son necesarios en su negocio, por lo que quiere comprar sillas, golosinas y algunos discos nuevos de juegos. Ella sueña con mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia que son las más importantes.
texts.en:
Vida Luz is 32 years old. She currently provides video games services. This is not the first loan that she receives from Fundacion Leon 2000 because she has enjoyed this experience. She is a very dynamic and happy woman. She was always keen on developing her business to raise her 2 children who mean the world to her. She is applying for this loan in order to buy furniture for her business such as chairs, candies, new CDs for gaming purposes. She hopes to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chairs, candies, new CDs

loans.name: Sa

texts.en:
Sa K., age 30, is married and resides with her children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. She has four children. She is engaged in a business selling meatballs in front of a local garment factory in the city, earning approximately an income of US$ 5 per day. By doing so, she is able to cover her family expenses, especially the children’s education. She has been in this business since 2008. Her husband helps his wife in the business and is able to earn the same amount of income as his wife.

The standard of living of the family has improved since she has been in this business, so she wants to have a loan to expand her business. K. is requesting a loan of USD 200 to buy more meatballs for resale. This is her first loan from CREDIT, partnered with Kiva.

loans.use: buy more meatballs to expand the business

loans.name: Meshack

texts.en:
Meshack S. N. is thirty-two years old, married and has three children between the ages of eight and one year old. His business is located at Jambo-Chaani, an industrial area in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many many tourist attraction sites, not forgetting the Indian ocean white beaches. 

He has been selling shoes for the last eleven years to the local people and tourists. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is that shoes for resale are hard to get. However he works very hard to keep his business doing well. Meshack is using his loan of 40,000 KES to buy more shoes to expand his business. He hopes to be a wholesaler in the future. He also hopes to build his own house some day. He is a very hardworking man.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to resell.

loans.name: Marwan

texts.en:
Marwan is a 41-year-old married man with four dependent children. He has been working at home painting and decoration for the past 25 years and he has very good experience in this occupation. Due to the long period, he was able to earn a good work reputation and become known in this field. He works on a freelance basis upon request of the customers. 

Today, Marwan is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase new painting tools to replace his old ones. He is expecting to expand and fulfill his business objectives and is very confident that he will be able to achieve substantial growth in the coming years.

loans.use: To purchase new painting tools

loans.name: Ith

texts.en: Mrs. Ith E. is 49 years old and she livE. in Ta Kol village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice and vegetablE. to earn a living. She doE. not have enough money to support the crops, so she decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer, vegetable seed and gasoline. Mrs. Ith E. is a widow with a child who is a student in the local school.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, vegetable seed and gasoline to support her crops

loans.name: Air Field Short Cut Group

texts.en:
Edwina D. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called 'Air Field Short Cut'. She is 35 years old, single, with 3 children who range from 10 to 18 years old, and she also cares for 5 siblings. She could not continue her education through college. 

For more than 5 years Edwina has been selling charcoal at the Air Field Short Cut road in Sinkor, Monrovia, Liberia. She started with cash received as school fees with which she bought 10 bags of charcoal.

When Edwina buys charcoal it is usually dusty and she doesn’t know what is in the bag as she doesn't bag it herself. She sells dry charcoal with good-sized pieces at a reasonable price in order to encourage customers to continue buying from her.

 Her goal and dream is to expand her business to international standard, build a house, educate her children and give them better medical attention. She plans to use her 15,000 Liberian dollar portion of the group loan amount of 45,000 Liberian dollars to buy more bags of charcoal.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Edwina is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:

The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.


Join the Team LEAP - Liberia lending team on Kiva today: http://www.kiva.org/team/team_leap_liberia

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna B. is from the village of Barangay Villa Coloma, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 48 years old. Lorna is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Lorna owns & operates a general store, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Lorna has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Lorna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lorna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 27000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the ninth loan taken out by Lorna from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad A. is a young man from Bethlehem. Ahmad is the father of three sons. He owns a poultry farm where he raises and sells chickens. He  $500 a month. To expand his business and his profits, he decided to start raising and selling goats on his farm.

Ahmad bought 10 goats to start and then came to FATEN and took a $2000 loan to buy more goats. This endeavor will increase his returns, provide Ahmad and his family with better living conditions, and will cover the household expenses.

In the photograph, Ahmad appears in the FATEN's office.

loans.use: Purchase goats to add to the farm

loans.name: Soth

texts.en: Mrs. Soth D. is 51 years old and is a villager in Melong Khang Cheung village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 2 hectares of land to cultivate rice. For this farm, Mrs. Soth D. decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline to support her farming crop. Her husband, Mr. Thin Chin, owns a wedding and funeral store which he rents, allowing him to earn a small revenue to support his family. This couple (pictured together) has three children; one is a teacher, another a driver, while the last one is a student.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline.

loans.name: Union Por El Progreso Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL UNION POR EL PROGRESO

L. Alcancía Comunal “UNION POR EL PROGRESO” cursa el ciclo 7 demostrando puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos. Ceci es una socia entusiasta y alegre que convoco a sus amigos hace varios años, todos son socios comprometidos ya que se dedican a diferentes giros D. negocios informales y estos les  permiten atender las necesidades básicas D. sus familias. Ceci se dedica a L. venta D. jugos tiene un pequeño puesto en un mercado en L. zona alta D. Huaycan, ElL. tiene un pequeño hijo por el cual debe D. trabajar, su objetivo es poder brindarle una buena educación  además le sueña con estudiar, para poder desempeñarse en otras actividades. El grupo agradece los préstamos a KIVA y EDAPROSPO.
texts.en:
Union por el Progreso Communal Bank The Union por el Progreso Communal Bank is in its seventh cycle, and they are demonstrating punctuality and responsibility with their payments. Ceci is an enthusiastic and happy member who organized her friends several years ago. They are all committed members. They devote themselves to different lines of informal businesses, which allow them to see to their families’ basic necessities. Ceci sells juice. She has a small stand in a market in the high zone of Huaycan. She has a small son for whom she needs to work. Her objective is to be able to give him a good education. Also, she dreams of going to school to be able to do other activities. The group is grateful to Kiva and Edaprospo for the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products and supplies

loans.name: Damaso

texts.es:
El Sr. Dámaso  tiene 48 años de edad es casado y tiene 4 hijos dos  en edad escolar y dos ya mayores de edad vive en la ciudad de Carapeguá compañía Espartilla.
Don Dámaso  trabaja como artesano en su casa y con la ayuda de su esposa fabrican artesanías como ponchos, hamacas, frazadas y otros. 
Ellos cada día dedican varias horas  para fabricar los producto que luego salen a vender a los negocios de varias zonas del país.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías (hamacas, frazadas, fajas y sábanas) puesto que tiene muchos pedidos de estos productos.
texts.en:
Mr. Dámaso is 48-years-old, married, and has 4 school-aged children and 2 older children. He lives in the city of Carapeguá, Espartilla company. Mr. Dámaso works as an artisan in his house, and, with the help of his wife, makes handmade goods such as ponchos, hammocks, blankets, and other things. Each day they spend several hours making their products that they then sell at businesses in various regions of the country. He's asking for the loan to buy merchandise (hammocks, blankets, belts, and sheets) because he has many requests for these products.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beadspreads, sheets, hammocks, etc.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan K. is currently in the business of selling bags of maize, beans, rice and pulses in a little store  and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of rice and maize to sell.  Susan is 49 years old and is married to a husband who is a security guard. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her little store.

loans.use: Stock more bags of rice and maize to sell

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion M. is from the village of Alinam, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 48 years old. Salvacion is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Salvacion owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling vegetables, such as string beans and squash, to the local community. Salvacion has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Salvacion joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Salvacion is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be Salvacion's third loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand the business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Enecita

texts.en:
Enecita R. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 51 years old. Enecita is married and has 6 children. Her 2 younger children still go to school and she works hard to sustain their education. To make a living, Enecita owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale.

Enecita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Enecita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Enecita is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase supplies like seeds and fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: To purchase supplies like seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Kalimat

texts.en:
Kalimat B. is 51 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Bayan-Ulgiy province of Mongolia. He and his family all live together in their 'ger', a Mongolian nomadic housing tent. The family moved to the central town of Bayan Ulgiy province in 2004 because of their children's education. They used to live in the countryside in the nomadic lifestyle. Their oldest son serves in a military force on the border of the country. Their two younger sons attend university while their youngest, a daughter, stays at home with her mother. 

Kalimat began his taxi service business in 1998 and has gained a lot of business experience. He transports local residents to and from various points in his province. He uses his business earnings to pay his children's tuition fees. Because of his cheerful and gentlemanly character, he gains a lot of permanent customers. He says, " I want to provide a good education for my children and build a big house for them, too." 

Kalimat is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan to prepare for wintertime as well as to pay his children's tuition fees.

loans.use: To pay his children's tuition fees

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel  tiene 44 años, es casada con un hijo menor de edad. Su actividad económica es una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación, la cual ya tiene 18 años de tenerla, esta pulpería brinda de manutención a ella y a su familia. Este negocio empezó con muy poco capital  de trabajo, como una búsqueda de fuente de ingresos alternativos. El crédito será invertido en la compra de granos básicos, que es lo que más se vende actualmente. Su meta actualmente es que sus hijos logren finalizar sus estudios y mejorar las condiciones de vida del hogar.
texts.en: Maribel is 44 years old; she is married and has one underage child. She has a general store located in her home; she has had the store for 18 years since it provides income for her and her family. She began the business with very little money and she had to find a source of alternative income. The loan will be used to buy basic grains which is what she sells. Her goal is that her children will be able to finish their studies and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: Work capital.

loans.name: Kara Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Kara” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 1,200,000 for each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Aminata K. who is pictured on the left. Aminata is age 45 and was born in Makeni. She is married with four children. Her husband is a teacher and her children are attending both primary and secondary schools, respectively.  

For many years now, Aminata has been selling cloths, including gara lappers (locally dyed clothes), dishes and rubber bowls. She will use her share of this loan to expand her business. She will buy gara lapper making materials like inks, caustic soda, powder, white cotton cloths, dishes and rubber bowls to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy gara lapper making materials like inks, caustic soda, powder, white cotton cloths, dishes and rubber bowls to add to her business

loans.name: Lucie

texts.en:
Lucie is 23 years old, married with one child who is two years old.  Lucie is a self-employed businesswoman who is in the business of selling new shirts for men. She has been in this business for about 4 years; her business is open 7 am to 6 pm every day.

Although Lucie has been in this business for about 4 years, her capital is still too low to expand meaningfully.  To end this situation, she needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, she will hopefully earn more profits through the sale of a big number of shirts which in turn will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability. In addition to that, she will continue taking care of her family.

loans.use: buying a lot of shirts for sale

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “LA AMISTAD DE OLLANTAYTAMBO ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Ollantaytambo perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Doris; La socia tiene 42 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos, la socia se dedica a la atención de su pequeño hospedaje situado en sus casa, la socia brinda el servicio de hospedaje a los turistas que llegan a la zona y también ella tienen sus terrenos en el cual produce maíz, papa, verduras. La socia desea el préstamo para poder implementar los desayunos en su hospedaje y dar mejor servicio. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de frutas, gas, insumos.

La socia  agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Mrs. Doris M. S. is a member of the Communal Bank “La Amistad de Ollantaytambo” [Ollantaytambo’s Friendship]. The bank is situated in the District of Ollantaytambo and is part of the Urubamba province in the Department of Cusco.

Mrs. M. is 42 years old, has three children and lives with her common-law husband. She has a small lodging in her house where she offers services to tourist visiting the area. She also plants corn, potatoes and vegetables on her land.

She requests the loan to be able to offer breakfast in her lodging thus providing better service to her costumers. She will use the loan to buy supplies, gas and fruits. Mrs. M. is grateful for and values the loan and she commits herself to make the payments within the specified time.

loans.use: to buy supplies, gas and fruits

loans.name: Samson Kenana

texts.en:
Samson Kenana K. is 20 years-old. He is married to Longisa K. and he is a father of two children aged nine months and two years. Samson is a businessman and he has been buying and selling beans and potatoes for the past four years.
  
Samson learned about KADET from a member of a group within his locality that was registered with KADET. This will be his first loan and he is planning to spend Kshs 50,000 to buy more beans and potatoes to sell to his clients. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to buy young rams to raise and sell.

His dream is to become successful in his business and known countrywide

loans.use: buying more beans and potatoes for resale

loans.name: Mr. Ten Seang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan has 17 people, who have selected Mr. Ten S. to become the village bank president located in Pou Bay Village, Takeo province. All the members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes, to improve their family's living standard. 

Mr. S. is a farmer who owns a two-hectare plot of land that he uses to grow rice to sell to support his family. He is also a village chief in this village, while his wife, Mrs. Chrun Norn, is a pig breeder. In his rice field, he has some problems because his field is infertile. To improve production, Mr. S. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer. With the remainder of the loan he is going to buy some pig food. This couple has two children, one of whom is a motorbike taxi driver, while the other is a student in public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es: El señor Rafael nacido el 25 de Julio en El Torno, es agricultor, se dedica a esta actividad hace muchos años, el Sr. Trabaja duro y fuerte ya que tiene a su Padre con una discapacidad ya que no puede hablar y el  Sr. Rafael trabaja para mantenerlo, su papa también lo ayuda en lo que es la cosecha de sus productos, el siembra maní y le va muy bien con los productos que el siembra ya que el tiene su propia parcela  y también trabaja con chanchos compra para la cría  y lo carnea para vender por kilo. El señor tiene su parcela en los moros a 5 km de El Torno, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de semillas y lo que ocasiona los gastos del preparado de la tierra para la siembra, y también en la compra de cría de Chanchos, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Rafael, who was born in El Torno on a July 25th, is a farmer.  He’s been a farmer for many years.  He works hard because his father is handicapped and unable to speak and Rafael works to support him.  His father helps him during harvest time.  He farms peanuts and does well with the crop since he owns his own piece of farmland.  He also raises pigs to butcher and sell by the kilogram.

He has his plot of land in Los Moros which is 5 kilometers from El Torno.  He will use funds from the loan to buy seed and pay for costs related with preparing the soil for planting.  He will also buy a litter of pigs.  He is grateful to the institution for the support given.

loans.use: For peanut crop and to buy pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Decesaria

texts.en: Decesaria M.'s main source of income comes from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in her community. She is 55 years old, married and has seven school-aged children. They are from the village of Camul, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. Decesaria has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Decesaria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC which was used to purchase additional fish to sell. Decesaria is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be her third loan from PMPC. She plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Eldar

texts.en:
Eldar A. is a 40-year-old married man who lives with his wife and son in the Saatli, province of Azerbaijan. They are a very hard-working family.  Eldar is always engaged in farming. His wife does the household work and takes care of their school-aged son. They do their best to give him a good education. Now their son goes to the local school. 

The main source of income for the family comes from a cattle-breeding business. After successfully repaying his previous loan, Eldar requested a new loan in amount of 1,500 AZN, which was used to purchase livestock feed and to buy three more cows. Currently, the income of his family has increased to 300 AZN per month.

loans.use: To buy three cows

loans.name: Hanadi

texts.en:
Hanadi. a wife and mother of four sons, works with her husband in their land which produces tomatoes and cucumbers. Hanadi lives in Rafah in the Gaza Strip.

Hanadi took a loan from FATEN to purchase agricultural insecticides which will save their crops and increase their produce. Hanadi has been working in their land for 7 years now.

Hanadi's husband appears in the picture here as she is a religious woman, as are most Gaza Strip inhabitants.

loans.use: Purchasing agricultural insecticides

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.en:
Jacinto C. is from the village of Sta. Clara Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 55 years old, married and has three adult children. To make a living, Jacinto owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Jacinto has been engaged in his business for over 30 years and earns approximately 30,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2011, Jacinto joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jacinto is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be Jacinto's first loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Eva is a very hard working entrepreneur. Eva is 47 years old and all her children are in school.

Eva has a buying and selling of used clothing business in the Philippines. Eva requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase bundles of used clothes.

Eva has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, Eva would like to send their children to school, spend money for house repairs and buy appliances.

loans.use: to purchase used clothes to sell

loans.name: C6230 Ingenzi Group

texts.en:
Aisha is 35 years old and is married with three children who are between the ages of 3 and 12 years old. She also takes care of ten dependents from her family. She has a salon that is three years old and she employs three persons in her business.

Aisha has now requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of growing her business through purchasing more materials for her beauty salon. This purchase will allow her to serve more customers from the community which will help her to earn more money. The profits she expects to earn will be one of the ways she will develop her business and will provide all the basic needs of her family, including her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more material for her beauty salon

loans.name: Amonullo

texts.ru: Бобоев Амонулло проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 20 лет. Холост. Образование-среднее. Уже три года как он занимается торговлей. Он в основном продает телефоны и запасные части телефона. Кредит просит для приобретения сим-карт, зарядных устройств, панели телефонов, батареек, запасных частей телефона и для аренды нового помещения.
texts.en: Amonullo B. lives in Hamadoni. He is 20 years old and single. He has a high school education.  He has been working in trade for three years. He primarily sells phones and phone spare parts. He is asking for a loan to buy SIM cards, chargers, cell phone covers, batteries, phone spare parts, and to rent new premises.

loans.use: to buy SIM cards, chargers, cell phone covers, batteries, phone spare parts, and to rent new premises.

loans.name: Areta

texts.en:
Areta Maruqyan is 55 years old and lives in Vanadzor. She has two sons and one daughter. Two of her children are married and live separately and one son, still single, lives with Areta and her husband.

Areta and her husband opened a shop across from their house three years ago, but they have been in this business for 13 years. They sell groceries and household goods such oil, paper goods, towels, toys, jam, soap, etc. The profits from the sales allow them to take care of the family's needs. Areta is seeking a loan of 1,000,000 AMD to buy sausages, macaroni, coffee, tea, household goods and other items for her shop. This is Areta’s 8th loan form Nor Horizon and 2nd loan from Kiva.

loans.use: To buy sausages, macaroni, coffee, tea and household goods for her shop.

loans.name: José Francisco

texts.es: El señor José, tiene la edad de 65 años , habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposa la cual , labora como comerciante , ellos tienen hijos ya casados e independiente, los planes hacia su familia es poder mejorar la vivienda ya que el zinc esta deteriorado , don José se dedica  a la ebanistería desde hace mucho tiempo , la mayor afectación que se le presento durante el primer crédito fue la compra de una madera totalmente deteriorada lo cual lo llevo a tener perdidas por el traslado tan largo y no tenia las condiciones para que esta llegara bien a su destino , con este segundo financiamiento lo quiere invertir es  en madera , clavos , lijas , pegamento y otros materiales para la elaboración  de sillas , mesas, puertas etc. Agradece a Afodenic atrávez de fondos Kiva el apoyo y la compresión para sacar adelante su pequeño taller que es fuente de ingreso para el pan de cada día.
texts.en:
José is 65 years old.  He lives in the town of Ticuantepe together with his wife who is a trader.  They have children who are already married and live independently.  José's plan for his family is to improve their home since the metal sheeting is in a bad state of repair.  José has been making furniture for a long time.  The biggest problem that he faced with his first loan was that he made losses because some of the wood he bought was totally damaged.  This was due to its long journey and the fact that it was not kept in appropriate conditions for it to arrive at its destination in good condition.

José would like to invest his second loan in wood, nails, sandpaper, glue and other materials for making chairs, tables, doors etc.  He is grateful to Afodenic for the support they provide through their Kiva funds and their understanding in helping him to get ahead in his small furniture business which is the source of income with which he covers his basic needs.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails, glue and other products

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
The photo shows Heng in front of her house in the Ornlong Veng district, where she sells various items. She is 38 and married, and has been blessed with three children, all of whom are single. Her husband is a car taxi driver. Heng is a busy woman who works hard every day at her business operations in order to earn money to help support her family. 

Presently, her husband's business is bothered as his car is often broken, and he normally pays for mending costs. To decrease this expense, she will use this loan to add to her savings to buy a used car to replace the broken one so her husband can continue his taxi service as before.

loans.use: to buy a used car to replace the old one.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 37 years old and married, with three children in school.  To earn a living, she runs a green grocery.  She has been in the business for four years with four employees.  Alongside her grocery store, she sells charcoal.  She also owns rental houses which earn her extra income.  Previously, she was farming.  

Gladys has improved her business through Faulu Kenya and she has bought a piece of land at her rural home.  Her dream is to have a well-established business in the future.  She has requested 80,000 KES to buy kale, onions and charcoal.

loans.use: to buy kale, onions and charcoal.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 40 years old and married. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a Sari Sari  (variety) Store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her store.

Marilou has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the Sari Sari Store for 15 years and also earns an income from E-loading (prepaid cell phone credits).

Marilou aspires to save money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her store.

loans.name: Risolat

texts.ru: Рисолат проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ей 58 лет. Она замужем. У нее 8 детей. У них очень большая и дружная семья. Рисолат имеет высшее экономическое образование. Она по профессии проработала более 24 лет. На сегодняшний день Рисолат занимается торговлей на рынке "Дехкон". Она в основном занимается продажей пуговиц, бисера и тесьмы. Этим она зарабатывает и обеспечивает семью. Кредит берет для приобретения разных видов пуговиц, разноцветных ниток, бисера и тесьмы. Она хочет увеличить ассортимент своего товара.
texts.en: Risolat lives in Tursun-zoda.  She is 58 years old, married, and has eight children.  She has a large, loving family.  Risolat has a higher education as an economist.  She worked in her profession for more than 24 years.  Now, Risolat trades at the Dekhon market.  She primarily sells buttons, beads, and trims.  She is able to earn enough to support her family doing this.  She is taking out a loan to buy different kinds of buttons, different colored thread, beads, and trims.  She wants to increase the variety of her goods.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of buttons, different colored thread, beads, and trims.

loans.name: Oscar Manuel

texts.es:
Oscar  de 40 años vive en el barrio San José y tiene dos hijos en las edades de 4 y 10 años. Allí  tiene como negocio vender productos del mar;  Oscar prepara deliciosos cabritos, (Producto estrella) es decir bocachicos rellenos de verduras en su asador y también cocteles de camarón chipichipi, cazuela de mariscos, alimentos por los cuales es muy reconocido en la comunidad y que hacen que cada día gane su negocio una mayor clientela.  Su menú está conformado por los supercostales, pescado asado, pescado en cabrito que acompaña con refrescos especialmente los fines de semana. Su meta es darle una mayor forma y presentación a su negocio y gradualmente lograr un confort para sus clientes que ya no solo quieren llevar su producto sino también degustarlo en las mismas instalaciones. Esta es la razón por la cual con su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, comprará una carpa, y mayor volumen de sus materias primas e insumos para lograr que las delicias ofrecidas se extiendan mucho más entre nuevos clientes y obtener un mayor capital de trabajo para este propósito. 
Mientras Oscar trabaja para lograr sus sueños, maneja una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor de 17,7%, su razón corriente es de 1,8% sus inventarios rotan cada dos días mientras sus cuentas por pagar cada 3 días.
texts.en:
Oscar is 40 years old and lives in the neighborhood of San José. He has two children, ages 4 and 10. Oscar has a business selling products from the sea. He sells “cabritos”, which are grilled bocachico fish stuffed with vegetables. Oscar also sells seafood cocktails with shrimp and clams, seafood stew, and other dishes that are well-known in the community. Every day is able to gain more customers for his business. His menu consists of marinated seafood, roasted fish, and stuffed fish that are served with beverages, particularly on the weekends. Oscar’s goal is to make his business more presentable and comfortable for his customers so that they will not only want to order his food but also stay and enjoy it in the same place.

For this reason, Oscar is requesting a Kiva loan, his first instance of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will buy a canopy and a large amount of ingredients and supplies for preparing his delicious food. This will allow him to attract new customers and obtain more operating capital for expanding his business. In the meantime, Oscar works toward achieving his goals. He maintains a sales profitability rate of no less than 17.7% and a cash flow of 1.8%. His inventory turnover period is two days while his accounts payable period is three days.

loans.use: to purchase a canopy and a large amount of ingredients and supplies.

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr:
Ama est une femme  âgée de 26 ans. Elle est mariée å un frigoriste. Elle a 02 enfants.  
Ama travaille comme revendeuse de biscuits et bonbons depuis 2005. Elle vend à ses clients au marché d’ADAWLATO Elle achète les produits à LOME. Elle travaille seule.
Ama a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des biscuits et des bonbons.
texts.en: Ama is 26 years old and the mother of two children. She is married to a refrigeration engineer. She has been a retailer of cookies and candies since 2005. She buys her products in Lomé and sells them to her customers at the market in Adawlato. She works alone. Ama came to the microfinance institution WAGES and applied for her first loan to buy cookies and candies.

loans.use: to buy cookies and candies.

loans.name: Ma. Celina

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Ma. Celina works hard to support her family.

She has a lechon (roasted pig) vending business in the Philippines. She also earns income from the buying and selling of dressed chicken. Ma. Celina is borrowing 23,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional pigs for her lechon vending business.

Ma. Celina has been sustaining her business activities through her past sixteen loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy scrap materials like plastics, bottles and cans to sell in the junk shop.

loans.name: Tursunbubu

texts.ru: Турсунбубу 51 год, замужем и имеет пятерых взрослых детей.  Начав бизнес в животноводстве около 20 лет назад, Турсунбубу добилась успеха – на сегодняшний день ее хозяйство насчитывает скот на общую сумму 160,000 сом (KGS). Такое развитие бизнеса стало возможным благодаря упорному труду семьи Турсунбубу, хорошему уходу за скотом, включая соответсвующий ветеринарный уход и хорошие условия содержания. Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Турсунбубу обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS)на покупку скота. За счет доходов от полученного кредита, Турсунбубу сможет провести ремонт своего дома.
texts.en: Tursunbubu is 51 years old, married and has five grown children. Having started a livestock business about 20 years ago, Tursunbubu has become successful—today the combined value of all   livestock on her farm is 160,000 KGS. This business growth was possible due to hard work by Tursunbubu and her family, who  their good care of the animals, including providing appropriate  veterinary care and keeping the naimals comfortable.  In order to develop her business further, Tursunbubu turned to  Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan in the amount of 80,000 RGS to buy cattle. Thanks to the income made possible by this loan, Tursunbubu will be able to have her house repaired.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Americo

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Chibuto, Provincia  de Gaza, sul  de Moçambique, casado e pai de 5 filhos todos maiores de idade. Fez a 5ª classe e não continuou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta os netos que vivem com ele. 

Saiu de Chibuto para Maputo ( Boane) a procura de melhores condições de vida, trabalha como servente de escritorio da escola de condução de Boane ha mais de 7 anos e tem salario de 1.600.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o quarto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a obra da sua casa (ferro, cimento, pedra, areia, blocos e outros). Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 5.800.00mt,10.000.00mt,e 15.000.00mt, todos para a obra.  
Compromete-se a pagar sem problemas e no futuro pretende solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku para concluir a sua casa e mobiliar.
texts.en:
Americo was born in the district of Chibuto, in the province of Gaza in southern Mozambique. He is married and the father of five adult children. He went to school through fifth grade but had to drop out because of financial difficulties. He lives in his own home with his family, and also supports his grandchildren, who live with him.
He left Chibuto for Maputo (Boane) in search of a better life. He's had a desk job at a driving school for more than seven years and earns about 1,600 meticals a month. He uses his salary to pay for household expenses and also saves a little in a bank account. He has never had loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvuku from a friend who is also a client of the institution. This is his fourth loan, in the amount of 20,000 meticals, which he will use to purchase construction materials (iron, cement, stone, sand, cinder blocks, etc.) to continue the construction on his house. His first loans, in the amounts of 5,800, 10,000, and 15,000 meticals, were all also used for his home. He is committed to paying off this loan without any problems and in the future intends to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to finish and furnish his house.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (iron, cement, stone, sand, cinder blocks, etc.) to continue work on his house.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.
 
Rosalina has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.
 
Rosalina has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rosalina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Idrissa

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Idrissa.  He is married and has 5 children aged 17, 15, 12, 9 and 5. 

In 2001, Idrissa established his shoes, bags, artificial hair products and cosmetics business. He began this business because he wanted to be self-employed and get a regular source of income to support his family.  Working 7 days a week and 9 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,200,000 every month from this business. 

Idrissa would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000.  He has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy more shoes, bags and cosmetics. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. 

In the future, Idrissa plans to expand his business to other areas in the township, and to educate his children to university level. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy shoes, bags and cosmetics

loans.name: Silda

texts.es: Silda tiene 28 años, es una mujer trabajadora, dinámica  y alegre. Vive en compañía de su pareja y de sus tres hijos, a los que quiere mucho. Juntos habitan en su casa que es de su propiedad, que logró comprar con mucho esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza Silda, es la venta de plátanos, contado para esto con un pequeño puesto de ventas en el mercado de su distritio. Es así que se levanta desde muy temprano y se dirige al puerto fluvial  Miguel Grau, en donde espera la llegada de los productores y es a ellos a quienes compra sus productos para luego llevarlo al mercado. Tiene más de tres años dedicándose a esta actividad y hasta el momento ha contado siempre con la ayuda de su pareja, quien atiende a los clientes. Gracias a su negocio es que ha logrado ayudar en la economía de su hogar, sin embargo es un trabajo que requiere mucho sacrificio pues tiene que levantarse de madrugada, pero es necesario si desea salir adelante. Ella espera mas adelante incrementar su capital de trabajo y así comprar y vender en mayores volúmenes. Este seria el primer crédito con la institución MFP, se siente muy a gusto con el grupo comunal ya que todos se han mostrado muy solidarios con ella. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de más plátanos para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Silda is 28 years old and a hardworking, dynamic, and cheerful woman. She lives with her partner and their children who she loves dearly. They have their own home which they were able to buy after much effort. Silda sells bananas. She has her own vending stand at the market in her district. Silda wakes up very early so that she can get to the Miguel Grau river port and wait for her products to arrive. After she buys her products, she takes them to market. Silda has been in this business for more than three years and currently has the support of her partner, who helps with attending to the customers. Thanks to her business, she has been able to help with the household finances. However, her work requires great sacrifice since she must wake up at dawn, but it is necessary if she wants to succeed. Going forward, she hopes to increase her operating capital so that she can buy and sell in greater volumes.

This will be her first loan with MFP. Silda is very comfortable working with her Communal Bank since all the members have been very supportive of her. The amount she requested will be invested in the purchase of more bananas so that she can restock her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas.

loans.name: Mwanatibu

texts.en:
Mwanatibu is a married woman with one school-going child. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to providing for the family's basic needs. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees for her child.

For the past one year, she has operated a coconut selling business; Customers are the local area community members. She dreams of starting a charcoal selling business.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase some sacks of charcoal for her new charcoal selling business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase some sacks of charcoal for her new charcoal selling business.

loans.name: Irma Florinda

texts.es:
La señora Irma Florinda es soltera, tiene 21 años de edad, cursó los 3 años de educación media, se dedica al comercio a la venta de ropa típica para mujeres, inició este negocio con el apoyo de su mamá, y hasta el momento lleva 4 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo para invertirlo como capital para comprar mercadería, consistente en cortes, delantales, güipiles, blusas, fajas, sabanas. Espera ver grande su negocio en el futuro.
texts.en:
Irma Florinda is single. She is 21 years old and finished three years of middle school. She sells traditional women's clothing. She started this business with her mother's help, and she has 4 years' experience.   

She is asking for a loan to invest it as capital to buy merchandise. This will consist of aprons, huipiles, blouses, sashes, and sheets. She hopes to see her business get big in the future.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing for resale.

loans.name: Hilda Ivonne

texts.es:
La señora Ivonne es casada y vive con su esposo,ella tiene un pequeño taller de costura en la parte delantera de su casa , el cual su marido  le construyo con materiales que compraron con un préstamo anterior.
 Desde hace algunos años su esposo se enfermó , por lo que ahora la mayor parte de la responsabilidad económica recae en la señora Ivonne.
Siempre ha trabajado como costurera , para lo cual estudio en el INA ( Instituto Nacional de Aprendizaje).Es por esta razón que ahora desea aumentar sus ingresos produciendo maquila , es decir haciendo ropa en serie para venderla a un distribuidor.
 Necesita tener mejores máquinas, y  necesita comprar una máquina cover, que utilizará para dar un mejor acabado a las prendas que realizara: busos( ropa deportiva) y pijamas, para lo cual tambien necesitará comprar los hilos , las telas , zippers ,botones y demás materiales para la confección de esas prendas.
texts.en:
Ivonne is married and lives with her husband. She has a small sewing shop in the front of their home, which was built by her husband using materials they bought with a previous loan.
Ivonne’s husband fell ill some years ago and now Ivonne has become the household’s main provider. She has always worked as a seamstress, for which she was trained at INA (National Training Institute). She now wants to increase her income by working under a maquila scheme, i.e., starting a mass production of clothing and selling it to a distributor.
She needs to have better quality machines, as well as to purchase a cover sewing machine, which she will use to give a better finish to her garments, such as sweatshirts and pajamas. She will also need to purchase threads, fabrics, zippers, buttons and other supplies needed for sewing the clothes.

loans.use: to purchase a cover sewing machine and garment production supplies

loans.name: Diana Yadira
