texts.es: La  señora   Diana  es  una  persona  muy  emprendedora,  actualmente  ella  tiene  un   negocio de  venta  de  ropa  usada   el  cual  le permite  salir  adelante   día   con  día además  de desempeñar  el trabajo  que  mas le  gusta  el  cual  son las  ventas  ya  que a  sentido  cierta  atracción  al respecto, en esta  ocasión se  acerco  con  nosotros  ya  que   desea  realizar  la compra  de ropa  usada  para  su  negocio,  ve  en el crédito  la  posibilidad  de  hacer   crecer   su  negocio lo  cual  le  permitirá   generar  mayores  ingresos  además  de  continuar   brindándole  a sus clientes  el  excelente servicio que  la a caracterizado.
texts.en: Diana is a very hardworking person and she currently has a business selling used clothes which enables her to move ahead day by day as well as letting her do the work she likes best, which is selling things, as she feels a certain attraction to this work. At this time, she has come to us as she wants to buy clothes for her business and she sees the loan as offering her the possibility to grow her business and generate better income while continuing to offer her customers the excellent service that is characteristic of her.

loans.use: to buy used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: La señora Miriam tiene un puesto de venta de maní azucarado, es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para mantener  a su familia.  Este producto es muy bien recibido por el común de la gente ya que es una costumbre muy antigua la de comer dicho maní azucarado. El crédito lo requiere para compra de insumos (maní y azúcar). Miriam es casada, tiene dos hijos y vive en alquiler ubicada en la zona de las Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la décima cuarta vez que trabaja con IMPRO y la cuarta vez con KIVA.
texts.en: Miriam has a stand selling candied peanuts; it’s her source of income for family support.  This product is very well-received by common folk because eating candied peanuts is a very ancient tradition.  She needs the loan to buy ingredients (peanuts and sugar).  Miriam is married and has two children.  She rents her house located in the city of La Paz’s Pasankeri zone.  It is the 14th time she’s worked with IMPRO and the fourth with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy peanuts and sugar.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 29 years old and a single mother of one child living in Hioma, Uganda. She owns a produce business and she has been operating it for three years now. Anna has a challenge of her customers not paying her on time and this affects her business cash flow. 

Her personal goal is to educate her only child and also expand her business to new markets. Ann needs the credit facility to pay school fees for her child.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Tobias' Group

texts.en:
In Buru Atego village in Ndhiwa sub County, Kenya, Tobias has volunteered to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser. Tobias is a friendly member of the community with 7 children. Tobias lives with his family in a house made of concrete walls, concrete floor, and an iron roof.

Buru Atego village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from Buru Atego borehole. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause water-borne diseases. Chlorine dispensers offer a solution to this problem by allowing people to treat their water to make it safe to drink. Tobias’ family, and the 25 other households using the local water source, need a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. 

Tobias has volunteered to be the promoter to encourage the community to use the dispenser and to refill it with chlorine when the tank runs low. Tobias volunteered to be the promoter because he wants to help the community to treat water, thus reducing water-borne diseases. There are also four other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: David, Rose, Moses and Jane.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce carbon footprints will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Tobias’ community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To ensure that the community has access to safe drinking water via chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia Lopez was born in Guayaquil, Ecuador. She has been selling car parts and accessories for six years now. Her father taught her all about the business since he ran a similar business for most of his life. When she was 20 years old, Eufemia opened Isa Express and slowly she grew the business to where is stands today. Her father helped her financially by giving her the money to purchase a property which happens to be located next to her cousins. The shop is centrally located and attracts a lot of attention from customers. In fact, Eufemia reports that many people come to her simply because they work at the factory next door. “They search for my services, and I deliver,” she says. Ms. Lopez is asking for this loan to be able to purchase spark plugs, filters, spare electronic parts, and motor oil. Her goal is to be able to repair everything in-house so that the job can get done more quickly for her clients. The attention she gives her customers is personal, and she hopes to receive this loan so that she can afford to pay an employee to work Saturdays, which are the busiest days when it comes to car repair.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about Ecuadorian businesses and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy spark plugs, filters, spare electronic parts, and motor oil

loans.name: Eldaniz

texts.en: Eldaniz is the resident of Beylagan town. in 2002 he applied to Normicro Beylagan branch, borrowed $300, rented a car and started to work as taxi driver. Subsequently he borrowed $500 and $800, expanded his business and bought the rented car. Now he wants to sell the old car and buy new one.

loans.use: To buy a new vehicle

loans.name: Nuuuli

texts.en: Nuuuli is married with five children.  Her husband is a very good fisherman while she is the one who sells the catch to the villagers. The husband and wife teamwork proved to be a good business formula.  Now they are planning, with a new loan, to purchase additional fishing gear and a new canoe so that her husband's brother can join in their business.  Nuuli’s business acumen, marketing skills and prudent cash management are her major strengths.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing gear and a new canoe

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es:
Elisa A. Domínguez is married and has 2 children, Emily, who is 5 years old, and Ángel, who is 8 months. Elisa is an entrepreneurial woman. Her husband contributes economically to the household, but she likes to work—her children’s wellbeing is her motivation. She is saving for their future so that they will be able to have access to a good education. She did not have access to much education; she only studied through 6th grade because her parents weren’t able to pay for school for her and her siblings.

Today, after much hard work, Elisa is the owner of a small grocery store located in her house. Thanks to the store, she is able to combine the time she needs for caring for her children with tending to business. Thanks to a good level of demand, and the good location of the store (there are no other groceries for a radius of several blocks), she has decided to add on to the physical area of the business. To do this she needs as loan of $800.00 to complete the expansion of the store and modernize it so that she can keep up with demand and offer more products.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Elisa A. Domínguez, es casada y tiene 2 hijos, Emily de 5 años y Ángel de 8 meses. Elisa es una emprendedora nata, su marido aporta ecónomicamente en la casa pero a ella le gusta trabajar, el bienestar de sus hijos es su principal motivo; ella está ahorrando para el futuro de ellos así el día de mañana puedan acceder a una buena educación escolar, ya que ella no pudo acceder a una, solo estudio hasta el 6to. año de la educación escolar pues sus padres no podian costear los estudios de ella y sus hermanos. Hoy día, y bajo mucho esfuerzo, Elisa es dueña de una despensa ubicada en su propia casa, gracias a ello, puede combinar el tiempo de crianza de sus hijos y cuidados que necesita su bebé, con la atención del negocio. Gracias a la gran demanda y la buena ubicación de la zona en que se encuentra (ya que es el la única despensa en varias cuadras a la redeonda) Ella ha decidido ampliar su negocio por lo que necesita un crédito de $ 800 para poder realizar la obra de expasión del almacén y modernizarlo para así poder cumplir con la demanda y ofrecer más productos en su despensa.

loans.use: Expansion and remodeling of the store

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Business Description

Sra. Emilia has 40 years of experience in her industry -- from a very young age she has been involved in business. Two years ago, she decided to open a stall to sell breakfast in a market near her neighborhood with savings from money her children have given her. She works from 6:00 a.m. until 1:00 p.m.

Loan Use

Sra. Emilia would like a loan to purchase utensils for her kitchen. The ones she has been using are quite old and have lost their usefulness. She would also like to purchase some tables and chairs to provide better service to her customers.

Personal Information

Sra. Emilia is 66 years old. She is a widow and has three adult children. She lives in a very simple one-story home made of cement with her daughter who works outside the home and whom she helps with the household expenses. Doña Emilia’s wish is to make improvements, little by little, to her home. Currently, her home has a dirt floor.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Kenney Molloy, Kiva volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

La Sra. Emilia tiene 40 años de experiencia en le negocio, ella desde muy pequeña se dedicaba al comercio. Hace 2 años decidió poner un puesto de venta de desayunos en un mercado cerca del sector donde ella vive con un dinero que fue ahorrando de lo que sus hijos le daban. Ella trabaja desde las 6:00am hasta las 13:00pm.

Uso del Préstamo

La Sra. Emilia desea el crédito para comprar utensilios para cocina, ya que los que actualmente tiene ya terminaron su tiempo de vida útil. Ella además quiere comprar un juego de mesas y sillas para darles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Información Personal

La Sra. Emilia tiene 66 años de edad, es viuda y tiene 3 hijos todos mayores de edad. Su casa propia y es de cemento de 1 piso y muy sencilla. Ella actualmente vive con una hija que trabaja y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar. El anhelo de doña Emilia es ir mejorando poco a poco su vivienda ya que el piso es de tierra.

loans.use: Purchase new utensils, tables and chairs.

loans.name: Yony

texts.es:
Yony is a selfless father of 4 who, with the support of his young 23-year-old wife, was able to convert a small rented room into his workshop. Thanks to his inherent talent for making beautiful and elegant handicrafts, he has become one of the most sought-after and recognized artisans in his city. After experiencing great economic difficulties, this young couple found a way to work and earn a living in order to get ahead and offer a better life for their chidren. Yony now wants to purchase an embroidery machine and enough raw material to be able to produce his craftwork and satisfy the great demand for his products. This is why he is asking for $200 to be able to invest in his business and continue to do what he loves. Yony promises to repay the loan within 6 months time. "Let's help make this young father's dreams come true and help him continue to improve develop his talent."

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Yony, es un abnegado padre de familia de 4 niños, con el apoyo de su joven esposa de 23 años, pudo implementar artesanalmente su centro de trabajo en su pequeña habitación alquilada, gracias al talento inherente que posee en la elaboración de sus elegantes y hermosos trabajos hizo que se convierta en uno de los artesanos más cotizados y reconocidos de su ciudad.Esta Joven pareja después de tener grandes problemas económicos encontró la manera de trabajar y ganarse la vida para salir adelante y brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus niños.El deseo que tiene Yony es adquirir una máquina de bordados y suficiente materia prima para poder realizar sus trabajos, así cumplir con la gran cantidad de pedidos que tiene, para esto esta solicitando un préstamo de 200 dólares dinero que lo invertirá en su trabajo y le permitirá cumplir con su anhelo; Yony promete devolver el préstamo en un lapso de 6 meses. “Ayudemos a hacer realidad los sueños de este joven padre y a crecer con su talento”

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine and raw material.

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Mrs. Long M., age 37, works on her plot of land raising pigs, earning around $1 per day. Her husband is a fisherman and also works growing cucumbers, making around $2 each day. They have two children who are students. She would like to request a loan of $500 in order to purchase a water pump to draw water from their well to more efficiently water their crops. This will allow them to make more productive use of their land and earn extra income from selling the crops in the market.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump for farming.

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Lê Thị Kiều is 34 years old. She and her husband live in Kim Động, Hưng Yên. They have 2 sons who are attending school. They are woodworkers for the last 5 years. This type of work is popular in the town where they live. They needed capital to buy wood so Ms Kiều has joined TYM fund. Their loan was well invested as it yielded increasing profit as the production increases. They work full time in their shop, they also have 2 employees helping them. Their income is about 125 USD a month. This time she's requesting a loan of 625 USD to stock up on wood thus increase the production.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Lê Thị Kiều năm nay 34 tuổi sống cùng chồng tại Kim Động, Hưng Yên. Anh chị có 2 người con trai, đều trong độ tuổi đến trường. Gia đình chị làm nghề mộc từ 5 năm nay. Đây là một nghề phổ biến tại vùng nơi gia đình chị Kiều sinh sống. Nghề này đòi hỏi phải có vốn mua gỗ nên chị đã tham gia quỹ TYM. Với vốn vay của quỹ công việc sản xuất kinh doanh của chị Kiều ngày càng thuận lợi. Ngoài lao động chính là 2 vợ chồng, gia đình chị còn thuê thêm 2 nhân công phụ để phụ giúp trong công việc này. Thu nhập bình quân từ nghề mộc là 125USD/tháng. Vòng vốn này chị tiếp tục xin vay 625USD để có thể mua được nhiều gỗ phục vụ cho việc làm nghề mộc tại gia đình.

loans.use: Buy wood

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Upon the onset of her mother’s spinal related illness seven years ago, Margarita decided to start a business in her home that would allow her to care for her mother and still help her husband with family finances. This is how she came to open a small store.

At first she sold only jello, fruit-flavored ice-cream, popcorn, soft drinks, and beer; however, thanks to the financing provided through EDAPROSPO, she was able to expand her business two years ago. She is steadily buying more products.

If she is given the opportunity, Margarita would like to convert the first floor of her house into a mini-market.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Al enfermar su madre de la columna, hace 7 años, Margarita pensó poner en su casa un negocio que le permitiera cuidarla y además ayudar a su esposo con la economía familiar; fue así como abrió una pequeña tienda. Al comienzo solo vendía gelatinas, helados de fruta, palomitas de maíz, gaseosas y cerveza; pero gracias al financiamiento de EDAPROSPO hace dos años pudo ampliar su negocio, comprando cada vez más productos. De tener la oportunidad, a Margarita le gustaría convertir el primer piso de su casa en un mini mercado.

loans.use: To convert the first floor of her house into a mini-market

loans.name: Roman

texts.es:
Roman is 47 years old, and has a stable job at a milk processing plant. Additionally he is dedicated to the intermediary sale of cattle between ranchers and third party clients. Other work that he does to parallel his cattle trade is to rent out a light and sound system for special social events. Meanwhile, his wife works as a seamstress out of their home. Their family is made up of 5 people, him, his wife, and 3 children 16, 13, and 9. The couple has more than 21 years experience in their various activities, and as such the competition does affect them in any particular way. The prices they get for their goods are defined by the market (supply and demand) They have a very good credit history.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

Roman es un señor de 47 años de edad, actualmente trabaja como empleado fijo de la Empresa de Lacteos PIL (Warnes), adicionalmente se dedica al comercio de ganado vacuno como intermediario entre ganaderos y terceros comerciantes. Paralelamente cuenta con un sistema de luces y sonido que alquila en s zona para distintos eventos sociales, por otra parte su esposa cuenta con un taller de costura ubicado en su domicilio. Su familia está compuesta por 5 personas, él su esposa y sus tres hijos de 16, 13 y 9 años respectivamente. La pareja tiene más de 21 años de experiencia en sus variadas actividades, por lo que la compencia si bien es media no les afecta de manera particular. Los precios con los que se manejan básicamente son definidos por los del mercado (oferta y demanda). Tiene muy buenos antecedentes crediticios.

loans.use: Capital for work

loans.name: Gladys Soledad

texts.es:
Señora Gladys Soledad H. L. is 40 years of age and has completed her studies to the second year of secondary school. She has three children but only one depends on her for support. She lives in the El Cortijo sector of the province of Trujillo in the La Libertad department – Peru.

Through a friend she came to join the “New Peru” Communal Bank where she obtained her first loan of 300 soles, which she invested in buying a bag of potatoes, flour and oil. By that time she had started her business with the sale of stuffed potatoes, cachangas (large mashed potato croquettes filled with a spicy ground beef and pepper filling) and breakfasts.

At present she sells in the El Cortijo zonal market. She offers breakfasts and lunches. Señora Gladys enjoys her work because she has liked to cook since she was very small.

With the loan of 500 soles, that will be repaid in four months, she will buy a bag of rice, sugar, a box of oil and other ingredients that she needs for the different dishes that she prepares.

Her greater dream is to finish building her house and add to it a large restaurant or a grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Gladys Soledad H. L. tiene 40 años de edad, estudio hasta el segundo año de secundaria. Tiene tres hijos pero solo uno aun depende de ella. Vive en el sector El Cortijo en la provincia de Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad – Perú.

Por medio de una amiga se pudo integrar al Banco Comunal “Nuevo Perú” en el que obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 dinero que lo invirtió comprando un saco de papa, harina y aceite. Por ese tiempo había iniciado su negocio con la venta de papa rellena, cachanga y desayunos.

Actualmente vende en el mercado zonal El Cortijo; ofrece desayunos y almuerzos. La señora Gladys gusta mucho de su trabajo ya que desde muy pequeña le gustó cocinar.

Con el préstamo de S/. 500.00 que lo cancelara en cuatro meses comprará un saco de arroz, azúcar, una caja de aceite y otros ingredientes que hacen falta para los diferentes potajes que prepara.

Su mayor sueño es terminar de construir su casa para allí ambientar un gran restaurante o una tienda de abarrotes.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil and other ingredients that she needs for the different dishes that she prepares.

loans.name: Ivonne Del Socorro

texts.es:
Ivonne began her business thanks to the need to help with household expenses. She sells clothes and make-up. She is married and aged 27: her husband is a cabinet-maker and they live in suburb 380. They have two sons, one aged 3 and one aged 7. She wants to invest the loan in a wall in order to ensure her family’s security and that of her business, so that in the future she will be able to increase sales.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Ivonne comenzó su negocio debido a la necesidad de ayudar a los gastos del hogar. Ella vende ropa y cosmético. Es casada tiene 27 años de edad su esposo es ebanista y habitan en el barrio 380, tienen dos hijos varones uno de 3 y 7 años de edad El préstamo lo quiere invertir en un muro y obtener mayor seguridad para su familia y su negocio que a futuro espera incrementar sus ventas.

loans.use: Building a perimeter wall to secure her house

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Flor belongs to the Communal Bank “Las Mercedes,” and she sells veterinary supplies in her store located in the Carhuaz district and province of Ancash state.

With the S/.1,000.00 nuevos soles loan, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy 3 cases of vaccines, antibiotics, vitamins and dewormers.

She is 54 years old, married, and her husband supports her in this business. Her income enables her to educate their three children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Flor, pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Mercedes, tiene su veterinaria, que esta ubicado en el distrito y provincia D. Carhuaz, departamento D. Ancash. Con este prestamos D. S/. 1, 000.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará 3 cajas D. vacunas, antibióticos, vitaminas, productos para parásitos. Ella tiene 54 años D. edad es casada, su esposo la apoya en este negocio, sus ingresos le permite educar a sus 3 hijos.

loans.use: Purchase veterinary supplies to sell

loans.name: San

texts.en: San S., 22, lives in the Kampong Cham province with her husband, Mun Pheap (pictured above), and their young child. She works together with her husband in the city, making US$13 of income each day as they sell firewood. Her business, however, is in need of capital to expand their customer base. She has asked for a loan of US$1000 to purchase two cows to use for transporting her firewood from place to place. A couple of cows will make her much more mobile and allow her to travel to make sales. In the future, she would like to expand her business even further with the purchase of a car to transport the firewood. A small car for her business transportation would allow her to reach an even larger group of customers.

loans.use: To purchase two cows to transport firewood

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna started the business because she always wanted to work without neglecting her house, to be an independent person and to support her husband with the expenses. For these reasons she began 6 years ago making and selling tamales in her house, selling them chiefly to her neighbors, and little by little she gained more clients thanks to the recommendations that she received.

She needs a loan of $250, that will be repaid in 3 months, to buy a pair of steam trays to increase her production and to reduce her costs. With your aid Reyna will grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Reyna inició el negocio por que siempre quiso trabajar desde sin descuidar su casa, para ser una persona independiente y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos; por lo que comenzó hace 6 años con la elaboración y venta de tamales en su casa vendiéndole principalmente a sus vecinos, y poco a poco fue logrando mas clientes gracias a las recomendaciones que recibía.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar un par de vaporearas para incrementar su producción y reducir sus costos. Con tu ayuda Reyna hará crecer su negocio.

loans.use: To buy a pair of steam trays for her tamale business.

loans.name: Wahida

texts.en:
Wahida is 25 years old. She is married and has 3 children. Her children are 2, 3, and 5 years old.

Wahida has been a juice and soft drink seller since 2007. Each day, she works from 7am to 10pm at her business. She can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Wahida now requests a loan so she can buy more soft drinks and juice to sell.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks and juice to sell

loans.name: Rosa Leila

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa Leila, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Claveles”, vive en la Región, provincia y distrito de Picota. Se dedica a la venta de golosinas y de gaseosas de diferentes sabores y marcas. Desde hace 6 años su negocio está ubicado en su propia casa en Jr. Grau s/n. Se inicia en el negocio para generar ingresos y manejar su propio capital.

Con este crédito de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en de 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de gaseosas de diferentes sabores y marcas, golosinas como galletas de diferentes marcas y sabores, chupetines y en abarrotes como  arroz, azúcar, aceite, jabón entre otros, para que los clientes encuentren lo que buscan.

Rosa es una mujer optimista y luchadora, vive con su esposo y sus hijos que la apoyan en todo momento. Su meta es ampliar el espacio de su local y surtir la mercadería.
texts.en:
Rosa Leila, who belongs to the Los Claveles community bank, lives in the Picota region. She works selling sweets and sodas of various brands and flavors. Her business has been in her house in Jr. Grau s/n for 6 years. She started the business to earn income and manage her own capital. With this loan of 1,000, which will be repaid in 6 months, will be invested in the purchase of sodas of different brands and flavors, sweets such as various cookies, lollipops and groceries such as rice, sugar, oil, ham as well as other products, so that her customers can find what they are looking for. Rosa is a hard-working and optimistic woman. She lives with her husband and children that always support her. Her goals are to increase the size of her locale and stock her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sodas, sweets and groceries (sugar, rice, oil, etc.)

loans.name: Nget

texts.en:
Mrs. Nget H. was born in 1970 and lives in Ta Skaom Village in the Takeo Province. She is a farmer and her husband, Mr. Un Voeurn, is a construction worker. They have six children, three of whom are construction workers while two are attending the local school. The youngest one is too young to work or study.

Although Mrs. Nget H.'s family members have income, they still live in an old house and in poor conditions. In order to improve their living standard, Mrs. Nget H. has decided to ask for a loan to buy timbers to build a new house for her family. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy timbers to build a new family house.

loans.name: Phan Thi

texts.vi: Chị Đãi năm nay 52 tuổi, chị đã tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1995. Vòng vốn đầu tiên chị vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Sau một thời gian tham gia Quỹ gia đình chị đã đầu tư vốn để kinh doanh hàng tạp hoá.  Hiện tại ngoài thu nhập từ buôn bán gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu nhập từ công việc thu mua phế liệu của chồng. Mức thu nhập bình quân hàng tháng của gia đình chị đạt 3 triệu đồng. Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 13 triệu để đầu tư vốn mua thêm hàng hoá phục vụ nhu cầu của bà con dịa phương.
texts.en:
Chị Đãi is 52 this year. She has participated in the TYM Fund since 1995. She put her first loan towards raising pigs. After participating in the fund for a period of time, her family invested in a general goods retail business. Currently, outside of the income from their retail business, they have an additional source of income from her husband's business of gathering and buying of scraps. The family's monthly average income is 3 million VND. For this loan cycle, she is asking to borrow 13 million VND to purchase more retail products that meet the demands of the local community.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: General Store - Retail Business

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is married and raises three daughters in the city of Kamenka. Svetlana sells food items, such as tea, coffee and fruits, in the local city market. Her vending kiosk is well known in the market as she owns big fridges with a nice selection of well preserved products. Moreover, she always offers a warm smile to all her customers. Svetlana has been in this business for 10 years.

She has benefited from receiving eight previous loans from Nadiya Ukraine. Presently, Svetlana has about 100,000 Grivnas invested in her business. Her income is about 7,000-8,000 Grivnas a month. Svetlana would like to buy more fresh fruit before the upcoming holiday season, as fruits are always a popular item during the Christmas holiday in Ukraine. Svetlana is requesting a loan of 3,000 Grivnas that she hopes to repay in two months. 

One of her long-term plans is to build her own little store. She has already purchased a land lot to start construction work.

loans.use: To purchase fresh fruit for the holiday season

loans.name: Muyinot

texts.en: Muyinot sells foodstuffs like rice, beans, plantains, etc. She has been in this business since 2002. The demands for her foodstuffs are high and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She needs the loan amount of 70,000 NGN ($500 US) to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. Muyinot is 33 years old and married with a child. She says, "Thank you to all that made this loan possible."

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Shame Paris Group

texts.en:
Razia is the group leader of Shame Paris group. They live in district 4, Kabul, Afghanistan and there are four members in this group. The total requested amount is 30,000 Afghani (USD$650) for the term of eight months and each of them would like to receive the loan for her own business.

Razia and Mah Jabin want to receive a loan for their tailoring businesses, Zia Gul wants to take a loan for her quilt sewing business, and Jamila wants to take a loan for her business of carpet weaving. They praise this process and want to thank Kiva, too.

loans.use: To improve her sewing business.

loans.name: Jhon

texts.es: Jhon tiene 24 años y vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Él se dedica a los bordados y a la atención de su pequeña tienda, la cual instalaron junto a su esposa hace medio año en su propia casa, como las ventas están con una demanda regular, le dedican mayor tiempo al   bordando de fustanes, negocio en el cual tiene muchos pedidos. Jhon aprendió a bordar de su esposa  y juntos realizan este trabajo  porque es rentable, los deseos de  Jhon es seguir adelante con esta actividad y a la vez mejorar  la mercadería de su tienda para mejorar  la entrada económica de su hogar. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y siente mucho entusiasmo por pertenecer a su banco comunal, además tiene muchos deseos de continuar adelante para el progreso de su grupo. Jhon esta solicitando un préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas para sus bordados  y en la implementación de su pequeña tienda de abarrotes para que las ventas  aumenten en la época escolar.
texts.en:
Jhon is 24 years old and lives with his wife and 2 children in his own house. He works making embroideries and tending to his small store that he started with his wife six months ago. They operate the store out of their home. Since the sales at the store are steady and not overwhelming, he dedicates most of his time to making the embroideries. He receives many orders for his embroideries. Jhon learned to embroider from his his wife and they would work together because selling the embroideries is profitable. Jhon wants to continues to move forward in life and provide for his family. He also wants to continue to improve the merchandise in his store and increase his income. This is the first time that Jhon is requesting a loan from MFP and he feels very enthusiastic about belonging to a communal bank. He is also very excited about helping his communal bank. Jhon is asking for a loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of fabrics for his embroideries and in investing in his small store so that his sales increase during the school year.

(Translated by Alex and Katey of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Materials for Embroidery

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 39-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Ibrahim has been working as a mason since 2000. Ibrahim requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work and reimburse his debts.

This is the first time that Ibrahim has requested a loan. He is special in his work because he values punctuality and good work. He decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on working on bigger projects.

loans.use: to purchase tools for his work and reimburse his debts

loans.name: Taesali

texts.en:
Taesali E. is a 44-year-old married woman with four children. She has five years of experience in the agricultural industry. She sells her crops to the general public five days per week.

Notably, she has received three previous loans from SPBD, all of which she successfully repaid. On average, her weekly net cash flow is approximately 270 Tala. SPBD loans are Taesali’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for loans from traditional banks. She is seeking this particular loan to purchase various materials for her business, and a portion of the loan will be used to improve her family's home. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To expand her business and to improve her home by purchasing materials (e.g., barded wire, fertilizers, weed-eater, spades, and a wheelbarrow for the business, and timber, kitchen zinc and cement for the home).

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami A. was born in 1974 and has 3 children, He is dedicated to the production of dairy cattle. With a lot of effort and sacrifice, he carries out this work every day for the purpose of improving the conditions of his family and bringing the daily bread to his table.

The need that Rami faces is to invest in the development of his business through the purchase of cows. In this he hopes that Ryada, with the help of Kiva, will offer him the loan to help him to do well, along with his family.

loans.use: purchase more cows

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort R. is fifty years old. She is divorced and has given birth to two sons and one daughter. According to her, all three of her children are in either junior high or senior high schools. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in the busy fishing/commercial town of Mankessim, near Cape Coast, in the Central Region of Ghana. She works very hard to provide for her family. 

Comfort is a seamstress. She makes women's wear and treks to markets to sell them. Comfort is also a trader. She procures bags of charcoal from nearby communities and sells them to retailers and food vendors in her community. She has operated this business for fourteen years and wants a loan to procure bags of charcoal in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal in bulk

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en: Mrs. Luzminda F. is a Paglaum member in good standing under PDP-LP program since August 31, 2009. Married to Juanito F. and blessed with 4 children, she's requesting her loan amounting to 16,000 pesos for the purpose of additional capital for her business, a "sari-sari store" (variety store) She wants to buy additional stock for her "sari-sari" store. Her plan for her family is to send her children through school until college and to build a new house.

loans.use: additional capital for sari-sari store

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: Ce monsieur a appris le métier de menuiserie, en 2006 il a ouvert son atelier de menuiserie qu’il a appelé « menuiserie CMPO ». Actuellement il a reçu des commandes de ses clients malheureusement il ne dispose pas des matières nécessaires pour exécuter ses commandes, il sollicite alors de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 90 planches  et 60 chevrons. Ces matières lui permettront d'exécuter ses commandes et de vite livrer ainsi il pourra gagner plus la confiance de ses clients.
texts.en:
This is a gentleman who learned the trade of carpentry. In 2006, he opened his own woodworking shop that he calls “Menuiserie CMPO”. He currently has orders from customers but unfortunately lacks the supplies necessary to fulfill them. He’s therefore requesting his first loan from WAGES to buy 90 planks and 60 rafters. These supplies will enable him to fulfill his orders and to deliver them quickly. Thus, he’ll be able to earn more trust from his customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lumber

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Anna K. from Mwanza. She is married with two children, who are 9 and 17 years old. Anna has been running a tailoring business since 2005. Her business is to make clothes for women. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by one employee. Anna currently earns about $300 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 USD in order to purchase threads and a sewing machine. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Anna thanks you for her support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase threads and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Juan Humberto

texts.es:
el sr. JUAN HUMBERTO M. Se dedica a la venta de verduras y granos de maiz y frijoles. tiene mas de 14 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, el y su esposa son los encargados de darle vida a este pequeño negocio que esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion del municipio de trojes. El Sr. M. realiza las venta de manera domiciliar, tiene tres hijos de los cuales solo una depende de ellos y es pasante de la licenciatura en enfermeria.
para la compra de granos basicos tiene que salir a comprar donde le vendan mas comodo y de esta manera ofrecerle un mejor precio a su clientela a la que atienden junto a su esposa con 
esmero y dedicaion , M. tambien se dedica a la caficultura lo que le genera otros ingresos para bienestar de su familia , El nos esta solicitando el credito para invertirlo en su negocio ya que por los momentos no cuenta con el capital de trabajo suficiente.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan Humberto M. sells vegetables, corn and beans. He and his wife started this business from the living room of their house in the city of Trojes. He has been in business for 14 years. Sr. M. sells his products by direct payment. He has three children – only the youngest is still a dependent and is currently an intern studying nursing.

In order to buy basic grains to sell, he must leave the comfort of his house in search of the best price. Together he and his wife attend to their customers with great care and dedication. Sr. M. also grows coffee beans, which generates additional income to maintain his family’s well-being. He is requesting a loan to invest in his business because, at the moment, he does not have sufficient capital.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables, corn & beans

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora T. (10700003089) is a 29-year-old woman who lives in the town of Apia.  She is married and has 2 young children.  To make a living, Nora sells daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste, in the local community.  Nora has just started this business and earns approximately 500 WST a month from these activities.

Nora joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Nora has successfully repaid a previous loan from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  Nora is now requesting a new loan of 2750 WST which will be used to purchase new items to expand product her offering.  This will be Nora's 4th loan from SPBD.  Nora plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: To purchase new items

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic N. and her family live in the simple village of Barangay in San Isidro Paredes of Diffun, Quirino province where she  maintains her mushroom production business situated in their backyard. She is now making an income from the mushrooms and, according to her, it is a good business if maintained and managed well. Her income in the said business also supports the education of her two children. Her husband Romeo also works very hard for them to overcome the prevailing economic crisis.  

Marivic is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 from Kiva lenders. She will utilize the loan for maintaining her mushrooms. She hopes that lenders will grant her request for the continuous improvement of her enterprise.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es:
Benjamín tiene un equipo de amplificación y este equipo le sirve para poder ofrecer sus servicios en eventos de Fiestas como ser: matrimonio, cumpleaños, prestes y otros eventos.
Vive en la zona de miraflores de la Ciudad de La Paz, en casa propia
El crédito será destinado para capital de inversión ( compra de un amplificador)
Es la séptima vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente bueno en el pago de sus cuotas con este crédito tendrá la oportunidad de mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Benjamín owns sound amplification equipment and offers his services with this equipment at festive occasions such as weddings, birthdays, “prestes”, and other events. He lives in his own house in the Miraflores neighborhood in the city of La Paz. This loan will be used as investment capital (specifically, to purchase an amplifier). This is the seventh time that Benjamín has requested a loan from Kiva partner Impro. His record rates him as a good customer with a good history of making his payments. With this loan Benjamín will have the opportunity to improve his income.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing an amplifier

loans.name: Dalia

texts.es:
Dalia tiene 35 años, es una mujer muy emprendedora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus dos hijos, quienes son su razón de vivir y a quienes trata de brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Su puesto está ubicado en una de las galerías más concurridas de la localidad donde vive, allí vende ropa y vestidos de gala para los diversos eventos sociales y ahora que estamos a puertas de terminar el año la demanda se incrementa, debido a las fiestas de graduación y celebraciones por fin de año, para lo cual se viene preparando. Lo que más le gusta a Dalia de su trabajo es embellecer a las personas con los vestidos de noche, pues son los más elegantes y para complementar su trabajo, también maquilla a sus clientas como una estrategia para captar clientela. Para el futuro, Dalia desea ampliar su negocio, pues su interés es abrir un salón de belleza, por lo que está perfeccionando sus conocimientos con cursos de especialización en cosmetología.
Este es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y sabe que con responsabilidad en sus pagos tendrá acceso a seguir solicitando futuros créditos. Con los tres mil soles que ahora requiere podrá adquirir algunas máquinas para instalar su centro de belleza.

loans.use: Compra de máquinas para su nuevo negocio

loans.name: Hegenio

texts.en: Hegenio C. is from the village of Lacapp, Acad Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. He is 40 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Hegenio owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Hegenio joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Hegenio is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding his business. This loan will be his second from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding his business

location.town: Lacapp, Acad Aurora, Zamboanga del sur

loans.name: Enith

texts.es:
Enith es una madre de familia de 40 años de edad que tiene 5 hijos, vive junto a su esposo y  sus dos últimos hijos de 18 y 12 años en casa de un familiar. Se ubica en la ciudad de Lambayeque, a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella se dedica a la confección de disfraces. Nos comenta que la idea nació cuando sus hijos estaban pequeños y empezaron a estudiar: ella confeccionaba sus disfraces por sí sola y los padres de sus compañeros de clase. Ellos le decían que estaban muy bonitos y luego le empezaron a pedir que confeccionara algunos para sus hijos. Desde ese entonces ha estado trabajando. Ahora se dedica a confeccionar nuevos disfraces en base a pedidos y a alquilar los que ya tiene guardados.

Durante el tiempo en que ha estado trabajando ha  invertido sus ganancias en la compra de más material. Por lo tanto ahora su pequeño taller está abarrotado de disfraces y no puede mostrarlos a sus clientes. Por este motivo está solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de vitrinas o mostradores. Los cuales harán que sus diseños tengan mejor vista. También piensa invertir en la compra de material para seguir confeccionando disfraces.

Ella es una mujer alegre, dinámica y trabajadora. Su sueño es seguir adelante con su negocio. Enith es optimista y le gusta mucho su trabajo. Cada vez que diseña sus disfraces lo hace con la mayor pasíon y entrega posibles.
texts.en:
Enith is a 40 year old housewife who has 5 children. She lives with her husband and her two youngest children, ages 18 and 12, in a relative’s house. She lives in the city of Lambayeque, 15 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She is engaged in the making of costumes. She tells us that the idea was born when her children were small and began going to school: she used to make costumes on her own for her children and the parents of their classmates. The parents told her that they were very beautiful, and then they began to ask that she make some for their children. Ever since then she has been working. Now she is involved in making new costumes on the basis of orders and to rent out those that she keeps.

During the time she has been working, she has invested her profits in the purchase of more material. As a consequence, her little workshop is crammed with costumes, and she is not able to show them all to her customers. For this reason, she is applying for the first time to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 new soles that she plans to invest in the purchase of counters or display cases. This will mean that her designs will be more easily seen. She also plans to invest in material for continuing to make costumes.

She is a cheerful, dynamic, and hardworking woman. Her dream is to get ahead in her business. Enith is an optimist and likes her work a lot. Every time she designs a costume she makes it with the greatest passion and delivers the best possible product.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of material and showcases for her business

loans.name: Bertha Aurora

texts.es:
La señora Bertha, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de la Colina II”, Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 34 años y es madre de 03 hijos, los 03 que aun dependen de ella.

Bertha, lleva 10 años dedicándose a la confección de vestidos, ya que teniendo conocimiento en este tipo de actividad, no dudo en implementar su propio taller de costura, ubicada en su misma casa, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, donde diariamente atiende a sus clientes fijos, que ya la conocen y necesitan el servicio. Bertha, trabaja con pedidos que con anticipación sus clientes le solicitan y siempre regalando una sonrisa y con amabilidad sus clientes se sienten muy contentos y satisfechos. En la actualidad Bertha esta muy contenta y orgullosa por lo logrado. Muy a parte, también se traslada a diferentes pueblos aledaños, a ofrecer sus vestidos, que ella misma confecciona.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,700.00, comprará telas en metros, de diferentes especies y colores, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, hilos en carretes grande y de variados colores, agujas de coser y de maquina, alfileres, botones. 

Hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Bertha, 34, is a member of the “Mujeres de la Colina II” communal bank, which is in the Banda de Shilcayo district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She lives with her partner and has three children, all of whom still are dependent on her. For the past 10 years, Bertha has been a seamstress. Having these skills, she didn't hesitate to set up her own sewing workshop in her home. It is a very well-equipped environment where she tends to her regular customers on a daily basis since she is well known and they require her services. Bertha works based on advance orders placed by her customers and, thanks to the ever-present smile and kindness they get from her, they feel happy and satisfied. Currently, Bertha is very happy and proud of what she has accomplished. And, on another point, she also travels to neighborhing towns to sell her dresses which she herself has made. With the 1,700 sol loan she plans to buy meters of fabric in various colors and kinds, tools she uses, like scissors, large spools of thread in various colors, sewing needles (both hand and machine), pins and buttons. Today, she feels very fulfilled, with stronger desire to reach and make her other dreams come true. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business and also to many women who want to grow as businesswomen.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing materials.

loans.name: Dorjhand

texts.en:
Dorjhand S. is 37 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a house in Bayanzurkh district in Ulaanbaatar, the largest city and capital of Mongolia. Her son and daughter both attend a local secondary school. Dorjhand operates a construction materials business with the help of her husband in their district. She started selling construction materials in 2007 and has quickly found success with her new business. She has gained much experience as a businesswoman and has built a good reputation among both her customers and suppliers. The business is very important for her family and has provided them with financial security. She says, "With my business earnings I can support my children's education and I am happy for that."

S. is optimistic about the future and hopes to soon expand her business, her dream being to own her own workplace in the future. She is requesting a 3,500,000 tugrug (~2500 USD) loan to purchase construction materials for her business and to remodel her house.

About XacBank XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here:http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&queryString=Mongolia&status=fundRaising&gender=All§ors[]=All®ions[]=All&sortBy=Expiring+Soon

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for her business and to remodel her house

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine T. is from the village of Tungawan, Tambulig, Zambo.Sur. She is 55 years old. Josephine is widowed and has four adult children. To make a living, Josephine owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily-use products and snacks in the local community. Josephine has been engaged in her business for more than eight years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Josephine joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Josephine from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Noin

texts.en: Two people are shown in the picture above: Mrs. S. and her husband at their house. To earn a living, the family has cultivated rice, raised many pigs and climbed palm trees, and they can make US$7 a day from their enterprises. Mrs. S. now has five teenage children, all five of whom are farming rice or going to school. Mrs. S. lacks money and is asking for capital to purchase more piglets to raise.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets to raise

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.en: Bernardo L. is from the village of Bayabo East, Tumauini, Isabela. He is 48 years old, is married, and has three adult children. He owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Bernardo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This loan will be his sixth from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy food to sell to her customers

loans.name: Mrs. Pha Yeom Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Pha Y. owns a general store in her village. She is a widow without children. No matter how hard she tries to work, she cannot earn enough income. In order to improve her living conditions, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to sell in order to expand her business. 

This village bank includes 11 people who all live in Thmei village in Kandal province. Mrs. Pha Y. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. They will use their loan for different purposes.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for re-selling

loans.name: Busajja Bwakuba Alice Wabwire Group

texts.en: Alice W. is a businesswoman of thirty years of age; she is married with six children of whom five are going to school. She has a restaurant and she has been operating this business for over three years. She is using the loan to purchase a variety of food (bananas, cassava, Irish potatoes, rice, chicken, beef, and so forth) and other items for the restaurant. She is a hard-working businesswoman who is looking forward to employing other people for the expansion of her restaurant business. Her dream is to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of food (bananas, cassava, Irish potatoes, etc.) and other items for the restaurant

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann sells tubers of yam at retail prices to make a living in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. Yam is a staple food in Nigeria. She has been in this business for a very long time. She is 49 years old and married with 5 children. Her husband also works to support their home. She is a friendly and happy woman. She has requested a loan of NGN 120,000 to purchase more tubers of yam to sell. She loves her business and family dearly and she hopes to excel in life. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tubers of yam to sell

loans.name: Mohomad Arus

texts.en:
Mohomad Arus is a 49-year-old married woman living with her husband and four children.  She is hard-working and she wants to be independent.

She has an agricultural business in which she raises some poultry as well as some other animals.  Mohomad started this business last year.  Her husband and children help her to maintain it in a profitable way.  Now she has more experience with the business and hopes to expand, with the help of this loan.

Mohomad has requested a 15,000 LKR loan form BRAC. She hopes to provide a nutritious diet for her family and to pay her children's tuition through the earnings of this business.

loans.use: For her agricultural business

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
El señor Fernando E. ya ha tenido tres créditos con FVP los cuales ha pagado puntualmente. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder impermeabilizar el techo de su casa ya que esta en muy mal estado y teme que les pueda pasar algo a su familia en la época de lluvia. 
Solicita su cooperación para este crédito ya que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para comprar el material, ya que el se encargara de la mejora en horario adicional a su trabajo.
Planea pagar el préstamo con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo como coordinador de una compañía de trasportes. 
Desea que la casa donde vive su familia este en buen estado y que no tenga ningún problema para su salud. 
La persona que aparece en la foto es la señora Verónica Mejia esposa del señor Fernando E., el no estaba en su casa el día de la visita y quien nos atendió fue su esposa.
texts.en:
Mr. Fernando E. has had three loans with FVP, all of which he has repaid on time. He is requesting a loan to be able to put a seal on the roof of his home. It is in bad shape and he fears that something might happen to his family during the rainy season. He is asking for your support for this loan for he does not have the money needed to buy materials. He will do the repairs himself during the time that he is off from his work. He plans to repay the loan with the money that he makes at his job as coordinator for a transportation company. He wants the house where his family lives to be in good condition and not cause problems to their health. The person in the photo is Mrs. Verónica Mejia, the wife of Mr. Fernando E.. He was not at home the day of our visit and she is the one that took care of us.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sealing of a roof.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 57 years old. She is married to a retired civil servant and they are blessed with 6 children. She is a native of Bini and most people in her community call her nurse. She has been in business since 1986. 

Elizabeth needs the loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. She says thank to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Djibril

texts.fr:
Monsieur Djibril C.  est un homme marié de 29ans qui est polygame. Il vit   avec ses épouses et ses deux  enfants à Mena,  un des villages de la Préfecture de Kolondièba dans la  troisième région (Sikasso) de la République Mali. 
Monsieur Djibril fait le commerce d’articles divers. Sa boutique  se trouve à son domicile.
Pour augmenter son capital il adhère au programme crédit de  Soro Yiriwaso avec qui, il est à son premier cycle de prêt. 
Avec ce prêt il compte acheter, dix 50kg  de sucre, un carton de cigarettes, deux cartons de thé, quelques sacs de céréales et des conserves.
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice de 60.000FCFA par mois.
Le bénéfice  servira à payer de la nourriture et sera investi dans l’entreprise.
texts.en:
Mr. Djibril C., 29, is married and polygamous. He lives with his spouses and his two children in Mena, one of the villages of the prefecture of Kolondièba in the third administrative region (Sikasso) of the Republic of Mali. Mr. Djibril sells various items, and his shop is located in his house. To grow his working capital, he joined the credit program of Soro Yiriwaso, with whom he is on his first loan. With this loan, he intends to buy 50 kg of sugar, a carton of cigarettes, 2 cartons of tea, several sacks of cereals, and some tinned goods. He expects to make a profit of 60,000 F CFA each month. His profit will be used to pay for food for the family and invested back into the business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various items for resale

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy L. is from the village of Malasin. She is 41 years old, is married, and has six school-aged children. Mercy owns and operates a business selling fruits and vegetables in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Mercy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to have additional inventory and working capital. Mercy is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her seventh from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maoundé

texts.fr: Maoundé S. est une femme de 29 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SINTHIANG HOOULATA depuis le 26 avril 2008 et y a reçu 04 prêts qui lui ont permis de développer une activité de petit commerce de savon et des détergents pour la lessive. Avec son nouveau crédit elle pourra renforcer son capital d'investissement et acheter plus de savons d'eau de javel et d'autres détergents. Elle achète la marchandise en gros et le revend au détail dans son quartier. Les bénéfices que génère son activité lui permettent de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille et à assurer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Maoundé S. is a 29-year-old married woman with four children in her care. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Sinthiang Hooulata since April 26, 2008, and has received four loans which have allowed her to develop a small business selling soap and laundry detergents. With her new credit she will have more capital to invest and will be able to buy more bleach, soaps and other detergents. She buys the products in bulk and re-sells them on a retail basis in her neighborhood. The profits from her business allow her to help improve living conditions for her family and ensure that her children can attend school.

Translated from French by Rachel Braff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase investment capital

loans.name: José Anibal

texts.es:
El Sr. José es de la Ciudad de Carapeguá, barrio Santo Domingo, está casado con la Sra. Ramona, y juntos tienen 2 hijos.

Hace varios años que trabajan juntos haciendo ricas comidas y vendiendo, son muy conocidas en la zona por su buen trabajo.

Realizan pedidos de empanadas, tortas, sopas y otros tipos de menú, de esta forma el Sr. José comenta que siempre se sacrificó trabajando y así poder solventar los gastos de la familia.

Solicitó el crédito para la compra de ingredientes como harina, carne, aceites y otros.
texts.en:
Sr. José is from the neighborhood of Santo Domingo in the city of Carapeguá. He is married to Sra. Ramona and together they have two children.

For several years he and his wife have worked together preparing and selling flavorful foods. They are well-known in the area for their good work.

They fulfill orders for turnovers, sandwiches, soups, and other menu items. Sr. José says he has always worked and sacrificed in order to cover the family expenses. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy ingredients such as flour, meat, oil, and other products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour, meat, oil, and other products

loans.name: Marina Landrine

texts.fr:
femme de 30ans, celibataire et mère de 2 enfants dont l'age vari de 7ans à 5ans tous scolarisé, ayant 2 personnes à charges.ayant un niveau scolaire secondaire, elle debute son commerce comme gerante dans une boutique en 2000 et se lança dans la vente de friperie en 2005. sa recette journalière varie de 7000frs)à 20000frs .

elle veut renforcer son activité avec ce prêt en achetant des balons de t-chirt,de serviette,de gean's .
sa strategie est de mieux sa marchandise afin de satisfaire ses clients, avoir un bon étallage.

elle veut être grossiste dans les jours futur afin de mieux améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille, aider ses enfants à prosperer dans les études.dans son quartier elle est l'exemple des femmes ambitieuses à encourager.
texts.en:
Marina Landrine N. N. is 30 years old, unmarried and the mother of two children whose ages range from 5 to 7 years. Both of the children are in school and in her care. With a middle school education, she started in business in 2000 as a manager in a shop and went into secondhand clothing sales in 2005. Her daily revenue ranges from 7,000 to 20,000 francs. She wants to expand her business with this loan by purchasing bundles of t-shirts, towels and jeans. Her strategy is to have better merchandise in order to satisfy her customers and to have a good display. She wants to be a wholesaler in the future so as to better improve the living conditions of her family and to help her children prosper in their studies. In her neighborhood she is a model of an ambitious woman to encourage.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bundles of shirts, towels and t-shirts

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret N. is 21 years-old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala East region of Uganda.  She is married and has three children.  Two of her children are currently in school.  For the last four years, Margret has had a business of a beauty salon.         

To help expand her business, Margret has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase to buy more oil and braids for hair.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Margret hopes to generate greater profits and to buy food for her family.  In the future, Margret hopes to educate her children through to university.             

Note to lenders: 

BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.  This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan.  Initially, the ELA program provides disadvantaged adolescents, in particular girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills.  Afterwards, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses.  These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age, improve their prospects for the future and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance.  Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, and in giving Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: To buy more oil and braids for the hair.

loans.name: Mateo Amangandi

texts.es:
Mateo Amangandi S. tiene 61 anos. Es casado y vive en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia Bolívar de Ecuador. Tiene 6 hijos. 

Mateo es socio de la ventanilla rural Gradas Chico, que está ubicada a quince minutos en carro de la ciudad de Guaranda. Son 20 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz, trigo, papas, y la cría de animales.  Este es el tercer préstamo que sacan con la cooperativa.

A Mateo se dedica a la agricultura. Tiene cultivos de maíz, trigo, cevada, y papas. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en el mercado de Guaranda cada semana. 

Solicita el credito para invertir en una tienda general. Con el apoyo del préstamo le permitiria comprar un tanque de gas, arroz, y otras cosas para su tienda con el objetivo de tener mejor ganancia. Su sueno para los proximos 5 anos es aumentar mas la tienda, hacerlo mas grande, y para mantener la familia económicamente. Se desafia por la falta de dinero para aumentar su negocio. 

Los domingos le gusta ir a la iglesia y escuchar la palabra de Dios.
texts.en:
Mateo Amangandi S. is 61 years old. He is married and lives in the canton of Guaranda , part of the Bolivar province in Ecuador. He has six children. Mateo is member of the Gradas Chico rural bank, which is located 15 minutes by car from the city of Guaranda. There are 20 members in total, who for the most part dedicate themselves to growing corn, wheat, potatoes and the breeding of animals. This is the third loan taken out with the cooperative. Mateo devotes himself to farming. He grows corn, wheat, barley and potatoes. He gets his supplies and sells his products at the weekly market in Guaranda. He is requesting the loan to invest in a general store. Support from the loan will enable him to buy a tank of gas, rice and other items for his store in order to make better profit. His dream for the coming five years is to develop his commerce, expand the store, and provide financial support to his family. He is challenged by the lack of funds to develop his commerce. On Sundays he likes to go to church and listen to the word of God.

Translated from Spanish by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy items for his general store

loans.name: Josette

texts.en:
Josette A. is a 52-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures:   furniture-making, farming, and hog raising businesses. She lives in Tuod, Brgy.Isio, Cauayan, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts.

 By working hard in her   three  businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 20,000 PHP. Josette is now borrowing  15,000 PHP so that she  can purchase  materials for her furniture-making business.  This will be her 5th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 10,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. 

Josette aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials for her furniture-making business

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia, de 38 años, es una mujer luchadora y alegre, es madre soltera y a pesar de los constantes problemas que afronta está orgullosa de su hija María de 14 años; ambas viven en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Patay. Desde muy temprano se levanta para poder preparar sus alimentos y enviar a estudiar a su hija, y a las 8 de la mañana se dirige a cuidar y limpiar sus sembríos hasta altas horas de la noche, como dice: “hasta que el cuerpo resista “. Ya que son 28 años que ella se dedica a la siembra de papa (tubérculo peruano), arveja y flores de gladiolos. Como toda una mujer de negocios Sonia también abrió una pequeña tienda, donde vende productos de primera necesidad.  Más delante desea incrementar sus ventas; con la compra de más semillas y sembrar en mayores cantidades; para poder venderlo a un mejor precio y darle una excelente calidad de vida a su hija, que es el motor de su progreso y trabajo. Es el octavo crédito con MFP y está sumamente agradecida por la seguridad que le brinda su banco comunal. Con el crédito que solicita,  lo invertirá en la compra de semillas de gladiolos, ya que es la temporada donde hay mayor demanda, asimismo desea surtir su pequeño negocio con la compra de productos novedosos.
texts.en: Sonia is a happy and resourceful woman of 38 years of age. She is a single mother and even with the constant problems she has to face she is proud of her 14 year –old daughter María. They both live in a house they own located in the town of Patay. She gets up very early to prepare her meals and to send her daughter tor school; at 8 in the morning she goes tacking care of her sown fields until very late at night or, as she herself says “until the body resists”. She has been engaging in planting potatoes (Peruvian tuber), peas and gladioli for 28 years. Being a real businesswoman, Sonia has also opened a small shop were she sell basic necessities. In the future she wishes to increase her sales by buying more seeds and cropping more products, in order to sell them at a better price and give an excellent quality of life to her daughter, the real engine behind her progress and her work. This is her eight loan with MFP, and she is extremely thankful to the security offered by her communal bank. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy gladiolus seeds, as this is the season with the highest demand; she also wants to supply her small ship by buying new products.

loans.use: To buy gladiolus seeds.

loans.name: Faithful Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you the members of the “Faithful” group from Makeni. They are small-scale businesswomen who are based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 1,200,000 for each of them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Ramatu K.. Ramatu is 30 years old and was born in Bombali district. She is married to a businessman and they have two children.
