Ramatu sells palm oil (the country’s favorite cooking oil). She has been running this business for many years now. She will use her share of this loan to buy gallons of palm oil to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy gallons of palm oil to add to her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in his business

loans.name: Sopiah

texts.en: Sopiah D. cooks food and travels around Elmina to sell it. She also sells cosmetics. She is married and has six dependants. Her husband is a security man. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more foodstuffs to cook for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to put up a stall where she can sell her food.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to cook for sale

loans.name: Tumalel Ole

texts.en:
Tumalel Ole P. is 30 years old, married to Margaret Setek and a father of five children aged between two to ten years old. Tumalel is a wheat farmer in Narok area and this has been his livelihood for the last five years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for wheat farming.

He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his first loan which he is planning to use to prepare his thirteen acres of land for wheat planting in the next planting season. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to increase his wheat production.

His hope and dream is to become a large scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land. He is a hardworking man and with the right resources he can do great things.

loans.use: to prepare his thirteen acres of land for wheat farming

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: K. Kate is an individual client from Rukungiri. She is 52 years old, very strong and hard-working with an agricultural business where she grows bananas in her banana plantation for sale. She is a salary earner and she has been in the agricultural business for 4 years. Kate is also involved in the sale of milk from her home in Kyagera cell. She works with her children since she is a widow and wants the best for all four of her children. Kate needs a loan to be able to improve her banana plantation by buying manure and fertilizers.

loans.use: Improving her banana plantation by buying manure and fertilizers

loans.name: Roberta

texts.es:
Roberta es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Huancheñas”  del distrito Huancané,  provincia de Huancané y departamento de Puno, tiene 50 años, de estado civil casada tiene 05 hijos (01 dependiente), estudio hasta 5º de educación primaria.

Trabaja hace  02 años con  el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos, su  primer préstamo  fue de S/. 500.00, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de animales como vacas, ovejas y chanchos.

Solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, con este dinero comprará un torete y verduras.
La señora también vende comidas en las ferias y realiza tejidos como frazadas.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia en Juliaca.

Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las capacitaciones y las orientaciones
texts.en:
Roberta, 50, is a member of the “Las Huancheñas” communal bank in Huancané district, Huancané province, Puno department.  She is married and has 5 children, one still dependent on her.  She studied up to fifth grade in elementary school.

She has collaborated with the Manuela Ramos Movement for two years.  Her first, 500 sol loan, was money she used in her cattle, sheep and pig raising business.

She will ask for a new, 1500 new sol, loan to buy a bullock and vegetables.

She also sells meals at the local markets and weaves articles like blankets.

Her dream is to have her own house in Juliaca.

What she likes about the communal bank is the training sessions.

loans.use: To buy a bullock and vegetables.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 37-year-old single man from Qana. He has owned a mobile phone shop since 2005, with 8 years of experience in this field. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, for the fourth time, in order to buy extra mobile recharge cards to improve his income. The previously requested loans had a good impact on his business, and he hopes for the same with this loan.

Hasan is doing well in his business. Since his major education was in electronics maintenance, he specializes in doing mobile phone maintenance, in addition to selling the phones. This gives him an important advantage among competitors, who use his help in doing the necessary maintenance on their clients' mobile phones. Hasan hopes to open a larger shop, which he plans to divide into two sectors: one specialized in mobile selling and the other in maintenance.

loans.use: to buy extra mobile recharge cards

loans.name: Ma. Vilma

texts.en:
Ma. Vilma A. is from the village of San Pedro. She is 44 years old. Ma.Vilma is married and has four school aged children. To make a living, she raises pigs in her backyard. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $139 a month for these activities.

In 2006, Ma.Vilma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC.

She is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase piglets and feeds. This will be her 9th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed for them

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva is currently in the business of selling maize and sorghum. She is 30 years old, a widow, with three children, and two of them go to school. Eva requested a loan to stock more bags of maize and sorghum. With extra profits from her business, Eva hopes to pay her children's school fees in the future.

loans.use: stock more bags of maize and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Maritza Alejandra

texts.es:
Maritza Mejía de 34 años, es madre soltera. Trabaja hace 3 años atras en el mercado municipal con un puesto de comercio de pescado y marisco. Labora de lunes a domingos de 7 hasta las 3 de la tarde. Tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad y labora con ella en el trabajo. 
 
Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso ahora quiere con el préstamo  va a comprar pescado, concha y camarón. Unos de sueños es poder comprar un terreno para hacer su casa ya que alquila.
texts.en:
Maritza Mejía, 34, is a single mother.  For the last three years she's been working in the back of the Municipal Market in a stand selling fish and sea food.  She works from Monday to Sunday, 7am to 3pm.  She has two adult children who work with her in the business.

She has many dreams for her business and wants to use the loan to buy fish, conch and shrimp.  One of her dreams is to buy a lot to build a house because she currently rents.

loans.use: For fish, conch and shrimp.

loans.name: Raphonsel

texts.en:
Raphonsel B. is from the village of Sta. Clara Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 33 years old. Raphonsel is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Raphonsel owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Raphonsel has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 25,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2011, Raphonsel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Raphonsel is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Raphonsel from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is married with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lydia is 43 years old.

Lydia has a souvenir shop business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock of souvenir to sell.

Lydia has been in this business for five years.  In the future, Lydia would like to expand her business and savings for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more souvenirs to sell

loans.name: Aida Nely

texts.es: Aida Nely P. G. madre soltera, vive sola, en casa propia en San Antonio del Monte en el departamento de Sonsonate, ella  realiza comercio ambulante  y vende en su casa prendas de costura que ella misma realiza; Aida es una mujer muy emprendedora y sabe cómo ganarse la vida honradamente, ella  realiza su labor en una zona muy concurrida de los cobanos y últimamente ha tenido buenas ventas y quiere abastecerse con mas mercancía para poder realizar sus prendas,  es así como se decidió a solicitar a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar telas, hilos, aguja entre otros para así poder confeccionar las prendas de vestir y salir a vender con el mejor de los ánimos, pues sus clientes la prefieren por ser novedosa con su producto. Aida tiene mucha confianza que su actividad laboral podrá seguir sosteniendo su hogar y a su familia.
texts.en: Aida Nely P. G. is a single mother who lives by herself in San Antonio del Monte, in the Sonsonate Department. She works selling clothing that she herself makes; she sells her products both in a a moving stall and from her home. Aida is an enterprising woman, and she knows how to make an honest living. She does her work in a busy area of Los Cobanos, and she has had very good sales recently; she wants to stock up on materials to be able to finish her work. For this reason, she decided to apply for a loan from INTEGRAL, which would allow her to buy fabric, thread, and needles, among other things, to be able to sew more clothing and go out to sell her wares in better spirits, because her clients prefer her for her originality. Aida is confident that her labors will be able to continue supporting her family and her home.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, and needles.

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
There are many Cambodians who make a living as rice cultivators; one of them is Mrs. Pen Y. who has been working in this sector since 2003. She and her husband grow rice on their own farmland that they inherited from their grandparents. They always use this land to grow different kinds of crops such as rice, peanuts, and sesame seeds. From this business they can generate an income of around US$ 3 per day. 

This humble couple has seven children, two of whom are employed as garment workers. This rice-growing season, the family hasn't planted any crops on their farmland yet because of lacking funds. To solve this situation, Pen Y. would like to apply for a loan as capital to buy peanuts and sesame seeds for planting. 

Note that Pen Y. and her husband appear in the picture.

loans.use: to buy peanuts and sesame seeds for planting.

loans.name: Amen Plus Group

texts.en:
Jeanine is the leader of a community bank named “Amen Plus” which is composed of 12 micro-entrepreneurs united in solidarity to obtain loans from Kiva through the microfinance institution HOPE DRC with the goal of developing their individual businesses.
 
Jeanine is 49 years old and the single mother of four children between the ages of 26 and 33. Two of her children attend school. Jeanine sells beans and rice in the northeastern area of Kinshasa. She has been in business for years and currently makes about 150 USD weekly. Jeanine is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE DRC and has successfully repaid ten previous loans. 

Jeanine will use her loan to increase her inventory of goods by purchasing sacks of beans to sell. In the future, she dreams of diversifying her business by opening a beverage facility in her store.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of beans to sell

loans.name: Tarneem

texts.en:
Tarneem is a 31-year-old housewife. She is married and has three daughters and two sons; all of her children are school students. Tarneem's husband started his job one and a half years ago, and now he is in need of a new fishing net.

Tarneem took out a loan from FATEN to purchase the net he needs. Tarneem is a conservative woman, therefore, her husband appears in the picture here instead of her.

loans.use: To pay for a fishing net.

loans.name: Liwliwa

texts.en: Liwliwa is 35 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. She earns about 60,000 PHP per crop as a farmer working in the Philippines. She grows rice and has been doing so for 10 years. Liwliwa is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farm. She dreams that someday her business will be profitable to support her children's education.

loans.use: to acquire farm inputs such as fertilizers and rice seeds

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: Pour renforcer son activité (vente de tôles, tuyaux, fils) Kodjo achète ses marchandises à SOTOTOLES (une usine spécialisée dans la vente de ses produits) et revend dans son magasin. Il a commencé en 2009. Soucieux de l’avenir de sa famille (père d’01 enfant) il veut ajouter d’autres activités à la première. Sa femme est revendeuse.
texts.en:
To strengthen his business (sale of metal sheets, pipes and wires) Kodjo purchases his products from Sototoles (a factory specializing in selling these products) and resells in his shop. He got his start in 2009.
Mindful of his family's future (he is father to one son), he wants to add other activities to the former. His wife works as a reseller.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets and pipes.

loans.name: Khurelpurev

texts.en:
Mr. Khurelpurev is 22 years old, a waiter, and lives with his mother in a house bought on a mortgage in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He is a laborious and diligent young man who is trying to improve his life and private career. 

Khurelpurev has been working as a waiter in Grand Khan Irish Pub LLC from 06.00 pm-midnight on weekdays since March 2010. Until 06.00 pm, he does a taxi business using his car which is old. Recently his old car is becoming bad and he needs to renew it immediately. This business is the main income source for him and his mother. Now he has saved up the amount of 1.500.000 MNT for buying a new taxi. 

Therefore, he needs a 2.100.000 MNT loan to renew his old car to improve his taxi service business. "If I have a new car, I will try harder and it will be a most important support to my business and our life," he said.

loans.use: To renew his old second-hand car to improve his taxi service business.

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi is a married man with four children, one of whom attends school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Hamisi has operated a greengrocery business for the past two years, selling as wholesale to retailers, neighbours and passersby. He faces the major challenge of seasonality in his business. Hamisi dreams of expanding and establishing another grocery shop in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000 loan, he wants to purchase sacks of vegetables, onions and tomatoes. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of vegetables, onions and tomatoes.

loans.name: Vania

texts.en: Vania is 32 years old and the single mother of one daughter who is one-and-a-half years old. She has just recently started a business in which she sells crafts such as dolls, mirrors, and knitted blankets and hats. She is asking for a loan in order to jump-start her business and purchase various crafts such as blankets, hats, little dolls, and ornamented mirrors. She is excited about her new business and desires for it to be very successful. Vania is committed to making all of the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy more crafts to sell such as blankets, dolls, and mirrors.

loans.name: Heremakono I Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe HEREMAKONO I sont de femmes mariées qui ont en moyenne 44 ans, ont en moyenne 5 enfants et vivent majoritairement dans des familles polygames à Nogonlon, l’un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce premier prêt, FATOUMATA, la deuxième assise à droite, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir environs 0, 75 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 70.000F CFA en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the HEREMAKONO I group are married women who have an average age of 44 and on average five children. They mostly live in polygamous families in Nogonlon, one of the villages of the rural commune of Banco, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, second administrative region of Mali. 

They collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. The crops they cultivate are, among others, rice and peanuts. They are on their first loan with Soro Yiriwaso.

With this first loan, FATOUMATA, seated second from the right, intends to buy farm inputs and small equipment, and pay the fees for plowing and weeding to maintain 0.75 hectares of rice and peanuts. 

The crops are sold at the markets of Baou, Koula, Banco and N’Golobougou, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. Fatoumata expects to make an average profit of 70,000 F CFA at the end of the crop season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, weeding, farm inputs and small equipment.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 29 years old and married to Linet. They are blessed with two children. He has been running his barber shop for the past six years, making a monthly profit of KES 10,000. He has been loaned KES 40,000, which he plans to use to purchase new shaving machines and renovate his business premise.

With the anticipated profit, he plans to educate his children. In the near future, he hopes to build his own residential house.

loans.use: to purchase new shaving machines and renovate his business premise

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia aims to improve her general store in the village, to satisfy her customers needs and to earn income.  She is a widowed 52 year old, and has four adult children. Being a single parent, it is difficult for her to send the children to college. But she tried her best to support their education until they earned a degree.  She would like to continue managing the business to earn and save for future emergencies and to support the education of her grand children. 

She is requesting an additional capital of P8,000 to buy bread, candy, junk food, beverages, noodles, canned goods and soap for sale in her general store. She works hard and believes that her loan will increase her product offerings and therefore her income. She believes that nothing is impossible for a person who has a strong faith and determination.

loans.use: to buy bread, candy, junk food, beverages, noodles, canned goods and soap  to sell in her store.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer is a determined business-lady aged 35, single, and blessed with four children who are still in school. For the last five years, she has been practicing dairy farming to earn a living. She has improved her business since she joined Faulu Kenya.  In the next five years, she wants to become successful in her business. She is requesting for a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Claudette

texts.en: Claudette is 25 years old and has a 6 year old child. She is married to a motorcycle taxi driver. Her child is in school.  She sells vegetables in the market and her business has enabled her to buy chairs to put in her sitting room. Claudette needs to start up another business in addition to the existing one.  She needs a loan in order to buy a motorcycle to earn more income . She will then use the profits to buy some land.

loans.use: to buy a motocycle.

loans.name: Ke

texts.en: Mrs. Ke is a 59-year-old widow with four lovely children. One of her children is already married and lives in a new house with her humble husband. The other three children are all single and still live with her. Currently, Mrs. Ke is a good teacher at a secondary school in the Reussey Keo commune. From this business, she is able to earn about $3 per day to cover her family’s daily expenses. She is a resident who works hard to help support her children to get a good education and a good future. What she wants is to have a better quality of life.  She now wants to repair her broken house but she is lacking some funds. Thus, she wishes to apply for a loan from HKL, a partner with Kiva. She describes herself as an easygoing, conscientious, straightforward person who pays punctually. She did not choose other stated banks or MFIs except HKL, one Kiva’s partners, because this micro-finance provides better services and long term periods for her loan. She hopes that this loan will make her family live in better conditions. Her dream in the future is to send her children to study at university and then get a good job.

loans.use: to repair her house.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu is a 55-year-old married mother of five children aged 25, 19, 13, 12 and 5, all of whom attend school. In 1999, she established a business selling dishes, bowls and other utensils and now earns about Le 1,000,000 each month by working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day.

Having already received and repaid two loans, Kadiatu is now requesting a new one in the amount of Le 4,000,000 in order to purchase a variety of dishes, bowls and bathing buckets. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000, and in the future plans to open a big shop to earn a larger income.

Hard-working, dedicated and assisted by her family, Kadiatu wants to fully educate her children for a better life. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of dishes, bowls and bathing buckets.

loans.name: 06.07.01 Đông Vệ Thanh Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs Xuân has a manufacturing business making wine. She is requesting a loan to purchase material to make wine.

Xuân is 49 years old and she is married with two children. She is the leader of a 4-member group, the 7.1 Đông Vệ solidarity group. 
Xuân lives with two dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Xuân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Xuân has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Xuân has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Xuân faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Xuân hopes to build a new house, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase material to make wine.

loans.name: Seline

texts.en:
Seline lives in the Coastal town of Changamwe, Kenya. She is married, has seven children; four are in school. Seline owns a water kiosk/selling point which has been in operation for three years. Besides this, she also operates a furniture shop. 
Seline is applying for a loan of Ksh 30,000 to buy a water tank in order to open another selling point. She is working towards owning more selling points and workshops in the future. Seline’s main challenges have been the lack of capital, pipe breakages, and lack of tanks. 
The additional income obtained from this will be used to pay school fees, renovate her house, and also save for the future.

loans.use: To buy a water tank

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Elizabeth solicita un préstamo para reparar el techo de enfrente de su casa, el que tiene actual mente esta en muy malas condiciones, con la reparación no habrá filtraciones en la temporada de lluvia, y podrán evitar enfermedades. Desea que su casa tenga una mejor apariencia, hay mismo tiene un negocio de barrotes. Con el cual pagan los gastos de la casa y con el cual pagara el crédito. Ya que le ayudara a mejorar el patrimonio de su hija ya que es madre soltera. 
Doña Elizabeth está agradecida por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual pudo invertir en su negocio y espera contar con su ayuda en este préstamo ya será para mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is requesting a loan to repair the roof in front of her house as it is currently in a very bad state of repair.  When she repairs it, it will no longer let in water during the rainy season and she will be able to avoid sickness.  Elizabeth would like her home to look better.  She has a grocery store through which she covers her household expenses and which she will use to repay her loan.  This will help Elizabeth to improve her daughter's inheritance as she is a single mother.

Elizabeth is grateful for your cooperation in her previous loan which she was able to invest in her business.  She hopes to be able to continue relying on your help with this loan as it will enable her to improve her home.

loans.use: to repair the roof in front of her house

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, de 42 años; vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Teodosia, de 35 años y fruto de ese amor tienen 03 queridos hijos a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Hace 13 años que Juan se dedica a la venta de libros, es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable. Juan se despierta muy temprano para luego dirigirse a su librería en espera de sus primeros clientes; entre ellos los escolares. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder trabajar tranquilamente; con el crédito solicitado podrá comprar más libros para abastecer su librería. Este será su préstamo número 07 con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos de trabajo. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá comprando más libros para incrementar su librería como: libros de fábulas, cuentos, obras, diccionarios, etc.
texts.en:
Juan is 42 years old and lives in his own home with his wife Teodosia, age 35. They have three beloved children for whom they try to provide a better quality of life. Juan has been selling books for 13 years. He is a hardworking and responsible man.

Juan wakes up very early so that he can open his bookstore in anticipation of his first customers, most of whom are in school. What he enjoys most about his job is being able to work in peace. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy more books to restock his store.

This will be his seventh loan with MFP. He waits for assistance so that he can continue with his work objectives. This loan of 3000 PEN will be invested in the purchase of more books to expand his store such as fable collections, tales, literary works, dictionaries, and other genres.

loans.use: to buy books such as fables, tales, literary works, and dictionaries.

loans.name: Tananko

texts.en:
Tananko has been practicing crop farming for the last sixteen years. He is 56 years old, married, and supports seven people in his family.

He has been a good client, and he repaid his previous loans well. He has applied for his third loan, which he plans to use to buy maize seeds and fertilizers and also to hire temporary field workers to assist him in planting. 

In the future, he hopes to see his children prosper and be motivated to work hard in all that they do.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizers and also to hire temporary field workers

loans.name: Terrizene

texts.en:
The tagline for Terrizene's accounting service is, "It's in the relationship." Terrizene has a degree in accounting from Dillard University and has been doing accounting work for over 30 years. The relationship she establishes with her clients is very important to her because Terrizene is passionate about helping New Orleans' small businesses and non-profits succeed. 

Terrizene is now in the process of transitioning her home-based accounting practice to a commercial space. She plans to use her Kiva loan to lease office space and to buy furniture, fixtures, and equipment. Between January and May, Terrizene is busy with tax season, and from May to December she assists non-profits with audit preparation, accounting systems set-up, policies and procedures, and prepares budgets for grant applications. Her clients have included: museums, public advocacy groups, outdoor education providers, and charter schools. 

Terrizene has lived in New Orleans her entire life except for a short period of time immediately after Hurricane Katrina, when she lived in Baton Rouge. Even in Baton Rouge, under very difficult circumstances, Terri continued to provide her accounting expertise to New Orleans' charter schools. She and the founder and principal of one of those schools did all of the school administration, continuing payroll and helping to create a makeshift school for displaced New Orleans school children. As life returns to normal in New Orleans, Terrizene grows more passionate about helping non-profits and small businesses by providing them with her expert accounting services. 

Terrizene is excited about spending the holiday season with her son and daughter, and her two young grandsons.

loans.use: to lease office space and purchase furniture, fixtures and equipment

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan is a married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has two children. Loan earns a living running a general store, which she has done for three years. 

Loan would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as eggs, sugar, soft drinks, soap, shampoo, and toiletries to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money to meet any future difficulties.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as eggs, sugar, soft drinks, soap, shampoo, and toiletries to stock her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase Stock

loans.name: Tofig

texts.en:
Tofig is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Kalbadjar region , settled in  Khirdalan settlement. He is married and has 3 children.

Tofig has been doing light trucking for 6 years. He has his own car.
The first time he borrowed $400 and bought 2 wheels and other parts.
The second loan of $800 he spent to paint and repair his car.

Now he needs a loan of $1200 to assemble the back part of his car from the wood and iron.

loans.use: To assemble the back part of his car from wood and iron

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is married and lives with her husband and five children in a small Samoan village.  Her children are all in school, and paying for their education fees, school uniforms, and school supplies is a drain on the family finances.  In order to ensure that all her children remain in school, Marie runs a fast food stall where she sells cooked foods.  She used an initial loan from SPBD to purchase ingredients for her cooked foods.  Having repaid this initial loan in full and on time, Marie is eligible for a second loan.  She would use this loan to purchase a gas oven that would help her with baking and cooking.  Marie’s dream is to one day own a restaurant.  She says she will keep investing in her food stall and by growing her profits, she can save enough to reach her dream of financing the launch of a restaurant.

loans.use: Gas oven

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: About a year ago, Diana started a business selling and renting videos, DVDs and CDs. She once operated a small grocery, but decided to switch to selling non-perishable items. Her company is in a small park in Ivano-Frankovsk, a good location with no competitors close by. Diana’s husband, Ivan, works as a security guard, but also helps with the business when he can. They are looking forward to the birth of their first child. Diana has requested a loan of $450 to help purchase a new supply of licensed DVDs and CDs. This is her second loan from Nadiya Ukraine. She used the first one to expand her business, and is grateful for the financial help. In the future, Diana would like to open a second sales location. We look forward to seeing how her business will continue to grow.

loans.use: Purchase inventory of DVDs and CDs

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
Business Description

Mery has three years of experience in her business. She started her business with the help of a friend who supplied the products that Mery sells. She has decided to make her own capital investments. Her business is doing very well and she has many customers in her area. Mery works every day of the week from 9 a.m. until 5 p.m. On the weekend she also prepares food that she sells, including local specialties such as encebollado, morochos, and pastries. Her daughter helps her with the business.

Loan Use

Mary will use the loan to purchase costume jewelry and cosmetics for her business. She hopes that in the future she will be able to purchase a showcase where she can display her merchandise.

Personal Information

Mery is 34 years old and has two children. She is a single mother. Thanks to her hard work, she has been able to give them a good education. They are very happy with the efforts of their mother and in their free time they help her out with the business. As can be seen in the photo, their house is made of cane and consists of one living area. Mery hopes to partition the space and convert it to a cement structure.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Kenney Molloy, Kiva volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

Mery tiene una experiencia de 3 años con su actividad. Se inicio con la ayuda de una amiga la cual le proveía los productos para que ella vendiera. Decide tener su propio capital y lo invierte. Le ha ido muy bien con el negocio captando muchos clientes dentro de su sector. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 9 a.m. hasta las 5 p.m. Los fines de semana se dedica también a la elaboración de comida para su venta como lo es encebollado, Morochos, pasteles. Recibe la ayuda de su hija mayor en sus negocios.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de bisutería y cosméticos para su negocio. Espera a futuro poder comprarse una vitrina donde pueda exhibir sus productos.

Información Personal

Mery tiene 34 años y dos hijos. Es madre soltera. Ha logrado gracias a su trabajo darle una buena educación. Ellos están contentos con el esfuerzo de su mama. Que en sus días libres le ayudan con la atención de sus negocios. Su casita es de caña y viven en un solo ambiente. Su deseo es poder realizar divisiones dentro de su hogar y construirla de cemento.

loans.use: Purchase a larger supply of cosmetics

loans.name: I Komang Mertajiwa

texts.id:
I Komang Mertajiwa lives in a very basic house made of gedek and dirt floor. I Komang Mertajiwa supports his family by plating vegetable in a 35 acre land. With the help form his wife Desak Putu Pujawati they work on this since 1999. They had to stop because they use their capital to put their children to school. But 2 years ago they came back to this business on a borrowed capital. In 30 acres of land the plant long beans, and the cost for 3 months operations for insecticides and fertilizers is Rp. 2.750.000 while the profit is only Rp. 5.400.000, to get a higher profit they have to go to a bigger town to sell their product. Even though is not easy, Mertajiwa keep striving on because his children are still schooling, where one of their child is still in primary while another just started secondary, which will incur more cost for them.

Translated from Bahasa by Bernard, Kiva volunteer.

Tinggal di rumah yang sangat sederhana dengan dinding gedek dan masih beralaskan lantai tanah , I Komang Mertajiwa menghidupi kelurganya hanya dari hasil berkebun sayur-sayuran yang di tanam di tanah sakapan ( mengerjakan tanah orang lain dengan bagi hasil ) seluas 35 Are. Dengan dukungan dari Desak Putu Pujawati, istrinya, Komang Mertajiwa telah menekuni pekerjaannya ini sejak tahun 1999,walau sebelumnya sempat terhenti karena modalnya di pergunakan untuk membiayai sekolah anaknya. Namun sejak 2 tahun terakhir Komang Mertajiwa kembali memulai usahanya dengan menggunakan modal pinjaman, dan tanaman yang di tanam pun masih jenis sayur – sayuran yaitu sayur kacang panjang . Dari sekitar 30 Are tanah yang ditanami kacang panjang Mertajiwa menghabiskan modal untuk beli bibit, pupuk , obat-obatan dan juga biaya oprasional lainnya sebesar Rp. 2.750.000,- / periode masa tanam ( 3 bulan ) . Sedangkan untuk hasil panen yang di dapat dalam satu periode adalah Rp. 5.400.000,- Untuk mendapatkan harga pasaran yang lebih tinggi, hasil kebunnya langsung di jual ke pasar umum yang ada di kota Negara. Bahkan kadang –kadang Mertajiwa juga mengambil hasil panen petani lain yang kemudian di jual lagi ke pasar sebagi penghasilan tambahan . Meski sangat melelahkan , Mertajiwa tetap semangat dan tekun dalam bekerja mengingat tiga orang anaknya yang kini sudah bersekolah. Anaknya yang pertama di SMP dan dua orang lagi masih di bangku SD, yang tentunya membutuhkan biaya yang semakin besar. .

loans.use: Membeli bibit kacang panjang, pupuk, obat - obatan dan biaya perawatan - To buy seed for long beans and fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. Chea K. S., age 35, runs a butchery stand selling pork and beef, earning around $7 per day of profit. Her husband is a farmer making around $1 per day. They have two children who live at home, one who is a student and another one who is unemployed.  She would like to request a loan of $500 in order to purchase a cow for her butchery business. This will expand her inventory to meet customer demand and raise the income level of the family.

loans.use: To purchase meat for her butchery business.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en: My name is Shahida B. and I live in Lahore, Pakistan. I have six children, all of whom study at a local school. My husband manufactures water pumps and he is in the process of expanding his business. To continue with this expansion he needs a loan of $250.

loans.use: To expand the family water-pump manufacturing business

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is married with a teenage son. She lives in Dneprorudnyi with her family. Yelena owns a small business in the market selling lamp stands, bulbs, chandeliers, etc. She has a big assortment of inventory in her kiosk. Yelena has been in the trade for about 3 years. Currently, her monthly profit is about $1000. 

Yelena decided to start this business to make her investment in the family budget. Her husband works as a coal miner and has a good salary, however, Yelena wanted to learn how to do business and be financially independent as an entrepreneur. She is very energetic and willingly invests all of her energy in her business, working long hours every day. We believe this current loan to increase her business capital will help Yelena reach the kind of success she is seeking to achieve.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Libania

texts.es:
Miss Libania belongs to the communal bank "Las Hormiguitas," located in Yarinacocha, Ucayali in Peru. She is single, and 22 years old. With her first loan from Manuela Ramos for S./300 soles, she decided to invest in selling food and drink.

Currently, she runs a restaurant selling typical regional food, which requires her to wake up very early to go to the market.

With this loan for $350, which she will repay in four months, she will purchase 1 sack of rice, oil, condiments, eggs, sugar, sodas, gelatin, and suckers.

Libania says that she gets great support from Manuela Ramos because, "I'm improving the business and more customers are coming to the restaurant all the time. At the same time, they've given me opportunity since I was young to start up my own business."

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La señorita Libania pertenece al banco comunal Las Hormiguitas, ubicado en el Jr. Aguaytia Mz. LL Lt. 15, distrito de Yarinacocha, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 22 años y es soltera. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de comidas y bebidas. En la actualidad cuenta con un restaurante de venta de comidas típicas de la región, para lo cual se levanta muy temprano para ir al mercado. Con el préstamo de S/.1,000, el cual pagará en 4 meses, invertirá en la compra de 1 saco de arroz, aceite, condimentos, huevos, azúcar, gaseosas, gelatinas y chupetes. Libania manifiesta que recibe un gran apoyo de Manuela Ramos porque mejoro el negocio y las clientes van cada vez más seguido al restaurante y a la vez desde joven me dan oportunidades de emprender en un negocio propio.

loans.use:
Con el prestamo comprara 1 saco de arroz,aceite y otros productos para su restaurante
Purchase 1 sack of rice, oil, and other products for her restaurant.

loans.name: Lisseth Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ms. R. Pérez works as a cashier in the Juigalpa's Town hall. She is 41 years old and single, and it's her first time asking for a loan in order to improve her home in Juigalpa, east from Shell 1c. She has two children: one is a high school student and the other is student at college. Ms. R. Pérez will use the money from this loan to change the roof of her bedroom (for the purchase of materials and zinc). Her deepest desire is to improve her home to provide a better life to her children so they feel proud of her and her achievements as a single mother.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica MR, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. R. Pérez trabaja en la Alcaldía de Juigalpa como cajera, soltera y con 41 años de edad, esta solicitando su primer crédito para mejorar su vivienda habita en la ciudad de Juigalpa, de la Shell 1c al este, con 2 hijos, 1 estudia la secundaria y la otra la universidad, su crédito lo utilizara para cambiar el techo de su dormitorio (compra de perlines y zinc). Sus deseos más profundos son empezar a mejorar su vivienda para así poderles dar una mejor vida a sus hijos y que se sientan orgullosos de lo que ella ha logrado como madre soltera

loans.use: Change the roof of a bedroom at her home

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana started her business to get ahead. She started a grocery store to help with her family's expenses. She started 2 years ago by selling fried snacks, until she had supplied the store with canned goods and basic grocery items.

Now she is requesting a loan of $200, which she will repay in 3 months so she can buy a display case for cold meat and dairy products.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Juana inició el negocio para salir adelante por su misma puso un tienda de abarrotes para apoyar con el gasto familiar. Comenzó hace 2 años solo vendiendo frituras tipo snack, hasta empezar a surtir la tienda lateria y canasta básica.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses de manera que puede comprar una vitrina para carnes frías y lácteos

loans.use: To buy a display case

loans.name: Mabel Nelly

texts.es:
First loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=27767&_tpos=1&_tpg=1

Mabel is a member of the Solucion ("Solution") community bank. She's 40 years old and married with 3 children. She sells tuna at the food markets in Lima that she buys from different towns in the surrounding area. Her sales increase in the months between November and March when tuna production is highest. She also sells lubricants and spare parts for cars, a business that she started to fill the demand that she spotted because her husband is an auto mechanic.

Mabel needs a loan of 3000 soles, money that she will use to buy various spare parts.

Mabel's dreams are to buy a car to carry her products, to have a shop in her house and to buy a lot to build another house.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Primer prestamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=27767&_tpos=1&_tpg=1

Mabel es socia del Banco Comunal Solución.

Mabel es casada, tiene 40 años y 3 hijos, Mabel vende tuna en los mercados de abastos de la ciudad de Lima, sus productos son adquiridos en los diferentes pueblos de la región, sus ventas se incrementan los meses de noviembre a marzo donde hay producción de tuna. Además vende lubricantes y repuestos, actividad que inicio por la demanda que había porque su esposo es mecánico.

Mabel necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de repuestos diversos para carro.

Los sueños de Mabel son comprar un carro para transportar sus productos, tener una tienda de abarrotes en su casa y comprar un terreno para construir otra casa.

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Moliya

texts.ru:
Moliya is 25, married and has a child. Every year, in the season for drying apricots, she and her family go to the apricot gardens to pick apricots for drying. The dried apricots are stored in sacks in her house, and are gradually sold for income that Moliya and her family subsist on. After she learned about the possibility of getting a loan, Moliya decided to apply for one so that she could purchase additonal fresh apricots.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer.

Молие исполнилось 25 лет, она замужем и воспитывает 1 ребенка. Каждый год в сезон сушки абрикосов, она и ее семья выезжают под абрикосовые сады и сушат абрикосы. Высушенные абрикосы хранятся в мешках дома и постепенно продавая их семья Молии живет на вырученные деньги. Узнав о возможности получения займа Молия решила подать заявку на займ и собирается получить займ и дополнительно к своим собственным сбережениям прикупить свежих абрикосов.

loans.use: Purchase of fresh apricots

loans.name: Sokheng

texts.en: Mrs. Sokheng K., a drink seller in Preak Thom Village in Kandal Province, is a 60-year-old widow with two children who help their mother's business in order to improve their living conditions. Since Mrs. Sokheng K.'s business is doing well, she wants to expand it  through a loan to purchase more soft drinks to resell.

loans.use: To purchase more soft drinks to resell in order to improve her living conditions.

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
Sharifa is married. She has one child who is 2 years old.

Sharifa is a commodities seller. Each day, she works at her business selling goods. She can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Sharifa now hopes to receive a loan so she can buy more commodities for her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for her business.

loans.name: Mahammad

texts.en:
Mahammad M. is a self-sacrificing, loving father, 60 years old with 3 children. In spite of his age, he continues to struggle to move his beloved family ahead and improve their economic situation. His main activity is dairy and meat sales and he started this business in 1983.

Mahammad is on a pension now, but it is too small a sum and his primary financial source comes from livestock. His 2 sons actively help him. The desire that Mahammad harbors in his heart is that of increasing his capital to invest in acquiring more animals. By selling calves and dairy products, he can create more income for his family. He requests a loan in the amount of 1000 USD. Let's get together behind this man to help him bring well-being and security to the members of his family.

loans.use: To purchase one cow and fodder

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Cette dame tient un commerce de produits locaux (pâte d'arachide, huille de palme etc). Avec cette activité elle soutient son mari pour entretenir leur famille de 5 enfants; Elle sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer ses activités
texts.en:
This lady sells local products (peanut butter, palm oil, etc.). With this business she helps her husband support their family of 5 children. She is requesting this loan to bolster her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to bolster her little business

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ly C. is the leader of this three-member group in Tongrong Commune in Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia. Ly is 47 years old, and she has four children, three of whom are working. Her husband, Mr. Va Nouv, is 44 years old. Va is a rice farmer and also a carpenter. He does repairs and builds structures in the area around their village. Since 1985, Ly has been a farmer. She requests a loan of $150 to buy more construction materials for her husband’s business. This will help them earn more for their daily food.

The other two members of the group are also farmers. Mr. Chhantry H. is 69 years old, and a rice farmer. He requests a loan of $150 to purchase furniture for his house. Mrs. Saron I. is 44 years old, and a rice farmer. She requests a loan of $50 to buy fertilizer to improve the yield of the rice crop.

loans.use: Buy more construction materials for carpentry business

loans.name: Faustino Saul

texts.es: Don Faustino está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 3er crédito para  Terminar de construir  una habitación, trabaja como Responsable de insumos médicos del hospital Jacinto Hernández desde hace 18 años, en el que se ha desempeñado con gran resposalidad, es honesto, trabajador y muy querido por sus compañeros de trabajo, tiene 2 hijos: el mayor de 13 años estudia su 5to  grado de educación primaria y una niña de 9 años estudia su 4to grado de educación primaria, su esposa trabaja en el Gallo Mas Gallo, ambos son trabajadores asalariados, no dependen de otros ingresos, pero ambos comparten los gastos familiares, el se siente agradecido con la institución de AFODENIC  ya que con los anteriores ha comprado sus electrodomésticos, su sueño es tener salud para sus familia,  estabilidad laboral y poco a poco ir mejorando la infraestructura de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Faustino is starting his third loan cycle in order to finish building a room in his home. For the past 18 years he has worked as a manager of medical supplies at the Jacinto Hernandez Hospital, a job that he has carried out with responsibility and honesty. He is hard-working and loved by his colleagues. He has two children: the oldest is 13 years old and is in 5th grade and he has a daughter who is 9 years old and is in 4th grade. His wife works at Gallo Mas Gallo and both of them are salaried workers who do not have other income to depend on. They both share the family expenses and he feels grateful for AFODENIC. With his previous loans he has bought household appliances. He dream is for his family to be in good health, with stable work and to continue to improve the infrastructure of his house, little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a room

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 48-year-old Judith K. from Dar es Salaam. She is widowed with three children between the ages of 14 and 24. Judith has been running a general store since 2005, a neighborhood shop in the city where she sells common household and grocery items. She works at the business for 13-16 hours per day, six days per week. Judith currently earns about 20 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 375 USD in order to purchase additional inventory in bulk. Judith thanks you for her support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit through micro-leasing in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women and uses the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory in bulk

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta J. B., 39 years old, is married to Reynaldo B. and lives at Owaon, Dapitan City. Luckily, they have 4 children and all are in elementary school.

She dreams of the success of her children, because she doesn’t want them to have the difficulties they encounter right now. With all her strength, she always researches new strategies in earning money. So she came up with hog-raising as an idea. But she hasn’t enough capital in this business and has tried to ask some of her friends, and they referred her to Paglaum Cooperative. This cooperative offers quality services to its members and gives benefits as well. Wholeheartedly the Cooperative accepted her and granted her wishes.

For a year she’s been a member of Paglaum MPC, and she sees that their life simply is getting better. Now she applies a loan of 7,000 php to buy vaccines for her hogs as well as feed for hog-fattening. Through this, she hopes that her children can go to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed & vaccines for hogs

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en: A 23-year-old, Marivic Buhi-an is married to her husband who is a teacher. They have one child and reside in Balangasan, Pagadian City, Zamboanga Del Sur. Marivic also supports her parents, especially with their basic needs. Her parents guide her on how to ensure that the piglets she raises grow healthy. Marivic applied for a loan worth PHP 5,000 payable in six months, for purchasing feeds and more piglets. Three months after raising the piglets, Marivic butchers the pigs and sells them per kilo. She hopes that someday the piggery business will flourish and hopefully provide supply to the neighboring towns. Aside from that, Marivic and her husband can prepare for the education of their child.

loans.use: To expand her pig raising business

loans.name: Saboat

texts.ru: Сабоат занимается куплей продажей различных промышленных товаров на центральном рынке города Исфары. Ей 46 лет, постоянной работы у нее нет и занятие бизнесом единственный источник ее дохода. Кроме этого в летний период она занимается переработкой абрикосов. В Микроинвест она получала займ для переработки абрикосов. Погашения этого займа недавно закончились. Условия кредитования Микроинвест ей понравились и поэтому она решила получить новый займ для увеличения оборотного капитала своего бизнеса, продажи промтоваров.
texts.en:
Saboat sells various manufactured goods at the Isfara central market. She is 46 years old and has no permanent employment, so business is her only source of income. In addition, she also works processing apricots during the summer. She received a loan from Microinvest for the apricot processing, and finished repayment of it recently. She liked Microinvest's terms so she decided to obtain a new loan in order to increase her sales business's working capital.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn F. G., 39, is married with four children. She has six years of experience in the housing rental business, which she works at seven days per week.  She is requesting her first loan from SPBD to purchase fixtures, paint supplies, lighting, tiles, new doors, etc. for her business. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala ($88 USD). An SPBD loan is Marilyn’s only access to capital because she is unable to qualify for a loan through traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase fixtures, paint, brushes, lighting, tiles, new doors for rental business

loans.name: Juruhon

texts.ru: Хасанов Журухон житель города Яван. Возраст 58 лет, женат и имеет пятерых детей. Уже около 10 лет занимается животноводством. Разводит коз для продажи. Как известно , при хорошем уходе за козами , они могут давать приплод до двух раз в год. Поэтому Журухон решил получить кредит для того , чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Он планирует купить коз , после получения прибыли за которых сможет женить сына. Кроме того он сможет обеспечить население качественным мясом.
texts.en:
Jurohon H. lives in the city of Yavan. He is 58 years old, married and has five children. He has been involved in animal husbandry for 10 years. He breeds goats for sale. It is known that when goats are well taken care of, they can be bred up to twice per year. This is why Jurohon decided to obtain this loan, so that he can increase his livestock headcount. He plans to purchase goats and use the profit for his son’s wedding. Besides this, Jurohon will be able to supply his customers with quality meat.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of goats

loans.name: Joska

texts.en:
Joska A. sells groundnut paste and bread at the market. She is requesting a loan in order to stock more groundnuts that she will use for making the paste to sell. She has two children, both boys, who attend Usarat primary school. Joska, 25 years old, is married to a peasant who grows cabbages at Walang-walang river bank. Joska hopes to open up a bookshop in the future if she can make extra profits in her business, following the receipt of this loan.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchse more groundnuts in order to make paste to sell.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora L. is from the city of Mobod, Oroquieta City. She is 62-years old. Nora is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Nora owns and operates copra-buying business in the agriculture sector where crops are raised. Copra comes from coconuts, and planting and harvesting coconut trees is basic to this business. Nora has been engaged in her business for over 49 years.

In 2001, Nora joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Nora is requesting a loan  to pay for services to increase her crop yield. This loan will be the 14th loan taken out by Nora from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia O. is forty-five years old and married. She is the mother of three children, all sons. Some of her children are in the senior high while others are in the junior high. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Cecilia’s husband is a farmer.

Cecilia is a trader. She sells printed textiles. She sells under a shed in the market square and treks to other towns to sell as well. She also hawks (sells door-to-door) to sell in her community. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She desires to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy printed textiles in bulk

loans.name: Badegnajuru Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Badegnajuru est composé de cinq  femmes  (toutes mariées)  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, 4 enfants et vivant  la plupart dans des  familles monogames dans le quartier Babemba, un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso  (3ème région administrative de la république du Mali.)
 Elles mènent  diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente  des condiments alimentaires, de chaussures, du bois de chauffe etc.  
Dans le but  d’augmenter la clientèle et le profit, elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur sixième  prêt solidaire, tous les prêts précédents  se sont  bien dénoués. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 50 colis de condiments, 100 paires de chaussures et 10 chargements de charrettes en bois de chauffe. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et  à Bamako (la capitale du Mali ) Les marchandises sont vendues au marché de Médine, dans les quartiers  ou de façon ambulante  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes et la plupart au comptant.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 18 000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée dans l’éducation et  la santé des enfants et l’autre partie sera utilisée pour rembourser le prêt.
Les femmes du groupe Badegnajuru  ambitionnent devenir des grossistes  et  aider leur mari à construire une maison.
texts.en:
The group of Badegnajuru is composed of five women (all married); on average, they are 37 years old with 4 children per woman. They mostly live in monogamous families in the neighborhood of Babemba, one of the neighborhoods in the city of Sikasso (3rd Administrative Region of the Republic of Mali).

They run diverse businesses, which sell, amongst other things, condiments, shoes, firewood etc.

With the aim of increasing their clientele and their profits, they are working with the micro-finance group Soro Yiriwaso. This is their sixth loan; all previous loans have been properly repaid.

With this new loan, they intend to buy 50 packages of condiments, 100 pairs of shoes and 10 cartloads of firewood. They will supply themselves from the large market in the city of Sikasso and in Bamako (the capital of Mali). They will sell their merchandise in the market of Médine, in the neighborhoods or walking around, to a clientele composed mostly of men and women. They will sell their goods mostly for cash.

They anticipate each earning a profit of 18,000 FCFA, which they will use partly to for education and the health of their children and the other part will be used to repay the loan.

The goal of the women of Group Badenajuru ambition is to become wholesales and to help their husbands build a house.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of items for their business.

loans.name: Jose Orlando

texts.es: el sr. Jose Orlando P. tiene 40 años de edad, junto con su esposa Sandra Salvador tienen un negocio de venta de accesorios para carro como ser halogenas, pitos, porta placas, empaques, parabrisas, papel polarizado, el esta ubicado en el parque el obelisco de la ciudad de comayaguela, el hace el trabajo de polarizar carros y la esposa vende los accesorios. tienen 5 hijos a los cuales les han logrado dar educacion, salud y hogar. el necesita el credito para comprar mas mercaderia y asi tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Jose Orlando P. is 40 years old and together with his wife Sandra Salvador runs an automotive accessory business selling items such as halogen lights, horns, licence plate frames, windshield washers, and window tinting film. He is located at the El Obelisco park in the city of Comayaguela. He tints car windows and his wife takes care of selling accessories. They have 5 children and they have managed to provide them all with an education, with health care and with a home. He requires a loan to purchase more merchandise, so as to increase his earnings.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase automotive accessories

loans.name: Ulalia

texts.en:
Ulalia L. (10400002780) is a 42-year-old woman living in the town of Tulaele.  She is married and has six adult children.  To make a living, Ulalia owns & operates a business manufacturing & selling clothing products to local businesses and community members.  Ulalia has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 500 WST a month from these activities.

Ulalia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ulalia has successfully repaid a previous loan from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products.  Ulalia is now requesting a new loan of 2400 WST, which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings.  The loan will be the third loan taken out by Ulalia from SPBD.  Ulalia plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support extended members of her family.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings

loans.name: Emmylou

texts.en:
Emmylou B. is from the village of Agusan Canyon, Camp Phillips, Bukidnon. She is 26 years old. Emmylou is married and has 2 very young children. To make a living, Emmylou owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling tropical aqua fish in the local community. Emmylou has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Emmylou joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emmylou is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Emmylou from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: Martha Lorena Ríos B. tiene la edad de 29 años es una mujer muy joven, ella es casada y junto a su esposo tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Actualmente ella presenta estudios hasta 5 grado de primaria. Ella se dedica a una pulpería anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de frijoles cocidos, y refrescos naturales por lo que con la ayuda de los financiamientos ha logrado salir adelante, por lo que no pudo continuar con este negocio porque no tenía el suficiente capital por lo que decide establecer una pulpería. Con este financiamiento comprara productos como golosinas, refrescos naturales, pan, galletas, pollo y detergentes. Su deseo más grande es salir adelante con su familia y su negocio.
texts.en:
Martha Lorena R. B. is 29 years old, married and has 2 children. She attended school up to 5 grade. She is dedicated to a small grocery shop. She was devoted to the sale of baked beans and natural juices, but she couldn’t keep this business because she did not have enough working capital. This is how she decided to establish a grocery shop.

The loan that she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of products such as candy, sodas, bread, biscuits, chicken and detergents. Her greatest wish is to keep her business and family going.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosanna D. is a woman from the island village in the town of Binangonan in Rizal province in the Philippines. She is married to Librado, who is 50 years old and the driver of a small passenger ferry. She is a mother to three: two sons and a daughter.

She has faith that she will get out of poverty. In 2008, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, with a bagful of hope of gaining access to capital. Her previous loans were carefully invested in a hog-raising business (pigs). The business runs smoothly, and it brings them good profit during times when the pigs are sold in the market. But it takes more than three months before the pigs will be ready to sell.

Just recently, she decided to shift her business to a more productive business: fishing. She believes that a fishing business would bring her enough profit with less time and effort. Now that she is about to receive her third loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP, she plans to buy 30 pieces of bamboo, thousands of fingerlings and fry, and bundles of fishnet, as well as to pay labor expenses.

She is hopeful that, with the help of ASHI and with the trust of KIVA lenders, little by little, she can reach her dreams in life. She aspires to expand her business and be able to save for the future of her children, especially their school needs.

loans.use: To pay for 30 pieces of bamboo, thousands of fingerlings and fry, and bundles of fishnet, as well as to pay labor expenses

loans.name: Chin

texts.en: Chin R., 36, has a business selling brooms at the local market of Takeo province to earn approximately around US$4 each day, while her husband, Nhor Nuk, pictured here, stays at home making brooms for her. Broom is made from a kind of long grass which grows in the forest. Both husband and wife know how to make broom from their neighbors and they start doing that business since 2000. This couple has five children, four of who are in school and one is too young to attend. Chin R. told to a loan officer that every month she needs to spend around US$45 on food and US$3 on utility. She is asking a loan from Kiva via Credit, local partner, to purchase long grass to make more brooms to sell at the market.

loans.use: To purchase long grass to make more brooms.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa S. is from the village of Naga, Jimenez, Misamis, Occidental. She is 34 years old, married and has three school-aged children. She owns and operates a service-based business, providing beauty services to local community members. Marissa has been in business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Marissa joined PMPC to help improve her living situation and to engage in business. Marissa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC to purchase materials. She is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be her second from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to pay the tuition fees for her children.

--------------------- About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Purchase nventory and for working capital.

loans.name: Rusbi

texts.es:
La señora Rusbi, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de la Colina II”, Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 27 años y es madre de 01 hijo, que aun depende de ella.

Rusbi, anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de verduras y poco a poco fue ahorrando y generando sus propios ingresos, hoy en día es una mujer perseverante, capaz y eficiente. En la actualidad, se dedica a la venta de mercadería de ropas, en un lugar muy bien acondicionado, ubicado en su misma casa y nos comenta que le esta yendo muy bien, cuenta con clientes que ya la conocen y saben del tipo de actividad que realiza. 
La fortaleza y la perseverancia que le caracteriza, le ayudo a crecer como mujer independiente y esta muy orgullosa con lo logrado.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,800.00, comprará  más mercadería de ropas para surtir su stock como: pantalones, shorts, blusas en todas las tallas y modelos, polos y vestidos para adultos y niñas. 

Se siente una mujer establecida y trabajadora y agradece la oportunidad que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos  la ha ofrecido, para así desarrollarse como mujer y pequeña empresaria.
texts.en:
Rusbi, 27, is a member of the "Mujeres de la Colina II" communal bank which is in the Banda de Shilcayo district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is married and has one son, who is dependent on her. Previously, Rusbi sold vegetables and little by little saved up and generated her own income. Today, she is a persevering, capable, efficient woman. Currently, she sells clothing in a very well-equipped space in her own home. She comments that she is doing quite well; she has regular customers who know her and know the kind of activity she undertakes. The strength and perseverance that characterize her helped her to grow as an independent woman. She is very proud of what she has accomplished. She will use this 1,800 sol loan to buy more clothing such as, pants, shorts, blouses in all sizes and styles, polo shirts, women's and girls' dresses, to stock her shop. She feels well established and hard-working and is grateful for the opportunity the Manuela Ramos Movement has offered her to develop as a woman and a small business entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a trader who sells mobile accessories and radios at Kortubuma in the central business market in Bo. He is married and has four dependents: two kids, mother and his wife. He dropped out of junior secondary school and has spent 17 years in business.

James also sells jewelry to add to his income. James intends to buy additional stock and to rent a shop. He hopes to use the proceeds from the loan to complete his house and pay his kids' school fees. His wife at times assists him in his business when he is not around and normally buys his stock from Guinea.

James has been a client with very good credit history.

loans.use: To buy mobile phone accessories and radios

loans.name: Emmily Wiyema

texts.en:
For the last three years Emmily Wiyema M. has sold home products such as plates, cooking pots, lamps, jugs, basins and cups to walk-in customers. She has one employee. 

Emmily is using the proceeds of KES 60,000 to restock her household goods. Her goal in life is to become a wholesaler and own a wholesale shop. Her business challenge is breakages caused by poor packaging getting wet when it gets to the rainy season as the business is in an open market.

Emmily is married and has four children. She describes herself as friendly, polite and respectful.

loans.use: To buy more plates, lamps, jugs and basins

loans.name: Arleen

texts.en:
Arleen P. is a mother and a farmer in Norala South Cotabato. She has three children. The eldest is 13, the second child is 12 and the youngest is 4 years old.  She works from morning until sunset so that she will be able to ensure that she will have an abundant harvest.

She is hoping to receive a loan of PHP 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies. In that way she will be able to improve the size of her harvest, and her income as well.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Gernie

texts.en:
Gernie M. is from the village of Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 26 years old. Gernie is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Gernie owns and operates a business, buying and selling coconut in the local community. Gernie is just starting this business.

In 2009, Gernie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Gernie is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to build up her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy printed fabrics.

loans.name: Vin

texts.en: Mr. Vin C. is 24 years old and he lives in Choeung Prey I village in Kandal province. He and his wife, Mrs. Chorn Por, are farmers who own one hectare of land to grow rice to support their family. They have some problems because the rice field is far from an irrigation system and the soil is infertile. In order to improve rice production, Mr. Vin C. decided to apply for a loan to dig a well. He would like to buy fertilizer and fuel with the rest of the loan. He is the father of a child who is too small to study or work. His wife is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To dig a well

loans.name: Kotognogontala Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe Kotognogontala  sont toutes mariées. Elles ont en moyenne 36 ans, 4 enfants et vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Zanfina, un des villages de Fana, préfecture de Dioila, deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali.
Ces femmes du groupe qui se sont connus à travers des liens de voisinage et de parenté  font essentiellement l’achat et la vente de produits alimentaires tels  les céréales,  les condiments alimentaires et le bois de chauffe.
