Après avoir correctement remboursés les quatre prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe  Kotognogontala  sont à leur  cinquième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter, une grande quantité de grains de céréales sèches (fonio, petit mil, maïs) et quelques colis de condiments alimentaires. 
Elles s’approvisionnent essentiellement sur place auprès des producteurs et grossistes et effectuent leurs ventes au marché de Fana, à domicile,  généralement au comptant, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15.000FCFA qui sera  utilisé pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group Kotognogontala are all married. They average 36 years of age and four children each, and they live in traditional extended families in Zanfina, a village of Fana, prefecture of Dioila, 2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali. These women of the group know one another through ties of community and kinship, and they essentially buy and sell food items, such as grains and condiments, and firewood. After having properly repaid the four previous loans, the women of the group are now on their fifth solidarity loan, which will be used for buying: a large quantity of dried grains (fonio, small millet, and corn) and a few packages of condiments. Supplies are gotten locally from producers and wholesalers. Sales are made at the Fana market and at home. Cash is generally accepted from customers composed of women and men. The group members each envision making an average monthly profit of 15,000 francs CFA that will be used to provide for the family. The rest will be invested in their businesses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying food items

loans.name: Mussarat's Group

texts.en:
Mussarat is 31-year old lady. She lives in a city named Lahore in Pakistan for the back 25 years. Her husband name is M. T. who works in a factory on monthly wage. 

Mussarat is a vigorous and skillful lady.  She involves in a decorative embroider business. She learned this art from her mother. She never got education because she always paid attention on this work. Her mother teaches her about all the techniques used in this work, which means that today, she is getting quite good!

She does this work for two reasons first is she loves her work and second is she wants to share the financial burden of her husband. She is acquiring for a loan of worth Pak Rs. 25,000 with which she will purchase the material such as (beads, colored thread, sketches and clothes) to generate more income.

She has four other ladies in her loan group. Najma wants a loan to buy clothes for her clothes selling business. Zeenat and Azra each want a loan to buy buffalos for their milk selling business.  Shazia wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit selling business.

loans.use: To buy material for decorative embroider business

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila T. is from the village of Kandiis, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 27 years old, married, and has three infant-aged children. To make a living, Sheila owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Sheila has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Sheila joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy artifacts

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan K. is a single, 33-year-old lady who has two children: Rebbecca (10 years old, in primary school) and Justus (7 years old, in primary school).

Joan runs a secondhand-clothes business which she started three years ago. From this business she earns a profit of Ksh 10,000 every month. She earns additional income from farming.

Joan has borrowed a loan of Ksh 20,000 from KADET. Half of the loan will be used to buy more blouses, Ksh 5,000  will be used to buy jumpers and Ksh 5,000 to buy hairnets.

Existing clients of KADET introduced Joan to the micro-finance organization and this is the first financial institution from which she has borrowed. Joan’s business is in Kabarnet Town. Her clients are honest.

If this loan boosts her business, Joan will use the extra profit to expand the business. She dreams of opening a boutique and transforming her business from the sale of secondhand clothes to the sale of new clothes.

Joan describes herself as an honest, God-fearing and hardworking woman.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her used-clothing retail business

loans.name: Noutèné

texts.fr:
Madame Noutèné Sangaré  est une femme mariée de 38 ans qui vit dans une famille polygame  avec son mari, ses coépouses et leurs enfants à Siana, un des villages de la préfecture de Kolondièba dans la  troisième région (Sikasso) de la République Mali. 
Noutèné fait de la restauration il y’ a des années. Son  restaurant se trouve au bord de la route qui traverse son village. Elle est très fréquentée et appréciée des résidants et passants.
Pour augmenter son capital elle adhère au programme crédit de  Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à son premier  prêt individuel. 
Noutèné a fait les prêts solidaires et  de campagnes qui ont été tous correctement remboursés
Avec ce prêt individuel elle compte acheter,  500kg de riz, des condiments alimentaires et divers articles. Sa clientèle est composée d’hommes et de femmes et sa vente  se fait essentiellement  au comptant.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 75.000 FCFA par mois qui sera réinvesti dans l’entreprise.
texts.en:
Mrs. Noutèné Sangaré is a married woman who is 38 years old. She lives in a polygamous family with her husband, his other wives and their children, in Siana, one of the villages in the prefecture of Kolondièba in the third region (Sikasso) of the Republic of Mali. Noutèné has been active in the restauration business for years. Her restaurant is on the side of the road which crosses her village. Her restaurant is used a lot and very much appreciated by both residents of the village and passers-by. In order to increase her capital, Noutèné joined Soro Yiriwaso's loan program and is on her first individual loan with the institution. She has had group loans and farming loans in the past, all of which have been repaid on time. With this individual loan she is planning on buying 500kg of rice, condiments and other miscellaneous products. Her customer base is made up of men and women and her sales are made essentially for cash. She expects to make a monthly profit of 75,000FCFA which will be reinvested in her business.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of restauration ingredients

loans.name: Srey-Em

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey-em S. (in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Sam Sok, have been married since 2005. They have one son and one daughter. Both are still young. They are living about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Srey-em and her husband have been operating a grocery store for more than three years. They buy grocery items from Phnom Penh market for resale in front of their house. Besides selling groceries, they also sell vegetables such as onions, cucumbers, tomatoes, and cabbage. 

The couple hopes to continue expanding their business, so Srey-em is requesting a loan of US$ 1,000 to buy additional grocery items for resale.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items to add to her inventory

loans.name: Pastor

texts.es:
El  Sr. Pastor O. Z.   es de la ciudad de San Estanislao, del Barrio Ciraty, tiene 45 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Vicencia Telma Z. Candia de 37 años de edad, actualmente tienen 2 hijos, todos en edad escolar.
 
       Posee una Oleria (fabrica de ladrillo) donde fabrican ladrillo y los producen para varias casas que se dedican a la venta de materiales de construccionen la ciudad de  Santani, el se encuentra  con clientela formada, buen ingreso, buenas referencias comerciales y personales, señor muy trabajador.

             El cliente queire actualmente abrir un negocio de ventas de productos de uso domestico para que su señora pueda trabajar en el negocio y de esa forma  obtendrian mayor ingreso.
texts.en:
Pastor O. Z. is from the Ciraty neighborhood of the city of San Estanislao. He is 45 years old, and is married to Vicencia Telma Z. Candia, who is 37. They have 2 children who are now school-aged. They have a brick factory where they make bricks for various businesses that sell construction materials in the city of Santani. He has regular customers, a good income, and good references, both personal and professional. He is a very hardworking man. Now he wants to open a store selling household products, so that his wife can work in the business and in this manner increase the family's income.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy noodles, rice, flour, dairy products, bread and other items

loans.name: Word Group

texts.en: Hawa S. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in a village call Mabanta, in Northern Sierra Leone. She is age 45, married to a farmer and the couple has four children, three of whom are still attending school. For many years now, Hawa has been selling vegetable oil, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, etc.  This is the first loan that Hawa and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Hawa will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to expand her business. She will buy margi, salt, vegetable oil, groundnut/peanuts, pepper, etc. at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy margi, salt, vegetable oil, groundnut, pepper, etc.

loans.name: Gilberto Crispín

texts.es:
El señor Gilberto es soltero de 33 años y tiene una hija de 1 año, tiene un estudio de serigrafía hace 5 años, el cual cuenta con una ubicación muy estratégica, pues, esta ubicado frente a un comercial muy concurrida, el cual facilita que se conozca  su negocio. Cuenta con una vasta clientela quines gustan mucho de sus trabajos por la calidad de las mismas.

El crédito solicitado es para comprar pinturas, plásticos y resma de papel ya que, además, de su servició de serigrafía también realiza fotocopias para tener un ingreso agregado.

Su máximo sueño es tener su propio local, para lo cual necesita incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Sr. Gilberto is 33 years old, single, and has a one year old daughter. Five years ago, he opened a silk screening business in a very strategic location on the opposite side of a busy shopping center. This enables his business to be easily recognized. He has a list of clients who are fans of the quality of his work.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy paints, plastic, and reams of paper. In addition to silk screening, he also provides photocopying services to generate extra revenue.

His greatest dream is to have his own location where he can increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase screen printing & photocopying supplies

loans.name: Luvsantseren

texts.en:
Luvsantseren S. is 61 years old and lives with his wife and four children in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city Mongolia. His children range in age from 21 to 33 years and they help out with their parents' business. He lives with her wife in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, while the children live in houses separately in the same yard.

Luvsantseren began his business in 1993 specializing in the sale of electric cable, accessories, tires and other electrical stuff. He sells at three rented stalls in Narantuul, the biggest and most crowded market in Ulaanbaatar. He says, “My only wish is to complete the new house which is under construction now”.

Luvsantseren is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan in order to increase his business working capital and purchase more electrical stuff and items at wholesale prices to retail in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more electrical stuff to sell

loans.name: Maria Delfina

texts.en:
Maria Delfina P. L. is 60 years old. She is married and lives in the Bolivar Province of Ecuador. She has 7 children, the oldest of whom is 40 years old, and the youngest is 23. 

Maria is a member of the rural loan group Gradas Chico, located 15 minutes from the town of Guaranda. There are 20 group members, the majority of whom work in agriculture. They grow corn, wheat, potatoes, and raise animals. This is the third loan they have taken with the cooperative. 

Maria works in agriculture. She cultivates wheat, corn, and beans. She plans to use the loan to purchase a dairy cow. The loan will help her maintain her economic well-being. Maria´s dream is to own 2 or 3 of her own cows. She has struggled this year when trying to sell her crops, as the price has dropped and a large portion of her crops have been destroyed by a pest called ¨lancha.¨ 

Maria doesn´t have much free time, as she works in agriculture nearly 7 days per week. However, she enjoys the annual Carnival that takes place during the month of February in the Bolivar Province.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Bedzame

texts.en:
Bedzame M. Mwavuo is a married man. His wife is a farmer and they have three children aged between twelve years and two years old.

Bedzame’s business is located at the busy Mwembe Tayari market in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is in the coastal region of Kenya and is well-known for its many tourist attraction sites, not forgetting the Indian Ocean’s white beaches.

Bedzame has been selling secondhand clothes for the last four years to the local people. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is insufficient capital. However he works very hard to keep his business doing well.

Bedzame is using his loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more secondhand clothes to expand his business. He hopes to obtain his own premises in which to do business where he will not be paying rent.

Bedzame hopes to give his children a quality education. He describes himself as forward thinking and business-minded.

loans.use: To buy more secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: Myrian Cecilia

texts.es:
Myrian es vendedora de productos Yambal (empresa de cosméticos que vende productos a un bajo costo para mujeres emprendedoras), vive en el suburbio de Guayaquil.

Para ayudar con los gastos familiares ya que su esposo era el único que trabaja ella tubo que comenzar a buscar una actividad que le generara ingresos, escucho de Yambal y se inscribió como vendedora a domicilio por catalogo. Poco a poco a tenido ingresos para solventar los gastos. Vende perfumes, cremas, desodorantes etc. 

Para seguir con su negocio ella quiere comprar perfumes, cremas y desodorantes. En el futuro quiere segir con su negocio y que se expanda.
texts.en:
Myrian sells Yambal products (a cosmetics business that sells products at low cost to enterprising women) and she lives in a suburb of Guayaquil.

To help with the family expenses since her husband was the only one working, she had to start looking for a way to generate income.  She heard about Yambal and she signed up to be a saleswoman to homes through catalogs.  Little by little she has had earnings to cover her costs.  She sells perfumes, creams, deodorants, etc.

To continue with her business she wants to buy perfumes, creams and deodorants.  In the future she would like to keep at her business and have it grow.

loans.use: Perfumes, creams, clothing

loans.name: Justinah

texts.en: Justinah is a member of the Dandora Success group in Faulu Kenya.  She supplies rice mainly to hotels.  She was previously selling second-hand clothes to earn a living. She has been motivated through Faulu Kenya and she has now become more focused in her business.  She sees herself owning a cereal store in the future.  She has requested 18,000 KES to buy rice for resale.

loans.use: To buy rice

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: El joven Alejandro  C. labora en una industrial de la localidad como obrero, tiene 11 años viviendo en la casa de su padre ahora el contribuye en los gastos del hogar y en este momento quiere terminar con lo que sus padres con mucho sacrificio han ido costruyendo su patrimonio, su padre es ladrillero tiene su propio negocio donde labora dichos ladrillos es un negocio familiar que se ha pasado de generacion en este momento el joven C. tuvo una buena oportunidad en la industria es por eso dejo de ayudar a su padre en la elaboracion de ladrillo empezo a trabajar esto para tener un ingreso extra para su familia, a pesar de ser tan joven es un hombre muy responsable y quiere estar al cuidado de su familia es por eso solicito el credito para terminar la vista de su casa y otorgarle en agradecimiento a su mama.
texts.en: Alejandro C. has a job in a factory in his neighborhood as a worker.  He has been living in his father's house for 11 years now he contributes to the household expenses.  Right now he would like to finish what his parents have been building up for him with a lot of sacrifice, his estate.  His father is a brick maker.  He has his own business where he produces these bricks.  It is a family business which has passed down from one generation to another.  Currently C. has a good opportunity in the factory and that is why he stopped helping his father making bricks.  He began this work to make extra income for his family.  In spite of being so young, he is a very responsible man who wants to look after his family. He is requesting the loan to put some finishing touches to the front of his house and present it to his mother in thanks.

loans.use: To improve the front of his house

loans.name: Gabriel Francisco

texts.es:
el sr. Gabriel D. se dedica al comercio, pues vende verduras desde hace mas de 5 años, dicha actividad la realiza de forma ambulante en las diversas comunidades como ser Cifuentes, Cayantu, Río Arriba  Campamento, Las Quebradas, La Apertura, Arenales. su producto lo distribuye en el vehiculo de su hermana ya que su vehiculo esta lo esta reparando porque esta en mal estado, razón por la cual esta solicitando el credito para comprar unos repuestos y tambien unas verduras.
las ganancias las necesita para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en: Gabriel D. has been a vegetable merchant for more than 5 years. He sells in various communities, such as Cifuentes, Cayantu, Río Arriba Campamento, Las Quebradas, La Apertura, and Arenales. He works from his sister's car because his car is being repaired. He's requesting this loan to buy spare parts and also vegetables. He needs the income to get himself and his family ahead.

loans.use: Purchase of potatoes, cabbage, beets, and carrots

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat has applied for a loan for the 2nd time from Kiva partner Asasah. She wants to financially assist her husband in his crockery business. With the loan, her husband will buy more crockery to sell in his shop. His shop is located in the market and Nusrat is hopeful that an investment will bring more profits for her husband. 

Nusrat lives in a small city in Pakistan called Jaranwala. It is known for its agriculture industry. She lives there in a 2 roomed brick house in the area named Mughalpura. She moved here 3 years ago. She is the mother of 2 children. Her daughter is studying in kindergarten and her son is too young to attend to school. 

Nusrat has a buffalo at her home. She takes care of it and sells its milk to her neighboring clients. She also does sewing works to supplement the income of her family. She learned this art from her mother before marriage and it is now becomes a good source of making extra income. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Nusrat.

loans.use: To buy crockery for crockery selling business.

loans.name: Clarita's Group

texts.en:
Clarita G. is from the village of Libertad Echague. She is 47 years old. Clarita is the group leader of an 8-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Clarita G..

Clarita is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Clarita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector selling fruits and vegetables. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling fruit and vegetables to local community members. Clarita has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Clarita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Clarita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Clarita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Clarita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the PhilippI.. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Juanitas Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama JUANITAS,está ubicado en el Estado D. México.El grupo está conformado por 11 integrantes.L. señorita Sandra P. es integrante D. este grupo.Tiene 28 años, estudió L. secundaria,no es casada. ElL. lleva viviendo en L. comunidad 28 años y se dedica a L. venta D. abarrotes, esta actividad L. inicio hace 2 años. Sus clientes comentan que gracias a su negocio ya no tienen que caminar a L. tienda más cercana que estaba a casi 500 metros D. su colonia y por eso se sienten satisfechos comprandole. Al solicitar este prestamo elL. se siente motivada para poder cumplir con sus objetivos. Quiere este credito para comprar más mercancía y agrandar su negocio. L. señora que faltó en L. foto fue Olga B. y L. señora que se movio al momento D. tomar L. foto se llama Emma, se ubica atras D. L. señora D. blusa negra y pantalon rojo.
texts.en:
This group is called “Juanitas” and is located in the State of Mexico.  It’s maD. up of 11 members.  Ms. Sandra P. is 28 years old and a member of the group.  She is single and has a junior high school education.  She’s lived in this community her whole life and began selling groceries two years ago.

Her customers say that they no longer have to walk to the nearest store that was nearly 500 meters from the neighborhood, thanks to her business, and they feel comfortable buying from her.  Upon requesting this loan she felt motivated to be able to accomplish her goals.  She wants this loan so that she can buy more merchandise to grow her business.

Olga B. is missing from the photograph.  Emma is the woman who moved when the picture was taken.  She is behind the woman wearing a black top and red pants.

loans.use: Para comprar mercancía de abarrotes y refrescos.

loans.name: Ikram

texts.ar:
اكرام في عمر 44 سنة تعمل في محل لبيع الاحذية لها في عملها من اكثر من 3 سنوات فهي غير متزوجة ولكنها تسعى دائما
الى تطوير العائلة ونفسها فهي تعيل والدتها هي طموحة ونشيطة تحب العمل الدائم وتريد ان تطور نفسها وعملها
لها مع المجموعة تاريخ جيد وقد اثر القرض بشكل ايجابي على عملها وهي تريد طلب قرض من المجموعة بهدف شراء بضائع
جديدة من ثياب واحذية وغيره وزيداة المدخول حتى يزيد الربح لها زبائن كثر من محيطها وجيرانها وضيعتها
فهي مقصودة من نساء ضيعتها ومحبوبة
texts.en: Ikram is 44 years old. Although she isn’t married, she does support her mother and help out with her family. Ikram has been selling shoes for more than 3 years. She is very assiduous and driven and is always looking to develop herself and her work. She is very popular with the many women from her village who provide their patronage. Given her good standing with A. Majmoua, Ikram wanted to apply for another loan to purchase more inventory (clothing, shoes, etc.) to increase the revenues of her business.

loans.use: To purchase clothing, shoes, and other inventory

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli A., 50, is married to a farmer and has four children, one girl and three boys. 

To make a living, she grows rice for sale. She also grows vegetables at her farm. Aside from that, her family has a small piggery in their backyard and sells "ukay-ukay" (used clothes). Araceli works hard to provide the needs of her family.

Araceli is in need of additional fertilizer and feed. She has applied for a loan of 14,000 PHP from Kiva partner, CEVI. She is hopeful that this loan will help improve her harvest.

loans.use: To purchase additional fertilizers and feed

loans.name: Net

texts.en:
Mrs. Net P. was born in 1946, and she is a villager who lives in Lvea Sa Kandal village in Kandal province. She is a Khmer cheese seller in the market where she can earn a small income to support her family. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it. So she would like to ask for a loan to buy more Khmer cheese for her business. With this loan, she hopes to increase her income to improve her family's living conditions. 

She is a widow with one child who is a sugar seller and also helps out with her mother's business.

loans.use: To buy more Khmer cheese to sell

loans.name: Nob Sa Jëkër Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité NOB SA JËKËR est créé le 05 décembre 2007. Il est composé de 14 femmes qui sont issues du même quartier. Elles font toutes du petit commerce, elles vendent soit des poissons frais, des légumes, des vêtements, des bijoux etc. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de ARTILLERIE NDIABOT

Madame NDATTE D. (debout à droite de la photo, vêtue de noir) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 43 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants en charge. 

Elle fait du petit commerce en vendant du poisson frais au marché central de son quartier. Elle s'approvisionne sur place auprès des pêcheurs qui viennent d'autres villages. Elle pratique cette activité depuis environs 05 ans.

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de mieux développer son activité et escompter des bénéfices plus important qu'avant

Son objectif est d'augmenter son niveau d'épargne et de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
The Nob Sa Jëkër group was created on 5th December 2007. It is made up of 14 ladies who come from the same neighborhood. They all have small businesses, selling either fresh fish, vegetables, clothes or jewelry etc. The group belongs to the Banc Villageois in Artillerie Ndiabot.

Mrs. Ndatte D. (who is standing on the right of the photo and dressed in black) is in charge of the group. She is 43 years old, married and mother to five children, who are in her care.

She has a small business selling fresh fish at the central market in her neighborhood. She gets her supplies locally from fishermen who come from other villages. She has been carrying out this business for around five years. 

Her new loan will allow her to build up her business and make more profit than beforehand. Her aim is to increase her savings and help her husband to look after the family.

loans.use: To build up a small fish business

loans.name: Miujiza Group

texts.fr: Bwira B. est entrepreneur,leader du groupe d’affaire Miujiza,âgée de 40 ans,mariée,mère de 8 enfants qui étudient tous.Son mari est vendeur des habits (friperie).La  cliente  Bwira B.  fait aussi le petit commerce, parfois elle s’entraide avec son mari dans le commerce de friperie.Elle installe ses marchandises au marché sectoriel de Nyabushongo.Vers 1998,elle démarra son activité avec un fonds propre reçu de son mari.En 2009, elle bénéficia de premier crédit de l’IMF Hekima pour renforcer son capital.Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec des nouvelles marchandises des habits friperie(2 ballons de friperie). En plus,elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise, agrandir sa maison pour qu’elle soit spacieuse.La cliente Bwira B.  remercie l’IMF Hekima pour ses actions dédiées aux pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Le groupe Miujiza est constitué de 35 membres.
texts.en:
Bwira B. is an entrepreneur, and the leader of the Miujiza group. She's 40 years old, married, and the mother of eight children who are all studying. Her husband sells secondhand clothing. She sometimes helps her husband with his business, but she also retails on her own at the Nyabushongo sectoral market.

She started her business around 1998, with her own funds that she received from her husband. In 2009, she got her first loan from Kiva's partner, the Hekima MFI, in order to bolster her capital.

This new loan will be used to buy two bales of secondhand clothing. Additionally, she ambitions to expand her business and her home, to make it more spacious. Bwira B. thanks Hekima for its actions targeting poor women who do not get access to loans from regular banks. Miujiza group comprises 35 members.

loans.use: to buy two bales of secondhand clothing

loans.name: Rin

texts.en:
Rin S. is 25 years old and lives Siem Reap Province. She sells a few wares in front of her home. She sells items like soft drinks, sweets for kids, and some cooking supplies. To meet the family’s living expenses, her husband works as a boat driver. This couple has two school-aged children. 

Rin S.' house often needs to be repaired. She would like a loan to repair her old house.

loans.use: to repair her old house.

loans.name: Manushak

texts.en:
Manushak M. was born in 1966. She is a widow and she lives in Kapan city with her two sons. Manushak’s daughter is already married and she lives separately. Manushak’s younger son is a student. Her elder son helps Manushak in her business, which consists of fruits and vegetable trading in Kapan market. 

Previously, Manushak was engaged in clothes trading, but then she decided to change her business because she believes that food trading is more profitable. Part of Manushak's income goes towards her younger son’s education and another part is spent towards supporting her family. 

This is Manushak’s 7th loan from Nor Horizon. This time she is seeking a 600.000 AMD loan to buy tomatoes, cucumbers and fruits to resell.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, cucumbers and fruits to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 31-year-old single woman from Lebanon. She is living with her parents and three siblings. She has been working as a private teacher at her house since 2007. She has prepared a special education room with all the needed equipment to receive her students fittingly. 

In parallel, she has worked as an instructor in a local school since 2009. Her work is very important because she helps her father with the family expenses. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a laptop in order to facilitate her work preparation and do more research.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita S. is from the village of Sto. Niño. She is 64 years old. Rosita is widowed and has nine adult children. 

To make a living, Rosita owns and operates a retail store, selling animal feed and farm-related products. Rosita has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Rosita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Rosita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products like a table and a carving knife for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rosita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like a table and a carving knife.

loans.name: Cornelio Elias

texts.es:
Cornelio, es empleado de la Unión de exportadores y cultivo de maíz, vive con su esposa y su hijo; tiene 5 años de ser empleado y dos de dedicarse a cultivar maíz.
Actualmente necesita pagar el alquiler de terreno y prepararlo para dar inicio a la siembra, así mismo comprar abono y fertilizantes, para esto solicita un préstamo que cubra esta necesidad y le permita realizar la siembra en el tiempo adecuado.
Para él trabajar fuertemente es su objetivo, continuar cultivando para ayudar a su familia y junto progresar económicamente.
texts.en:
Cornelio is employed by the Exporters Union and farms corn.  He lives with his wife and son. He’s been employed for five years and has been farming corn for two.

He needs to pay for the leas of his field and to get it ready for planting and needs to buy manure and fertilizer.  To do so he’s asking for a loan that will meet this need and make it possible for him to plant in time.

His objective is to work hard and continue farming to help his family so that they can progress economically together.

loans.use: to pay land lease and to buy manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Chanthou

texts.en:
Chanthou is 42 years old and his wife, Sokgern is 41 years old; have been married since 1990 and have one son who is in university. They live in a village along National Road Number One about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Chanthou is a driver; he drives for the office of public work and transport. His wife is a chef; she cooks for a restaurant in Phnom Penh. Chanthou is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for his son to drive to school. 

Chantou and his wife are in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for his son to drive to school.

loans.name: Limata

texts.fr:
Limata est une femme âgée de 42 ans. Elle est mariée à un agent de douane en retraite. Ils ont un enfant. 
Limata a travaillé comme revendeuse depuis 2008. Elle vend des produits d'alimentation générale dans une petite boutique à la maison. Elle achète les produits au Grand Marché de Lomé. 
Limata a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter 2 cartons de lait, 2 cartons de sardines, 3 cartons de tomates, 8 cartons de macaroni, de la mayonnaise et du lait concentré.
texts.en: Limata is a 42 year-old mother of one who is married to a retired customs officer. She has sold food products from a small shop at her home since 2008.  She sources her goods from the large market at Lomé. She is seeking her first loan from WAGES in order to purchase 2 cartons of milk, 2 tins of sardines, 3 tins of tomatoes, 8 tins of macaroni, mayonnaise and evaporated milk.

loans.use: to purchase food products

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim is 26 years old and married. He has two children, the older of whom is two years old while the younger is only 6 days old. Kim is a farmer working in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. He has been growing rice for eight years now. He earns about 7000 PHP per month doing this farming.

Kim plans to use his loan to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor. He hopes to be able to save for his children's future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor.

loans.name: Chamwino Group

texts.en:
Sophia, who is in her early 40s, is single with two children and two grand childrren who are still at school. She has been a food vendor for 14 years.  She works from 6am to 8pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be her second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to increase her capital and bought more food stock. She has repaid her loan successfully. She wants a loan to buy more food stock for her business. Her dream is to one day be able to make her business grow. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "Chamwino" which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more food stock for her business.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio tiene 66 años de edad , es un hombre casado y muy trabajador. Vive en una comunidad urbana del distrito de Chiclayo y goza de muy buenas referencias dentro de ella. 

Julio es un hombre con deseos de mejorar su calidad de vida y es por ello que trabaja arduamente para desarrollar su negocio con éxito. Él se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (ovinos y aves), desde hace 10 años. Cuenta con clientela establecida en su comunidad y alrededores, pues la crianza que le da a sus animales es buena.

Julio solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar aves de 
corral y alimento balanceado para estas y los ovinos que posee. Julio tiene gran experiencia en su negocio y sabe que con este préstamo sus ventas aumentarán.

Julio es un hombre responsable y emprendedor. Este crédito le sería de gran utilidad.
texts.en:
Julio, 66, is a married, very hard working man.  He lives in an urban community in Chiclayo District.  He enjoys very good references within it.

Julio is a man who wants to improve his quality of life and this is why he works hard to develop his business successfully.  He’s been raising small yard animals to sell (sheep and fowl) for the last 10 years.  He has a well established base of regular customers in his community and surrounding areas because the care he gives his animals is good.

Julio is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1500 new sol loan to buy barnyard fowl and nutritionally balanced feed for them and for the sheep he has.  

Julio has quite a bit of experience in this business and he knows that the loan will help him sales to increase.  Julio is a responsible, enterprising man.  This loan will be of great use to him.

loans.use: to buy barnyard fowl and nutritionally balanced feed.

loans.name: Bayarsaikhan

texts.en:
Bayarsaikhan, age 41, lives with her family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. She operates a clothing retail stall at a local market and has made great progress in one year and half. 

She has fifteen years of experience in the clothing retail business as she used to operate a retail stall at the largest outdoor market of Mongolia, Narantuul until 2007. Bayarsaikhan started her current business after working in Korea for three years. She usually sells clothes imported from Beijing or Ereen, a border city in China.

She has children aged 18 and 13 who attend local schools and a 22-year-old son who works as a machinist at a local company. Her husband operates a small business in the town as well. 

Bayarsaikhan is requesting a 1,300,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to purchase more clothes for the upcoming season. She is a responsible and very neat person who intent on improving her family’s living standards and helping her children to become highly educated people in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for the upcoming season.

loans.name: Everlyn

texts.en: Everlyn is a hardworking 37-year-old business lady. She is married and blessed with an eight year old child who goes to school. To make a living, she has been selling second-hand clothes and eggs. She wants in the next five years to have opened up another business outlet. She is requesting a loan of 70,000 Kenya shillings to buy eggs. Thanks to Faulu Kenya she has been empowered economically.

loans.use: To buy eggs

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen has operated his cereals shop in Naivasha town for the last two years.  He is 52 years old, married to Dorcas, and they have one school-going child.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy three  sacks of maize and three sacks of beans to add to his stock for sale.

In future, Stephen hopes to grow his cereals shop and become a leading supplier of cereals in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy three sacks of maize and three  sacks of beans to sell.

loans.name: Asifiwe Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kavira, leader du groupe d’affaire «Asifiwe », est  entrepreneur, âgée de 40  ans, mariée, mère de 5 jeunes enfants, qui étudient. Son mari est un chauffeur dans un organisme. Elle est  vendeuse d’huile de palmes. Elle installe ses marchandises au marché communal Nyabushongo. Il y a 10 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  8 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Son premier capital fut 100$ reçu de son mari. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  5 fus d’huile de palmes à  marchander.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement  et agrandir son entreprise.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en:
The client, Kavira, the leader of the business group "Asifiwe", is an entrepreneur, 40 years old, married, mother of 5 young children, who study. Her husband is a driver in an organization. She is a seller of palm oil. She sets up her merchandise at the Nyabushongo communal market. 

Ten years have passed in which she has been carrying on small revenue-generating activities such as this. However, she has completed 8 loan cycles with Hekima. Her first capital was $100 received from her husband. The new loan serves to supply her with 5 casks of palm oil to sell. Further, she wishes to see her children grow up comfortably and to grow her enterprise. The client thanks Hekima for its actions in favor of poor women excluded by traditional banks.

loans.use: to pay for 5 casks of palm oil

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica, a hardworking businesswoman aged 36, is married and blessed with four children. For the last five years, she has been managing a butcher shop to support her family, employing three people to help her. Now requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy a cow for slaughter, Monica wants to expand her business within the next five years.

loans.use: to buy a cow for slaughter.

loans.name: Michel

texts.en:
Michel is a 20-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and one sibling. He started his career at a very young age working as a plumber. He is specialized in installing toilets, faucets, etc. This will be his second Kiva loan and he notes that his business productivity and income have increased since taking his first loan. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to renew his business tools. He is sure that the loan amount will help him fulfill his business objectives. In the future, he plans to open his own shop.

loans.use: to renew his plumbing business tools.

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formó gracias a una de las miembros. El motivo por el cual esta miembro se esforzó en formar este grupo fue la de querer ayudar a cada una de ellas ya que todas tienen ganas de salir adelante por todo el esfuerzo que están realizando en este pequeño lapso de tiempo que llevan dentro del comité, así también tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante. El comité cuenta con veinte 16 integrantes en donde todas tienen una pequeña actividad a la cual se dedican por mas pequeña que sea.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Maura, ella se dedica a la venta de artículos de primera necesidad, como ser fideos, arroz, panificados y demás con lo cual obtiene los ingresos para ayudar a su familia con los gastos diarios. Ella quiere seguir invirtiendo en su negocio por lo que solicita el préstamo.
Solicita la ayuda de la fundación para la compra de fideos, arroz, panificados y demás para el abastecimiento de su local.
texts.en:
This bank was formed thanks to one of the members.  This member made the effort to form this group because she wanted to help each one of them, since they all want very much to get ahead.  For all the effort they are making in this short period of time they've had the bank, she also wants very much to get ahead.  There are 16 bank members, and they all have a little job they work on, no matter how small.

One of the members is Maura.  She sells household necessities like vermicelli, rice, breads, and others, with which she gets the income to help her family with the daily expenses.  She wants to continue investing in her business, which is why she is requesting the loan.

She is requesting the foundation's support to buy vermicelli, rice, breads, and other products to supply her place.

loans.use: to buy sugar, vermicelli, breads, and other products.

loans.name: Irenia

texts.en:
Irenia is happily married and blessed with three school-age children. She lives is Balintawak, Aurora Zamboanga del Sur.

To earn a living, Irenia manages her agricultural business, planting and harvesting flowers for sale. In their villages, most of the people are engaged in this line of business. This is the primary source of living for Ms. Irenia.

She has been in this business for three years. She has a monthly income of PHP 3,000. Irenia is in need of financial assistance for her flower farm. She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase fertilizers and other farm equipments needed.

Irenia became a member of GDMPC this month only. Irenia plans that in the future, her business will be more productive so she can get a good return.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: El señor Miguel se dedica a la construcción es albañil contratista, esta casado y tiene un hijo en camino por lo que se siente feliz y motivado, vive en casa de sus suegros ubicado en la zona de Chimboco, el se dedica al servicio de construcción hace 2 años, el préstamo esta destinado para la compra de material de trabajo material de construcción y pinturas, el Sr. Miguel es un joven trabajador con ganas de superación se siente feliz por la oportunidad que se le brinda en la otorgación del  crédito.
texts.en:
Sr. Miguel works in construction as a bricklayer for hire. He is married and has a child on the way, which is why he is both happy and excited. Miguel lives at the home of his in-laws in the District of Chimboco.

He has been providing construction services for two years. This loan will be used to buy construction materials and paints for his work. Sr. Miguel is a hardworking young man who has the drive to succeed. He is happy to have this opportunity of being granted a loan.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and paints.

loans.name: Maria Jose

texts.es: En la ciudad de Leon,de 32 años de edad, vive Maria quien nos cuenta su experiencia obtenida atravez del prestamo Kiva, el cual le permitio hacer mejoras a su local, invirtio en compra de productos, fue una gran oportunidad para el mejorar su negocio y sus ingresos por lo cual esta muy agradecida. Ahora solicita un segundo credito para invertirlo en compra de arroz,aceite, azucar, pollo, carne, verduras, gaseosas. Pues son parte de los materiales que utiliza para hacer sus suculentos platillo que vende en su kiosko.Ella quiere ir haciendo poco a poco mejoras a su hogar y su negocio quiere diversificarlo pues tambien quiere vender mercaderia en general estos son parte de los proyectos que desea ir desarrollando a medida que su negocio progrese.
texts.en: Maria is 32 years old and lives in the city of Leon. She tells us of her experience with Kiva loans which allowed her to improve her food stall and invest in the purchase of products. It was a great opportunity to improve her business and her income for which she is very grateful. She is now asking for a second loan to invest in the purchase of rice, oil, sugar, chicken, meat, vegetables, soft drinks, as they are some of the ingredients she uses to make her succulent dishes which she sells in her kiosk. She wants to make improvements little by little to her house and she wants to diversify her business to also sell general merchandise. These are some of the projects she wants to develop as her business grows.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, chicken, meat, soft drinks.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
La señora Sofía cuenta con 22 años de edad y está casada con el señor mariano, con quien tiene 3 hijos, Alejandro, José y Alondra, los cuales cursan primer año de primaria y los dos menores primer y segundo año de preescolar, se dedica a la elaboración de manteles servilletas y huipiles, desde hace 1 año.
Ella dice que decidió iniciar con esta actividad, porque quería buscar la manera de apoyar en algo a su esposo y a sus hijos con sus estudios, para que puedan tener un mejor futuro, también para así gozar de una muy buena economía, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de mas material como son: hilos al mayoreo, telas, y mantas.
Uno de los sueños que tiene doña Sofía es el de hacer crecer mucho mas su negocio, y brindar un excelente servicio, para así contar con un  mayor número de clientes, y hacerse de más y mejores ingresos.
Dice que este es el mejor apoyo que habían podido darle, ya que gracias  a esto, ahora goza de una mejor calidad de vida y un buen negocio.
texts.en:
Sofía, 22, is married to Mariano and they have three children: Alejandro, José and Alondra.  They attend first grade and first and second grade of preschool.  She has been making tablecloths, napkins and huipiles [traditional blouses] for a year.


She says that she decided to start this activity because she wanted to find a way to help her husband a bit and to help with her children’s schooling so that they can have a better future and also to enjoy a better economy.  The loan she received will be used to buy more materials like: thread at wholesale, fabric and unbleached cotton. 


One of Sofía’s dreams is to make her business grow more and to provide excellent service so that she can have a larger number of customers and earn more and better income.  She says that this is the best possible support she could have gotten and thanks to it she now enjoys a better quality of life and a good business.

loans.use: to buy more material like thread at wholesale, fabirc and unbleached cotton.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya. She is 35 and has been in farming for five years in addition to her tailoring and retail shop business in the local market. Her farm produces milk and vegetables which she sells locally. She is married with three children ages between 11 and 23 years old.

Emily has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her increase the number of poultry birds so that she can enjoy the economies of scale that comes with high volume of operations. She says she will use the income to up lift the living standards of her children.

She mentions however that drought and animal diseases are the common challenges in farming.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Azucena Margarita

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Florón de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Renacer.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Azucena, ella tiene  48 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene cinco hijos, cuatro  mayores de edad y uno de 4 años. Su esposo tiene una vulcanizadora.

Ella aprovechando que su esposo tiene una vulcanizadora comenzó con su primer crédito un negocio de venta de tubos y llantas para automóviles, ella vende llantas nuevas o reencauchadas, trabaja en su negocio de lunes a sabados y nos cuenta que sus ventas están aseguradas ya que les vende a los clientes que llegan hasta donde su esposo para que le realice sus trabajos.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar llantas y tubos. Lleva 16 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y sin tantos requisitos.
 
Su sueño es un negocio mucho más estructurado.
texts.en:
In the citadel El Florón in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the city of the Royal Tamarind Trees, the members of the communal bank of Banco Comunal Renacer meet twice a month.

In this place we meet Azucena. She is 48 years old, married and from this relationship has five children, four older children and one who is four years old. Her husband has a tire repair shop. She took advantage of her husband having a tire shop when she began her first loan for a business selling tubes and tires for cars. She sells new tires or retreads. She works in her business from Monday to Saturday and tells us that her sales are certain because she sells them to customers that have come to her husband to give him work.

This loan will be used to buy tires and tubes. She has been a member of the communal bank for sixteen years and she likes it because the loans are fast and without many requirements.

Her dream is a more orderly business.

loans.use: to buy tires and tubes

loans.name: Marianela

texts.es:
Marianela de 24 años convive con Jean, su pareja con quien tiene 1 hija llamada Sarely. Ellos viven en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa San Román Bajo en el distrito de Perené, provincia de Chanchamayo. Ella trabaja mucho. La agricultura es su vida por que desde niña creció rodeada de plantaciones de café. A eso se dedicaban sus padres y ella, fiel a ese ejemplo también lo hace.
Marianela contenta, comenta que tiene 4 parcelas de terrenos, en ellos siembra solo café. A todos sus cultivos cuida por igual y siempre le ha ido bien en las ventas. Muchas veces, cuando el precio bajaba tenía problemas pero nunca perdía su inversión.  Ella y su pareja trabajan juntos, pero no es suficiente, por ello invierten en la contrata de personal operario para apresurar las jornadas. “Obtengo de 35 a 40 sacos de mis chacras (terrenos). Me va bien”, dice.
Ella tiene planes que los realizará en poco tiempo. Para ello arrendará tierras para aumentar su producción de café, por que es muy rentable. De esa manera brindará a su familia la estabilidad económica que tanto aspira. Sería la primera vez que Marianela accedería a un préstamo de MFP. Se responsabiliza de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Se siente contenta de pertenecer al banco comunal “La Bella Durmiente”.
Con el dinero podrá comprar 7 bolsas de abonos orgánicos y pagará los servicios de los jornaleros para cultivar sus sembríos de café.
texts.en:
Marianela is 24 years old and lives with her partner, Jean, with whom she has a daughter named Sarely. They live in a house that they own in the native community of San Román Bajo, located in the Perené district and the Chanchamayo province. She works a lot and agriculture is her life since she grew up surrounded by coffee plantations. Her parents worked in coffee production and following their example, she does as well.

Marianela is content and she says that she has four parcels of land where she only grows coffee. She cares for all of her crops equally and she has always done well in sales. When prices have fallen, she has had several difficulties but she never lost her investment. She and her partner work together but it is not enough, which is why they hire operations staff to speed up the work. “I get 35-40 sacks from my fields. I do well”, she says.

She has plans for the short term, including renting land to increase her coffee production, as it is very profitable. This way, she will provide her family with the financial support she has been longing for. This will be Marianela’s first loan with MFP and she promises to make her repayments on time. She is happy being a member of La Bella Durmiente Communal Bank.

With this loan, she will be able to buy seven sacks of organic fertilizer and pay the day laborers for working her coffee fields.

loans.use: to buy seven sacks of fertilizer and to hire day laborers.

loans.name: Mahmadhakim

texts.ru: Махмадхаким занимается выращиванием сельхозпродуктов. Он женат и ответственный отец четверых детей. В основном Махмадхаким выращивает лук, пшеницу, картофель и кукурузу. Он имеет пятилетний опыт работы и знает все нормативы посева. Данный момент Махмадхаким запрашивает займ для покупки минеральных удобрений, ГСМ и семян для предстоящего посева. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Mahmadhakim is involved in growing agricultural crops.  He is married and is a responsible father of four children.  Mahmadhakim primarily grows onions, wheat, potatoes and corn.  He has five years of work experience and knows all of sowing standards.  Currently, Mahmadhakim is requesting a loan to purchase mineral fertilizers, fuel and seeds for the upcoming sowing.  He relies on your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers, seeds and fuel

loans.name: Olimpia Marisol

texts.es: Marisol es una mujer divorciada vive con sus dos hijos en Esmeraldas, Ecuador. En Quinindé, un cantón donde el clima es seco y caliente, la antigüedad del cantón permite a las personas descansar durante los viajes por ser un lugar preciso sobre la carretera que conecta a las provincias de Quito y Santo Domingo. En este lugar la agricultura y la ganadería se destacan como las principales actividades que realizan sus habitantes, Marisol tiene desde hace 8 años una carnicería en este cantón para poder atender a sus hijos que van a la escuela y hacer crecer la economía familiar. Ella trabaja 8 hora diarias para poder mantener el negocio, a lo largo de los años se ha enfrentado con muchas dificultades económicas que la han hecho pasar malos momentos, sin embargo han podido salir adelante en familia. Uno de sus anhelos más grandes como madre y como mujer es poder apoyar a sus hijos con este negocio y hacerlo crecer para demostrarles que es posible salir adelante y conseguir sus sueños a pesar de las dificultades, que con mucha energía disposición las metas se pueden lograr. Le brindamos nuestro apoyo a Marisol para que pueda hacer crecer su negocio y lograr sus metas.
texts.en:
Marisol is a divorced woman living with her two children in Esmeraldas, Ecuador.  In Quinindé, a canton with dry, hot climate, the antiquity of the canton permits people to rest during trips because it’s a beautiful place alongside the highway connecting the provinces of Quito and Santo Domingo.  In this place agriculture and animal husbandry stand out as the main activities residents carry out.

Marisol has had a butcher shop for 8 years in this canton to take care of her children who attend school and to make the family’s economy grow.  She works 8 hours daily to be able to stay in business.  Along these years she’s faced many economic difficulties that caused her to go through some bad moments.  However, she’s managed to get ahead as a family.  

One of her greatest wishes as a mother and as a woman is to be able to help her children by means of this business and to make it grow to show them that it’s possible to get ahead and reach your dreams despite difficulties; that with much energy and willingness goals can be met.

We give Marisol our support so that she can make her business grow and she can reach her goals.

loans.use: to invest in her butcher shop.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy W. is 42 years of age and married with twelve children. Two are independent, one is in college, three in secondary school and four in primary school and the rest are still too young for school. She loves her family and works very hard to provide the basic needs to her children despite so many challenges.

She is among the pioneers of Ngondo Rahab womens group and she has managed to pay back 3 loans already. She sells bananas to the neighboring schools and hospital. Besides this business, she grows vegetables, potatoes and maize on a small piece of land.

Her husband is an office messenger at one of the schools in that village. He is supportive, though his salary is very small. He assists her to look after the planted crops and marketing of the produce. Lucy got a small tender to supply two schools with bananas and this requires more money which she does not have right now. She is getting bananas on credit to clear when she is paid but the prices are inflated because of buying on credit. She believes when she gets the loan, her business will enable her to pay school fees without much struggle.

loans.use: Lucy wants to stock her banana business and to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Seymur

texts.en: Seymur is the resident of Beylagan town. He is boing business selling shoes in the market, in his own booth. In 2004 he applied to Normicro Beylagan branch and borrowed $300. He expanded the business and increased the variety of shoes. Last loan was in amount of $700. Now he needs $1200$ to enlarge the booth and increase the volume of sales.

loans.use: To enlarge the space

loans.name: Seeti

texts.en: Seeti is a 67-year old widow and works hard to remain financially independent.  While it is rare for a senior woman to work for a living and have independent financial security, Seeti does it via her weaving business.  Seeti weaves in the traditional Samoan way.  Women weavers are less common today than when Seeti was young, but there remains high demand for her fine mats.  People place orders with Seeti for special occasions, such as weddings and funerals.  She can earn up to ST 400 (about USD 160) per week with her mat sales.  Seeti is passionate about remaining independent and not relying on her children for financial support, and loan funds will help her do this.  Micro-loan facilities have ensured that Seeti can continue to purchase enough raw materials to fill her orders in a timely manner.

loans.use: Buy weaving materials

loans.name: Maria Del Rocío

texts.es:
Maria del Rocio is 41 years old. She and her husband have a daughter, who works together with her father in a refinery. Recently, this family was able to purchase their own home, but the payments that they make have significantly impacted their income. Two years ago, Maria began selling groceries in order to help her husband pay the bills. Her husband and daughter help her as time allows.

Though her store is small, Maria believes that it will grow if she can offer better merchandise on display shelves, and if she can increase the variety of the products that she offers for sale. In order to do this, she is asking for a $475 loan which she will repay in 6 months. Please help Maria’s store to gain momentum by supporting her. She and her family thank you.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria del Rocío tiene 41 años de edad, es casada y tiene una hija, la cual trabaja en una refinería junto con su padre. Hace poco les fue posible adquirir su propia vivienda, pero los pagos que realizan han disminuido considerablemente el ingreso que recibe esta familia, para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos, Maria inició con la venta de abarrotes hace 2 años, donde recibe la ayuda de su esposo e hija cuando tienen tiempo disponible.

Su tienda es pequeña pero Maria desea hacerla creer y sabe que podrá hacerlo si muestra mejor la mercancía en estantes e incrementa la variedad de productos que ofrece, para esto solicita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que se compromete a regresar en 6 meses. Ayuda a Maria a darle un impulso a su negocio, decídete a apoyarla, ella y su familia te lo agradecen mucho.

loans.use: Purchase of displays and merchandise

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
My name is Miguel. I am an entrepreneur and I own a small diary products business, that I sell as an ambulant vendor. I have been doing this for several years now, and it generates the income I need to pay for the family expenses.

It is important to know that with the income from this business, I have improved my home and this way improved the living standard of my family.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer

Original loan description in Spanish:

Mi nombre es miguel, soy comerciante, cuento con un pequeño negocio de venta de productos lacteos, los que distribuyo de manera ambulante, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me permite genera ingreso para cubrir los gastos de mi familia.

Es importante mensionar que con las utilidades de este negocio he mejorado mi vivienda, logrando asi un mejor nivel de vida para mi familia.

loans.use: To buy cheese, butter, and cream cheese

loans.name: Seupepe

texts.en: Seupepe is a single mother of four children. She is having a difficult time raising her children especially in terms of money. Seupepe's family lived on a plantation which was their only source of income. This will be Seupepe's second loan and she has been putting her first loan to good use. Seuppepe is requesting a $500 loan to buy supplies for her taro plantation. a Seupepe is also planning to start a cattle farm in the future, which she believes will become a strong family business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her taro plantation

loans.name: Ros

texts.en: Mr. Ros P., age 55, works on a plot of farmland growing crops, making $2 per day. His wife works at a garment factory, earning $3 each day. They have two children who are also employed at a factory, making about $120 per month each. He would like to request a loan of $500 in order to purchase seeds and fertilizer for his crop to make his farm more productive. He hopes that his income level will increase when he can sell additional crops to the middleman. His wife is pictured with their son as Mr. Ros P. was not available at the time.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer for his crop to make his farm more productive.

loans.name: Shahodat

texts.ru:
K. Shahodat is married and has 8 children. She has been a client of MicroInvest since 2006. Using the first loan she bought a young bull and sold it 4 months later. Her husband was unemployed, and using her income, she was able to purchase him a ticket to Russia, where he could find a job. She has a large family and only her income previously allowed them to get sufficient amount of food and clothing. Her husband currently makes $200 a month and sends $100 to his family in Tajikistan.

Shahodat used the funds from the last loan to purchase a cow. Now her children drink fresh milk every morning. She wants to receive a new loan to purchase 2 more cows for the purpose of breeding.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Кундузова Шаходат –замужем и имеет 8 детей. Клиент «Микроинвеста» с начало 2006 года. На первый полученный кредит она купила бычка и продала после 4 месяцев откорма. Муж был безработным,на полученный доход она купила билет, и отправила мужа на заработки в Российскую федерацию на заработки. Семья большая и только ее доход позволял им нормально питаться и одеваться. Муж на данный момент зарабатывает около 200$ в месяц и отправляет домой жене и детям по 100$ каждый месяц. На последний полученный кредит клиентка купила корову. Теперь ее дети каждое утро пьют свежее молоко. Она хочет получить новый кредит и купит 2 коровs и получить потомство (телят).

loans.use: Purchase of 2 cows for breeding

loans.name: Mukim

texts.ru:
Mukim O. is 40 years old, has finished college with a degree in accounting, is married and has 4 children. Mukim has been running a small cafe for the last 10 years. He is planning to use the loan to fix the building in which his cafe is located and purchase a heater for the space. This loan will allow him to improve the appearance of his cafe and the people who use it will be able to dine in a warm and clean atmosphere. Even now his cafe is a busy spot since it is located on the roadside between Rudaki and Dushanbe, capital of Tajikistan. Mukim is planning to pay back his loan in the next 18 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Одинаев Муким, возраст – 40 лет, образование – высшее, по специальности бухгалтер, женат, имеет 4-х детей. Муким имеет небольшую столовую. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 10 лет. Полученный кредит он хочет использовать для проведения текущего ремонта своей столовой и приобретение печки для обогрева. Данный кредит поможет ему улучшить условия своей столовой, а люди приодящие сюда чтобы пообедать, смогут это сделать в тепле и чистоте. В его столовой бывают много посетителей, так как она находится на обочине дороги Душанбе-Рудаки. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 18 месяцев.

loans.use: fixing the space and purchase of a heater

loans.name: Carmen Teresa

texts.es:
Carmen is 46 years old and dedicates herself to the sale of cosmetics from the Yanbal and Avon lines. Her husband has a little artisan factory of plastics connectors for glass tables. Her family is comprised of her, her husband, and their son. The family lives near the town of Urkupina which is quite far from the city. Both have worked more than 3 years in their respective areas, and there is quite a bit of competition, but there is sufficient demand for all types of products reasonably priced. Carmen and her husband are trying to keep up with there promises and obligations. The prices vary depending on the quality and type of product. This is the second loan they have take out with our institution and until now they have had a good credit and repayment history. They actually have another line of credit which they regularly pay.

Translated by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

Carmen es una señora de 46 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de la Línea de Yanbal y Avon, su esposo tiene una pequeña fábrica artesanal de uniones de plásticos para mesas de vidrio. Su familia está compuesta por ella su esposo y un hijo, la familia vive por el barrio Urkupiña en el Plan 3000, zona que está bastante alejada de la ciudad además de ser de condiciones muy humildes. Ambos trabajan más de 3 años en sus respectivas actividades. Existe bastante competencia pero así también hay demanda para todotipo de productos de acuerdo a sus costos, Carmen y su esposo logran cumplir con estas actividades todos sus compromisos y obligaciones. Los precios varian dependiendo de la calidad y el tipo de producto, generalmente se manejan los que rige el mercado. Este es el segundo préstamo de Carmen con nuestra Institución y hasta el momento ha presentado un comportamiento aceptable en el cumplimiento de pagos. Actualmente tiene otro crédito en una entidad financiera mismo que lo paga regularmente.

loans.use: Capital for work

loans.name: María

texts.es:
It is with much effort and sacrifice that Maria Martinez Chavarria, a young mother of 2, has been able to look after her kids, and provide what they need. Her husband also helps to cover the household costs, as he is a farmer in the county of Achuapa, which is where they currently live. Achuapa is a community without electricity as it is very far from an urban centre. Even so, this has not stopped Maria Martinez, and she has acquired a solar panal to provide light.

In order to cancel this debt she has asked for a loan from Ceprodel and so that the panal can continue to be used by their kids who so need your help.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio la joven madre de dos hijos Maria M. Chavarria ha logrado cuidar a sus pequeños y velar por sus necesidades y de igual manera las necesidades del hogar gracias al apoyo de su querido esposo que se dedica a la agricultura en el municipio de Achuapa que es donde viven actualmente. El municipio de Achuapa es una comunidad que no posee energía eléctrica por condiciones de lejanía de la zona urbana, sin embargo esto no ha sido impedimento para la dama Maria M. ya que ha adquirido un panel solar para su respectiva iluminación.

Para cancelar dicha deuda ha solicitado crédito en Ceprodel con el único fin de cancelar esta deuda y utilizar el panel sin ningún problema beneficiando directamente a sus hijos que tanto necesitan de su apoyo

loans.use: To pay for a solar panal/Pago de panel solar

loans.name: Orlando Cornelio

texts.es:
Orlando has been a tailor for 17 years. He began his business as a laborer in the Trajes Gómez tailor shop. He lives in the Omar Truillo neighborhood, is 52 years old, married, and has 6 children who work. With the loan he will buy more fabrics to offer his customers and thereby continue working with his family so they will have everything they need in their home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. Orlando es sastre con 17 años de experiencia, su negocio lo inicio a través de que laboraba en un taller de costura Trajes Gómez. El habita en el barrio Omar Trujillo tiene 52 años de edad es casado le tienen 6 hijos que trabajan. Con el préstamo Su objetivo es comprar mas materia prima para ofertar más a sus clientes y así seguir trabajando con su familia para que falte nada en su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase fabric

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en: Khursheed Baji is the wife of R. M. and has been living in a famous city called Kasur for the last 25 years. She is the mother of seven children: four daughters and three sons. All of her sons are enrolled in a local school. Khursheed Baji’s daughters are all married. She is a housewife and looks after her buffaloes. Her husband has the business in animal food. Her husband’s monthly income is $150. She also makes embroidered ribbons, used to tie-up hair and sells them in a big market. Her earnings are $50 in a month. She applies for a loan for her husband to buy animal food to sell in the market and earn a good profit.

loans.use: Improve the financial condition

loans.name: Eva Beatriz

texts.es:
Eva M. has worked in this sector (owner of bodega or small grocery store) for 16 years. Her husband is a driver. They have two small children. Eva has been an Emprender client since 2002, initially as recipient of a group loan. Later she took a break from the group before finally becoming an individual borrower. Currently she is in the ninth sequence and has made her payments in good faith.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

La sra, Eva M. trabaja en esa actividad hace 16 años, el esposo es transportista, tiene dos hijos pequeños, ella es cliente de Emprender desde el año 2002, con grupo solidario, luego descanso algun tiempo para retornar con crédito individual, actualmente se encuentra en la 9a. secuencia, demostrando responsabilidad en sus pagos.

loans.use: Purchase groceries in bulk to stock her business

loans.name: Raimbek

texts.ru:
Raimbek O. lives in the Rudaki region. He is married and has 4 children. Raimbek has a college education and is a teacher by profession. He does not work in his profession and instead purchases and sells fruits and melons. It is currently the season for melons and watermelons and Raimbek would like to purchase products for sale. After discussing it with those close to him, Raimbek decided to take out a 12 month loan. By filling his sales location with goods, Raimbek will increase his income.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Одинаев Раимбек житель района Рудаки. Женат ,имеет 4 детей. Образование высшее, по специальности учитель.Но по специальности на работает, клиент занимается кплей продажей фруктов и бахчевых культур.Так как сейчас сезон продажи дынь и арбузов клиент хочет закупить товар.Посоветовавшись с близкими клиент решил взять кредит сроком на 12 месяц.Пополнив товаром свою торговую точку Раимбек будет получать больше дохода .

loans.use: Purchase melons and watermelons for sale

loans.name: Hana

texts.en: Hana is a widow and she lives alone in Klokotnica near the town Gračanica. She is 63 years old and receives a pension in the amount of 540 KM. She has one cow, and she can earn 200 KM more by selling milk and milk products. Hana asked for her second loan at WWI in the amount of 1000 KM in order to buy hay and vaccines for the cow. Hana is very happy because she has this cow. She spends a lot of free time with the cow, and she wants to ensure that her cow is healthy and satisfied during the winter.

loans.use: To buy hay and vaccines

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora es socia del Banco Comunal Magnolia.

Teodora es viuda, tiene 50 años y 6 hijos, Teodora viaja a las ferias de la región como Putaja, Cangallo y los días domingos en la feria de las Américas, en donde vende ropa variada que adquiere en la ciudad de Lima a donde viaja cada fin de mes y aprovecha cada viaje para llevar cereales y tubérculos que vende en los mercados de Lima. Además Teodora tiene una mototaxi que alquila y diariamente cobra.

Teodora necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de maíz, papa. Los sueños de Teodora son ahorrar para construir su casa, que su negocio crezca más.
texts.en:
Teodora is a member of the Magnolia Communal Bank. She is a widow, 50 years old and has 6 children. Toedora travels to the regional fairs like Putaja and Cangallo and on Sundays she goes to the fair of the Americas where she sells a variety of clothes that she adquires in Lima. Teodora travels to Lima at the end of the month and takes advantage of the trip by bringing cereals and tubers that she sells at the marekets in Lima. She also has a mototaxi that she rents and charges a daily fee.

Teodora needs a 1400 soles (Peruvian currency) loan. She will invest the money on buying corn and potatoes. Her dreams are to be able to save enough money to build a house and that her business keeps growing.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Teodora needs a 1400 soles (Peruvian currency) loan, money that she will invest in buying corn and potatoes.

loans.name: Iris
