texts.es: Iris, en  la actualidad tiene 25 años, es madre de una hija de 6 años, que ha empezado sus estudios y es su aspiración de seguir  luchando en su negocio. Su pareja Joe, siempre la apoya en lo posible, y está de acuerdo con sus propósitos. Iris se dedica a la venta de ropa y a la exportación, al por mayor, de medias solo para  niñas, es una  joven madre que desde muy temprana edad se inició en el comercio, es por eso que en la actualidad cuenta con una gran clientela, gracias a su buena atención y forma de convencer para que lo compren sus productos. Además de querer seguir surgiendo en su negocio con el alquiler de un local para este, quiere mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda, sin embargo, no cuenta con lo suficiente para lograr lo que desea, es por eso que estima de un capital para poder cumplir con su objetivo. Ayuda esta joven madre que demuestra su interés de seguir  adelante.
texts.en:
Iris, now 25, is the mother of a 6-year-old daughter who has started school and who is her inspiration to keep struggling to increase her business. Her partner, Joe, always supports her as much as possible, and agrees with her proposals. Iris sells clothing and exports girl's stockings wholesale. She is a young mother who started in business very young, which is why she now has a large clientele, thanks to her good service and her ability to sell her products. In addition to desiring to keep her business growing by renting shop space, she also wants to improve the substructure of her home. Nevertheless, she does not have enough to accomplish her desires, which is why she wants a loan in order to achieve her objective. Help this young mother who shows such interest to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To rent shop space to sell clothing, as well as to increase her merchandise

loans.name: Luu Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Lưu Thị T. năm nay 51 tuổi, là thành viên của Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2003. Trong suốt 5 năm tham gia Quỹ chị T. luôn là thành viên gương mẫu, hoàn trả đúng quy định và chấp hành tốt các quy chế của Quỹ. Hiện tại công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị là buôn bán thịt lợn, chăn nuôi và lương thợ xây của chồng. Với mức thu nhập 4.000.000đ  gia đình chị T. hiện là một trong những hộ gia đình thành viên  có thu nhập ổn định nhất trong Cụm.
Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay  9.000.000 để mua lợn về thịt cung cấp nguồn thực phẩm cho bà con địa phương.
texts.en:
Ms. Luu Thi Hanh is 51 years old, and has been a member of TYM fund since 2003. In the 5 years she has been with the fund, she has always been a model member, paying back the loans on time, and implementing the fund's regulations. Presently, her family's main source of income is from raising pigs, selling their meat, and from her husband's job as a carpenter. With average income of 245 USD per month, her family is one of the families in the fund that have the most stable income. For this loan, she wishes to borrow 550 USD to purchase additional pigs to raise and selling their meat to the local people.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Yawo

texts.en:
Yawo N. is a single young man of 19 with a strong entrepreneurial spirit. He started his business 2 years ago and has been very successful selling shirts in the central market of Wome. Wome is a small village in Togo located approximately 130 miles from the capital.

Yawo has asked for this loan from FECECAV to expand his business by diversifying his inventory. Yawo hopes to sell t-shirts, shirts with collars, and also begin offering other small products such as batteries and prepaid cellphone cards. He believes this diversified inventory will differentiate his business from other vendors in the market. With the increased revenue he will earn from expanding his business, Yawo hopes to begin saving money to start a family.

loans.use: Expand business by diversifying inventory

loans.name: Kehinde

texts.en: Kehinde sells motor spare parts and engine oil. She has been in this business for a long time. She needs the loan amount of 140,000 to purchase more engine oil to sell. Kehinde is 50 years old and married with children. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more engine oil to sell

loans.name: Liep

texts.en: Mrs. Liep K. lives in the Ro Neam Tnort village in the Takeo province. She is 56 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is a farmer while the other three attend the local school. She is a farmer who now faces a problem because her field is infertile.  So she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to make her crops more productive.  Her husband, Mr. Nop Hol, is a duck breeder who can make a little income through this business activity.  He is in the picture on the right.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to make her crops more productive.

loans.name: Baby Lou

texts.en:
Baby Lou is diligently looking for every opportunity that she can find for an alternative source of income. At present she is maintaining a hog-raising business and she can see that it has a big potential to become productive. For the improvement of her business, she would like to request at least PHP 5,000. She will use the loan to purchase feed for her hogs. She believes that she has a lot of things to do and for her “time is gold”, that she needs to make the most out of it for the welfare of her family.

She and her family are living in Barangay (township) San Lorenzo, Ilagan, Isabela. Her husband Raffy is a corn and rice farmer. The couple is blessed with one daughter named Ashley Faye, one year old.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pig raising

loans.name: Um

texts.en: Um T., pictured here with her oldest daughter, is 55 years old. She has a business selling rice noodles and porridge from her home to earn approximately $15 in revenue per day. Her husband and two of her children are chicken sellers at the market. On average, they typically make $100 every day in revenue. Um T. is asking for a loan to purchase chickens and ducks to sell at the market.

loans.use: Buy chickens and ducks

loans.name: Sophoan

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophoan T. is a farmer cultivating rice on a small piece of land that she owns in Thmor Keo Village in Takeo Province.  She is also a vegetable seller in the local market. Sophoan wants to expand her business since it is doing well, but she needs a reliable means by which to transport her vegetables to market. She is therefore requesting a loan to buy a motorbike for that purpose. 
	
Sophoan is a 29-year-old mother of two, both of whom are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport goods to market.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a "bites"--maandazi (sweet fried breads) and kachori- (spicy Indian snacks)--seller in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar. She belongs to Tupendane group loan (Group code 2005). She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 50. Daily she works at her business.

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal for sale and flour for making bites, to expand her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Salma is 30 years old, married, and has three children: ages 9, 6, and 3.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal  for sale and flour for making bites, to expand her business

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort A., forty-nine, is a married woman with three children. Comfort lives with her family at Kasoa in Ghana. She runs a grocery kiosk in her neighborhood. She has been in business for two years. Comfort buys her goods from wholesalers for retailing to her customers in the community where she lives.

Comfort wants a bigger working capital. She desires to buy goods in bulk whenever she travels to the city in order to save her the problem of frequent trips. She is a member of a group called “Enye Ho” trust group. The group members guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan and provide support in handling repayment.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk.

loans.name: Shiringul

texts.ru: Ширингул Давлатова более 10 лет занимается торговлей. Она имеет собственный продуктовый магазин. Замужем, имеет 8 детей. Муж находится на заработках в России, он также каждый месяц высылает деньги. Проживает она в районе Явана. По бизнесу ей помогают дети. Клиентка просит у нас кредит, чтобы закупить продукты питания.
texts.en:
Shiringul D. has worked for over 10 years in retail. She owns her own grocery store. She is married and has eight children, who help with the business. Her husband is working in Russia, and sends money home every month. She lives in the Yavan district. Shiringul is requesting a loan to stock up on groceries for the store.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Liliana Zoraida

texts.en:
Mrs. Liliana A. is 27 years old, and has been with Claudio Alvarenga for five years, with whom she has a four-year-old son. 

Before, Liliana worked as a secretary in a boutique but, with the support of her parents, she was able to open her own tailor shop. She has a well-formed clientele and makes a variety of suits for women.

In the future, she would like to get a larger space in order to give better attention to her clients. She would also like to go to college, as she has not been able to yet.

loans.use: To purchase silk fabric, lining for dresses, and thread

loans.name: Anar Gul

texts.en:
The man who is pictured is Anar Gul, the son of A.. He lives in Bagrami, Kabul Afghanistan. He is married and has four children. He is a farmer and an educated man as well. He is involved in this business since 1999, so he has the experience of 10 years in farming. He likes to work hard and earn money to bring changes in both business and life.

Anar Gul wants to take an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani to buy more seeds and the required tools for farming.

Finally, he would like to state that Kiva is a best process that supports the entrepreneurs.

loans.use: For buying more seeds and tools.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad S. is from the village of San Roque, Bukidnon. She is 48 years old. Natividad is single and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Natividad owns & operates a business peddling specialty food products, specifically snacks, in the local community. Natividad has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Natividad joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Natividad is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make her products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Natividad from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children and supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients

loans.name: Joab's Group

texts.en:
This is the United Youth Association is a Pearl Microfinance lending group, led by Joab T..

Joab is a 31-year-old married man with two children, age four and nine. Both are in primary school. For six years, Joab has run a brewing business in Rwenyina Cell Kitagata Kyeiziiba. Since he did not have the necessary materials and equipment to do the job himself, Joab started by helping his fellow colleagues in the same business. This allowed him to set aside savings, which enabled him to start a business of his own. He ensures that the hygiene conditions at his workplace are good, and this attracts more and more customers.

He is able to make weekly profits of 80,000 from bulk sales as well as from customers who drink his beer products on site: this is currently at his home, but as soon as he has enough money saved to allow for it, he hopes to open up a dedicated location in the town of Bagenyi, where he can also stock more of his increased product output. He wishes to continue growing his savings, which he hopes will allow his children to complete university.

At the moment, Joab needs to buy more bananas for beer-making so as to increase output.

loans.use: To buy more bananas for making beer for sale.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia C. is from the village of Baluarte, Lumbia Cagayan De Oro City. She is 36 years old. Emelia is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Emelia owns and operates a variety store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of products in the local community. Sometimes she also does food vending as her sideline. Emelia has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Emelia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Emelia is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Emelia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children and pay her weekly obligation.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Baluarte, Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Mirtha Teresa

texts.en:
Mirtha is a member of the United Friends village bank. 
She is 44 years-old, married, and has two children who are 18 and 15 years-old. The eldest child studies at an institute while the youngest studies at the public school. 
Mirtha began working in a retail shop as a salesperson. She worked there for many years but had to quit that job because her mother, who was caring for her children, got cancer and passed away. Shortly after, she started working out of her house, selling groceries like rice, sugar, milk, noodles in a cart. Her business grew until she was able to convert part of her house into a convenience store. Since joining FINCA, her business has improved and she has a variety of merchandise. 
Mirtha needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy rice, sugar, detergent, and cases of beer. Her dream is to sell beer wholesale.

loans.use: buy rice, sugar, detergent, and cases of beer.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 39 years old and married with 3 children. She sells baking items and has been in the business for the past 2 years. She hopes for the loan amount of N 100, 000 to purchase more baking items to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more baking materials to sell

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel B. is from the village of Gingoog. She is 40 years old. Raquel is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Raquel owns  and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Raquel has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Raquel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Raquel is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand the product offering at her store. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Raquel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand the product offering at her store

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita C. is from the village of Poblacion. She is 55 years old. Tita is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Tita owns & operates a snack vending business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Tita has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2004, Tita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tita has successfully repaid previous loans from PMPC. Tita is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 14th loan taken out by Tita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her income.

About PMPC:   Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients and other supplies needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Aleydith

texts.es:
La señora Aleydith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de la Colina II”, Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 33 años y 03 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Aleydith, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, es una mujer que poco a poco, fue incrementando su propio negocio y haciéndose mas conocida por sus clientes. Las ganas de salir adelante le dieron buenos resultados. En la actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y nos cuenta que le va muy bien. Aleydith, vende sus productos de belleza de diferentes líneas como: Unique, Esika, Avon y se siente muy contenta con lo que hace.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,800.00, comprará productos de belleza para su stock como, perfumes para damas y caballeros, cremas, polvos compactos, lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas,  asimismo otra vitrina para exhibir  sus productos.

Aleydith,  a su edad es un ejemplo a seguir de muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio y a otras mujeres a crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Señora Aleydith belongs to the communal bank "Mujeres de la Colina II," which is located in the Banda de Shilcayo district in the San Martin province in the San Martin region. She is married, 33 years old, and has 3 dependent children. Aleydith sells cosmetics and she is a woman who, little by little, has increased her business, making it more well-known to her customers. Her drive to get ahead has brought about good results. Currently, she continues with her business and she tells us that it is going very well. Aleydith sells a variety of brands of beauty products, including lines such as Unique, Esika, and Avon. She feels very content with what she does. With this loan of 1,800 soles nuevos she will buy beauty products to increase her inventory such as: perfumes for women and men, creams, compacts (powders), lipstick, nail polish, and another glass case to exhibit her products. Aleydith, at her age, is an example for many women to follow, in that she started her own business and with perseverance she is managing to reach for her dreams. She is very grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos organization for helping her to start her business, and for helping other women to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy beauty products

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is single and sells children and men’s wear in a shop which he rents and is located in the central market area. After graduating from high school, Emmanuel has been doing business for about six years now.

In order to respond to the needs of his customers, Emmanuel is seeking a loan to buy more stock for his shop. Quite apart from buying more stock, he intends to use proceeds from the loan to buy a plot of land which he has already identified and to save some money to marry his longtime girl friend. He spends his entire time in the business.

loans.use: To buy  clothing

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly N.'s main source of income comes from selling firewood and wood-related products in her community. She is 48 years old, married and has eight school-age children. They are from the village of Bonifacio, Lugait, Misamis Oriental. Nelly has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Nelly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Nelly is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ang

texts.en: Ang C. is a single man who currently lives with his parents and his three siblings, who are working as farmers and silk weavers. Ang C. works to farm rice as well as weaving silk skirts, from which he earns a living. Recently he has exhausted his silk stock and he is looking for a loan to be used to buy more silk to continue weaving.

loans.use: To buy more silk

loans.name: Lassana

texts.fr:
Monsieur Lassana C. est âgé de 42 ans et père d’un enfant. Il vit avec sa femme et son enfant chez son père dans le quartier Massablacoura de Bougouni (troisième région du Mali)
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école moderne, il commença très tôt les activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat et la vente des produits de beauté, de fêtes etc. Il a appris cette activité auprès de son ami. Avec une expérience de 17 ans, il maîtrise son activité et est très sollicité. 
Il est à sa première expérience avec Soro Yiriwaso.
Pour renforcer son commerce, il décida d’intégrer le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  pour acheter une grande quantité de mèches, crèmes, pommades, déodorants et parfums.
Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) auprès des grossistes et effectue sa vente dans sa boutique sise au grand marché de Bougouni.
Les périodes propices de ses ventes sont surtout les fêtes réligeuses et les fêtes de fin d’années. Sa clientèle est composée surtout de femmes.
Avec ce prêt il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 52 5 00 FCFA.
Avec ce bénéfice il compte agrandir sa boutique, payer les intérêts du prêt, et subvenir à ses besoins.
texts.en:
Mr. Lassana C. is 42 years old and is father to one child. He lives with his wife and child at his father's house in the Massablacoura quarter of Bougouni (the third largest region in Mali). As he didn't go to modern school, he began earning money very early, notably through buying and selling beauty and party products etc. He learned this business from a friend and with 17 years' experience, he is good at his job and is very sought after. This is his first time working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. In order to strengthen his business he decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso's loan programme so that he could buy large quantities of highlights, creams, pommades, deodorants and perfumes. He buys his goods in Bamako (the capital of the Republic of Mali) from wholesalers and sells them in his boutique located in the main market in Bougouni. He makes the most sales around religious festivals and New Year parties. His customers are mostly women. With this loan he plans on earning a monthly profit of 52,500 FCFA. With this income he plans on extending his boutique, paying the interest on the loan and covering other necessities.

Translated from French by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products

loans.name: Iris Idayda

texts.es: Iris Idayda L. de 35 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Rosario de La Paz. Vive junto a tres hijos menores de edad, los cuales gracias al esfuerzo de su madre, se dedican a estudiar. Iris posee una venta de pupusas, en la cual se encarga de elaborar y vender su producto desde su humilde casa. Ella es una mujer muy esforzada quien cada mañana y noche se dispone a trabajar lo mejor posible, todo con el fin de poder brindarles una estabilidad económica a sus hijos, sin importar el esfuerzo que esto conlleve. Iris solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda adquirir el dinero necesario para poder comprar maíz, harina de arroz, queso, frijoles, y chicharrón, los cuales son los productos básicos para la elaboración de las pupusas. Iris desea poder contar con mayor cantidad de materia prima, y de esta manera vender más pupusas, ya que cuenta con mucho clientes. A pesar que ella ha sido madre soltera es alguien muy admirada por sus vecinos ya que ha sabido sacar adelante a sus tres hijos.
texts.en:
Iris Idayda L. is 35 years-old and lives in the town of Rosario de La Paz. She lives with her three young children, who, thanks to the efforts of their mother, are students. Iris has a business selling pupusas (stuffed tortillas). She makes and sells her products herself from her humble house. She is a very hard-working woman who every morning and night tries to do her best work, all with the goal of providing her children economic stability, no matter the effort necessary. Iris is asking for this loan to use as working capital to purchase corn, rice flour, cheese, beans, and pork crackling, the basic ingredients for making stuffed tortillas. Iris wants to use raw materials of the best quality and thus sell the best stuffed tortillas to her many customers. Although she is a single mother she is admired a lot by her neighbors for her ability to get her children ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw material for the elaboration of food products.

location.town: Rosario de La Paz, departamento de La Paz

loans.name: Virgette

texts.en:
Virgette A. is from the village of Maac in Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 27 years old. Virgette is single and has one young child. To make a living, Virgette sells "ukay-ukay" (used clothing) in the local community. Virgette has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Virgette joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virgette is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Virgette's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kounadia Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Kounadia, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 42 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à N’Tjifina sous préfecture de Fana,  Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce des condiments alimentaires, des céréales et des habillements.   
Ces femmes du groupe Kounadia sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter, des  paquets de condiments alimentaires, des céréales et des habits pour  hommes et femmes.
Elles s’approvisionnent généralement en habillements et condiments à Bamako et dans le village en céréales avec les producteurs et les grossistes sur place. Elles  effectuent leurs ventes au marché de la ville de Fana, Nangola et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20.000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relative au frais scolaire des enfants, à la santé, aux goûters  et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women from the Kounadia group are all married. On average they are 42 years of age, have 4 children and all live in traditional extended families in N’Tjifina, in the Fana Sub-Prefecture of the Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They were acquainted through family connections and are in the business of retailing food condiments, grain cereals and clothing. This is the first group loan request for the Kotognontala group, which will be used to buy packages of food condiments, grain cereals, and men and women’s clothing. They get their clothing and condiment supplies mainly from Bamako and within the village. The cereals come from local producers and wholesalers. They sell at the Fana city market, in Nangola and in area market fairs, retail, cash or credit, to both men and women customers. They hope to reach average monthly earnings of 20,000 FCFA each, which will be used to cover children’s school expenses, healthcare, after-school snacks, the remainder being reinvested in the business.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy condiments, cereals, and clothing

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy loves cooking and that is why she sells mouth-watering cooked foods and drinks. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to own a world-class restaurant in the future. She started this business eight months ago and she is making progress. As a hardworking woman with the determination to excel, she sells for long hours to make her business more sustainable. 

Dorothy hopes for a loan of 50,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia F. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 53 years-old and married.  Lilia owns and operates a business running a sari-sari (general) store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lilia joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilia is requesting a first loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated  to supplement the family income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama N. is a single parent and has seven dependents. She has received junior high education. Ama sells bread, doughnuts, and rice porridge (locally called rice water) at Abura.  Ama uses her income to pay school fees and utility bills. 

Ama will use the loan to purchase more rice, flour, and other ingredients to bake bread for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to reinvest in her business. At the time the picture was taken, N. had finished selling her bread.

loans.use: purchase more rice, flour, and other ingredients to bake bread for sale

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence has operated an agriculture supply shop in Naivasha town for the last 7 years, supplying farm supplies to the area's residents.  This has proved to be a successful venture as most of the people in her area practice farming.  She is 46 years old, married to Charles Wainaina, and they have 4 children.

She was introduced to KADET by a friend.  This will be her third loan after successfully repaying two previous two loans on time.  She plans to add fertilizer stock in her shop, which is in demand during the planting season.

Florence hopes to open another shop outside town, closer to farmers who currently must travel to town to shop for farm supplies.

loans.use: To add fertilizer to sell

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a 34 year old married woman,  blessed with three children who attend school.  She has been operating a retail shop for six years where she sells detergents.  She was previously employed as a teacher.  Since she joined the Mothers of Hope group in Faulu Kenya, she has been able to expand her business and employ more people.  This is because the group members previously guaranteed her a loan which she used to boost her business. 

She has requested for a loan of Kes. 60, 000 to buy raw materials for making detergents.  She dreams of owning real estate in the future.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for making detergents

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina E. is 54 years old and supports three children who are still studying in high school and college. She hopes that, one day, all them will have a degree and enjoy a stable career. This is because she saw from her five elder children how hard it is to support a family and yourself without a stable job and income.
Despite feeling unhappy about her children's situation, Josefina has been able to find strength through Kiva partner, ASHI. With ASHI, she has been able to request a loan and finance her family’s rice farming business, which is managed by her husband and sons. The proceeds from this business go towards meeting her family's needs. However, due to sudden climate change, their business and income is affected. For this reason, Josefina requested a loan to purchase a tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar) for a transportation business to be managed by her husband (while she supports the farming business). Now, Josefina is hoping to purchase another tricycle to be managed by one of her unemployed sons.
Despite the non-stop challenges Josefina encounters in her everyday life as a wife, mother and businesswoman, her hope of having a better kind of life in the future never fades. With ASHI, this hope has become even brighter.

loans.use: To purchase a tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional sacks of gari and soap to sell

loans.name: Try God Group

texts.en:
Tede W., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called 'Try God'. She is 50 years old, widowed, and has four children who range from 20 to 27 years old. Tede was only able to attend school through 4th grade due to lack of financial support. She cares for two siblings.

For 6 years, she has been selling dried fish in Banjor Market, on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 5,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 25,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more dried fish. She describes herself as a serviceable woman.

Her dream is to improve her business and build a house.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Agnes is inset at lower right because she was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more dried fish

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina E. is from the village of Pinoma, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 53 years old. Merlina is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Merlina owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Merlina has been engaged in her business for over three years and she want to start up her business again. Her previous income was 3,000 PHP per month. 

In 2007, Merlina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Merlina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ghislaine

texts.fr: ZANNOU Ghislaine est née en 1979 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Ghislaine vit depuis une vingtaine d'année au quartier Gankpodo à Cotonou, avec sa famille. Ghislaine est mariée à ATINDOKPO Guy, et est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Ghislaine assure avec son mari les différentes charges de la famille, grâce au revenu de son  activité. Ghislaine a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Depuis dix sept ans environs, Ghislaine vend des mèches en gros, et de façon secondaire, des plateaux d'oeufs frais par le système de distribution. Cette activité lui génère des revenus lui permettant de subvenir sans difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et aussi au Nigéria que Ghislaine achète ses produits. Ghislaine est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant obtenu antérieurement six crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Face à la demande de plus en plus grandissante de sa clientèle, Ghislaine sollicite un autre crédit en vue d'augmenter le volume de son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
ZANNOU Ghislaine was born in 1979 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  She has been living with her family in the Gankpodo district in Cotonou for about twenty years.  She is married to ATINDOKPO Guy and is the mother of two children, who are all in school.  Along with her husband, Ghislaine ensures that the different family expenses are covered, thanks to the revenues from her business.  Ghislaine dropped out in secondary school.  For about seventeen years, she has been selling hair extensions wholesale. Secondarily, she sells trays of fresh eggs by the distribution system.  This business generates the revenues enabling her without a problem to provide for her family.  She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and also from Nigeria.  She is a previous ALIDé client having had six loans in the past that have all been repaid.  Facing the growing demands from her customer base, Ghislaine is requesting another loan with the goal of increasing her business volume and satisfying her customers more.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying hair extensions, beauty products, hair products, and eggs

loans.name: Gennadyi

texts.en:
Gennadyi is married and has two teenage sons. He lives in the town of Kamenka, where he makes a living selling office supplies, books, text books, plastic bags and other retail items. Over the years, he has established good connections with local schools and other organizations which help him keep his sales pretty high all year long. Gennadyi has been in this business for 10 years, and currently has an inventory worth 40,000 Grivnyas. His net profit comes to about 3,000-5,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Gennadyi has used micro loans before and found them a great way to increase the success of his business. He is applying for a loan of 18,046 Grivnyas to buy additional merchandise that students will need during the school year that just started. He is hoping to generate extra income this season so that he can continue to grow his small business. He has an impeccable credit record and is confident that he can repay the current loan without any problems.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell to his customers

loans.name: Gonzalo Abel

texts.es: El Sr. Gonzalo se dedica a la venta de Computadoras y accesoR. de computación, además dicta clases de computación en un Instituto de nuestra ciudad, esta casado, pero su negocio es totalmente independiente, el quiere ser uno de los mejores proveedores de accesoR. de computación tiene la intención de ampliar su negocio y a futuro lograr abrir una cadena de tiendas a nivel nacional, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de computadoras portátiles ya que un institución le hizo una cantidad de pedidos, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sr. Gonzalo sells computers and computer accessories. In addition, he teaches computer training classes	in an institution in our city. He is married, but his business is completely independent. He wants to be one of the best providers of computer accessories. He intends to increase his business and in the future open a chain of stores at a national level. He will use the money from the loan to purchase laptop computers, since an institution has already given him a quantity of orders.

He is very grateful to the lending institution for the support they offer.

loans.use: Buy laptop computers

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a married woman with five children, two of whom attend school while three have graduated. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. 

She has operated her business of selling natural juice, soft drinks and ice blocks for two years. Khadija faces the major challenge of seasonality. During rainy winter seasons the demand for ice blocks and cold drinks is low compared to hot summer seasons. She hopes to be a wholesaler of charcoal in the future. 

With the 20,000 KES she wants to repair her refrigerator and purchase a container for storing ice blocks to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu because of its good reputation in the society.

loans.use: To repair her refrigerator and purchase a container for storing ice blocks to sell.

loans.name: Maythe Guillermina

texts.es: La señora se dedica a la venta D. ropa y venta D. productos D. belleza Avon desD. hace cuatro años aproximadamente. Vive en casa alquilada conjuntamente con sus menores hijos y su esposo el cual trabaja D. vigilante en una empresa agroexportadora,ambos se ayudan en los gastos familiares. La solicitante requiere del crédito para comprar mercaderia D. sus productos D. belleza Avon y ropa para la temporada D. verano, se propone otorgarle el crédito por que presenta buenas referencias personales y laborales.
texts.en:
Sra. Maythe has been selling clothing and Avon beauty products for approximately four years. She lives in a rented house with her young children and husband, who works as a security guard for an agricultural export business. They both support one another with the family expenses.

Maythe needs a loan to buy merchandise, including Avon beauty products and summer clothing. This loan is being granted because she presents good personal and work references.

loans.use: Operating capital to acquire summer clothing & beauty products

loans.name: Sixta

texts.es:
La Señora Sixta de 58 años de edad es comerciante y está casada con el Señor Teófilo de 57 años de edad. 
Se dedica a la venta de comidas y bebidas hace 4 años, posee una clientela bien formada ya que tiene su local en su casa propia el cual es muy concurrido por la buena ubicación  que posee. Esta actividad lo realiza con su esposo. 
Solicita el préstamo para la ampliación de su local, ya que anteriormente vendía sus productos en la calle y desea construir un lugar  para que sus clientes se sientan a gusto y puedan saborear cómodamente las ricas comidas que Sixta les prepara a diario. 
Sixta ha operado en varias oportunidades con la Fundación Paraguaya cumpliendo en forma puntual con el pago de sus compromisos, es por eso que desea una nueva oportunidad a fin de llevar a cabo su sueño.
texts.en:
Ms. Sixta is 58 year old shopkeeper and is married to Mr. Teófilo, who is 57. She has sold food and drink for 4 years and has a well formed clientele. Her business is in her own home and is very popular because of its good location. She runs the store with her husband. 

She requests the loan to increase the size of her store. Before, she would sell her products outside. She wants to construct a place so that her clients can feel at ease and comfortably enjoy the delicious foods that Sixta prepares every day. 

Sixta has worked with the Paraguay Foundation on several opportunities, fulfilling her loan payment obligations on time. Because of this, she wants a new opportunity to achieve her dream.

loans.use: To increase the size of her store for sales

loans.name: En Dios Confiamos 3 Group

texts.es:
Soneida es una de los miembros del Grupo En Dios confiamos 3, localizado en La ciudad de San Pedro de Macoris, cuya economia depende del comercio en general, zona franca y de plantas industriales de cemento y productos para el uso del hogar y cosmeticos. Esta ciudad como muchas otras en Republica Dominicana hay escasez de agua potable y de energía electrica y con una poblacion de dominicanos y emigrantes haitianos. En su negocio vende productos miscelaneas, como: ropas, zapatos, cosmeticos, accesorios, etc; y con su nuevo prestamo esta planificando invertir para adquirir estos productos y tener una mayor cantidad de los mismos, ya que en esta temporada hay mucha demanda de todas las ventas. Soneida está muy emocionada de recibir su sexto préstamo en Esperanza Internacional, después de haber pagado satisfactoriamente todos sus préstamos anteriores y asi haber dado un paso para el crecimiento de su negocio. 

Nos dice que su reto o desafío más difícil ha sido siempre tener estabilidad economica y poder suplir sus necesidades, y que disfruta del mismo modo trabajar duro, como descansar en su tiempo libre. Planea utilizar sus ganancias para reinvertir ya que habra muchas demandas de ventas. Su sueño es poder tener su negocio establecido y marchando bien.
texts.en:
Soneida is one of the members of the En Dios Confiamos (In God We Trust) 3 Group, located in the city of San Pedro de Macoris, where the primary economic activities are commerce, a tax-free area, industrial cement plants, and household and cosmetic products. This city, like many others in the Dominican Republic, has a shortage of drinking water and electricity and is populated by Dominicans and Haitian immigrants. Soneida sells miscellaneous products in her business, such as: clothing, shoes, cosmetics, accessories, etc. With this new loan, she is planning to invest in more of these products, since during this time of the year there is a lot of demand for the items she sells. Soneida is very excited to receive her sixth loan from Esperanza International, after having successfully repaid her previous loans and thus having taken a step towards expanding her business. 

She tells us that her greatest challenge has always been to have economic stability and fulfill all of her needs. She enjoys working hard, just as she enjoys relaxing in her free time. She is planning to reinvest her profits in her business, since there will be a lot of demand for her products. Her dream is to have a well-established, smooth-running business.

loans.use: Productos Miscelaneos

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 34 years old, married with two children.  She sells second-hand clothes so as to earn a living.  She has been running the business for ten years and has grown it through financial support from Faulu Kenya.  Apart from selling second-hand clothes, she does poultry farming to supplement her income.  She hopes to expand her business into wholesale in the future.  She has requested 30,000 Kes to buy clothes.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Dalmacia

texts.en: Dalmacia S. is from the village of Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 56 years old. Dalmacia is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Dalmacia raises pigs for sale. Dalmacia has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,880 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2008, Dalmacia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dalmacia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Dalmacia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the second loan taken out by Dalmacia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

location.town: Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Abbas

texts.ar:
عباس في عمر 25 سنة يعمل في محل لبيع الاجهزة الخليوية يحب عمله له فيه اكثر من 5 سنوات يريد ان يتطور وان يزيد من
مدخوله الشهري فهو طموح وجدي في التعامل ما يميز عمله هو النشاط والتجدد في البضائع
له تاريخ جيد في المجموعة يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء اكسسوار للاجهزة الخليوية ما يحلم به هو ان يصبح
من اصحاب المحلات الكبيرة له زبائن من محيطه ومحبيه
texts.en: Abbas (25 years old) has been employed for the past five years in a cellular phone shop. He is very earnest, diligent, and dynamic, as well as very eager to find ways to increase his salary. His customers hail from his circle of friends and his community. Given his good standing with Al Majmoua, Abbas wanted to seek another loan to purchase cell phone accessories. He ultimately hopes to own a large chain of such stores.

loans.use: To purchase cell phone accessories

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
If one would dream for one’s self or one’s family, why not dream for the best? Lida B., 48, dreams for the best, but more than that, she acts to make it a reality. Lida is married to Jimmy B., a factory worker. They have three children who are now in elementary, high school, and college. Together, they live in Malaria, Caloocan City. 

Lida has taken vocational courses. With the learning she gains as a Community Partner in CCT*, Lida runs her own sari-sari (variety) store to capitalize on the big target market she has in her community. She has been doing business here for seven years. It is quite easy for her since it is a residential business, and there is not much need at present to hire employees. She earns an estimated net income of 500 PHP per day.

To help grow her store, Lida is requesting a 22,000 PHP loan. She plans to use the funds to buy more grocery items to put in her store, so that it won’t look bare and incomplete. Lida makes an effort to maintain her business in good shape, because a profitable business translates to family needs being met and the schooling of her children being supported. 

Lida struggles with time management when it comes to balancing business, health and family life. However, she sees to it that these struggles will not prevent her from reaching her dreams for her family. She desires to see her small store grow and eventually expand. She dreams of having good health for everyone in the family and being able to send her children all the way through college. Deep inside, she knows that if there is faith, and action, everything will be possible.

With her going to CCT fellowship* meeting every week, she was able to improve and enjoy her relationship with God. As a Christian, through the Word of God, she also gained strength and inspiration day after day.
	
*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: additional stocks for her variety store

loans.name: Phuong's Group

texts.en:
Phuong T. N. is 42 years old and has three children. She makes a living by growing rice and vegetables. She also raises pigs for saL. in a local market. She has repaid several previous loans on time and is applying for this new one to improve the building in which she shelters her pigs.

MinhT. D. is 54 years old and runs a grocery store in the Trung Thon market. She will use her portion of this loan to improve her shop.  

Tam T. L. is 41 years old and runs a small restaurant where she serves breakfast. She will use her portion of this loan to buy new tables. 

Be T.  V. is 37 years old and makes a living raising pigs. She will use her portion of this loan to buy food for them. 

Tien T. N. is 46 years old and makes a living selling scrap steel. She will use her portion of this loan to improve her business

loans.use: to expand five small businesses

loans.name: Robeta

texts.en:
Robeta L. is from the village of Camul, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 28 years old. Robeta is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $25 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Robeta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 1st loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is 25 years old, married and has two children.  For five years, he has been running a barber shop.  He has been able to run his business well because he has been trained in business management by Faulu Kenya.  He has also learnt how to save his money and budget.  

He hopes to open another business in the future.  He has requested 30,000 Kes to buy shampoo and disinfectants.

loans.use: to buy shampoo and disinfectants.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah P. is from the village of Mandulog, Iligan City. She is 31 years old. Leah is married and has two school-aged children. Leah owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling junk foods, candies & snacks such as native delicacies biko & suman in the local community. Leah has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2010, Leah joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Leah has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Leah is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like candies & biscuits. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Leah from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like candies & biscuits

location.town: Mandulog, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle L. is from the village of Dalirig, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 46 years old. Annabelle is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Annabelle sells vegetables such as stringbeans, eggplants & cowpeas in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Annabelle joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & fund working capital for her business. 

Annabelle is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP to purchase additional vegetables like squash & beans to sell. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from this investment to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables like squash & beans to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 54-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and three children who are still attending school. He has owned a tractor for 7 years. His work is specialized in excavating land for cultivation and harvesting the planted crops. He works upon request of the land owners. He has been able to improve his business through his first loan that Kiva has granted him. 

 Today, he is requesting to take out a second loan of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to perform much needed maintenance work on his tractor’s engine and body. In that way, he will be able to proceed with his work easier and faster.  In the future, he is hoping to buy land and start his own farming work.

loans.use: to perform much needed maintenance work on his tractor’s engine and body.

loans.name: Neneth

texts.en:
Neneth is 40 years old and married with two children. Both children are in school and she works very hard to provide for them. For the past 14 years, Neneth has run a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines, selling a variety of items such as cooking oil, sardines, snacks, etc. 

Neneth is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy more merchandise such as sugar and milk to sell in her store. In the future, she would like to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as milk and sugar to sell

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: La señora  Bertha es una cliente antigua desde el año 2004 estuvo en grupo "leo" trabajo  12 secuencias en el grupo demostrando puntualidad y responsabilidad en  el pago de sus cuotas. Actualmente se independizo del grupo y  solicita  un crédito individual. La cliente vive cerca  a su negocio que esta ubicado en la zona villa victoria.  Ella esta muy contenta de que se le haya elegido para el programa Kiva debido a que siente beneficiada de gran manera con el préstamo que se le otorga, ella se dedica a  la   venta de comida  con ambiente propio y se levanta muy temprano para preparar los alimentos y poderlos vender a los  choferes y transeúntes de  la misma zona. La señora es  separada  y con  los ingresos  de su negocio solventa  a sus  tres hijos. Ahora el crédito lo  destinará  para comprar  productos de abarrotes para su negocio. Y así mejorar sus ingresos, es un apersona muy trabajadora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Bertha is a longtime client who has been working in the communal bank "Leo" since 2004.  This group has been through 12 loan cycles and has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility in making its payments.  Now Bertha is separating from the group and requesting an individual loan.  She lives close to her business, which is located in the neighborhood Villa Victoria.  Bertha is very pleased to have been chosen for the Kiva program, because she feels that she will benefit greatly from the loan that will be granted.  She has a business selling food in her own place; she gets up very early to prepare the food, so that she can sell it to the drivers and passers-by in the same neighborhood.  Bertha is separated, and with the income from her business she covers the expenses for her 3 children.  This loan will be used to buy grocery products for her business so that she can increase her income.  She is a very hardworking person who is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy grocery products for her business

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan, who works hard to support her family, is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. In this business for five years, Susan has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of goods to sell in her store. In the future, she would like to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Atamurat

texts.ru: Атамурат проживает в Яванском районе. Ему 57 лет. Он женат. У него шестеро детей. Его сын занимается строительными работами по найму. Сам Атамурот более 14 лет занимается животноводством. Он зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Кредит берет для закупа мелко - рогатого скота. Он хочет увеличить количество скот и получить больше дохода.
texts.en: Atamurat lives in Yavan.  He is 57 years old, married, and has six children.  His son is a day laborer in construction.  Atamurat has worked in animal husbandry for more than fourteen years.   He makes a living by raising cattle.  He is taking out a loan to buy small livestock (sheep or goats).  He would like to expand his flocks and receive a greater income.

loans.use: to buy small livestock (such as sheep or goats).

loans.name: Madalena

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Republica da Africa do Sul, é viuva e maê de 10 filhos cuja as idades ja não se lembra, mas quase todos ja independentes. Fez 4a classe e parou por falta de condiçoes financeiras. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta seus netos que vivem com ela.   
Saiu da Africa do Sul para Maputo ainda muito nova, veio com seus pais, mais tarde constitui a sua familia. Tem um negocio proprio de venda de produtos alimetares ha mais de 20 anos, não tem empregados e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 3.000.00 a 4.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca fez emprestimos noutros bancos. Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de amigas comerciantes que tambem são   clientes desta instituiçao. Este é o seu oitavo emprestimo no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar mercadoria (refrescos, cigarros, cervejas, sumo e outros) para aumentar a mercadoria no seu estabelecimento.
Esta confiante que vai pagar sem dificuldades e um dos seus sonhos e ampliar o seu negocio, e construir um estabelecimento comercial condigno, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos.
texts.en:
Born in the Republic of South Africa, the applicant is a widowed mother of 10 children, whose ages she can no longer remember, but almost all of them now live independently. She attended school up to the 4th grade and then stopped going owing to her financial situation. She lives in her own house and cares for her grandchildren who live with her.
She left South Africa with her parents when she was still young and later started her own family. She has run her own business selling food for the last 20 years. She does not have any employees and she manages to earn around 3,000-4,000Mts each month, which she uses for household expenses and saves the remainder in her bank account.
She has never borrowed money from any other bank. She heard about Hluvuku through business colleagues who are also Hluvuku clients. This is her eighth loan for 10,000Mts, she intends to use this to buy merchandise (refreshments, cigarettes, beer, juices and other items) to increase her business current assets.
She is confident that she will meet the repayments without any difficulty. One of her dreams is to expand her business and to build a proper commercial establishment. She intends to apply for further loans in order to achieve these aims.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (refreshments, cigarettes, beers, juices and other items).

loans.name: Deo

texts.en:
Deo is 55 years old and married with 4 children, 1 son and 3 daughters. She lives with her husband and children in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works as a hired motorbike driver. 

Deo earns an income to support her family by selling fabric in a small market. She has done this for the past 15 years. 

She would like to take a loan to buy a greater quantity of different fabrics and clothing materials to sell to her customers. She hopes that this will better meet the needs of her customers and will attract more customers to her store. Deo hopes that through the loan she will be able to increase her income to more adequately cover family expenses.

loans.use: to buy fabric and clothing materials to sell in her store.

loans.name: Jose Arquimides

texts.es:
José, tiene 21 años de edad, es casado, con su esposa tienen un hijo de 4 años de edad, viven en casa propia, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz, pipián y chile, desde joven trabaja como agricultor, junto a su familia aprendió todo el proceso. 
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en abono, pues necesita una buena cantidad de dicho elemento (abono), para aplicarlos al cultivo.
Él espera tener una buena cosecha, ya que de ella depende la alimentación de su familia y los ingresos que reciba al comercializarla.
texts.en:
José is 21 years old and married.  He and his wife have a 4-year-old son.  They live in their own house.  He’s a corn, pumpkin and chili farmer.  He’s worked as a farmer since he was a boy.  He learned the process from his family.

He is currently asking for a loan to buy manure because he needs a good quantity of this substance (manure) to apply to his crops.

He hopes to have a good crop yield because his family’s nutrition depends on it and he earns income when he sells it.

loans.use: to buy manure for his corn crops.

loans.name: Nanuli

texts.en:
Nanuli, age 60, is from the village of Erge in the Adjara region. She runs the family's agricultural business, assisted by her sons. They grow citrus fruits and various other fruits on 1.5 hectares of family-owned land. They also grow greens. They harvested their produce and sell it at the local open market. 
 
Nanuli and her husband Otar have two sons, ages 24 and 26. Otar has health problems and receives a pension from the government. 

Nanuli has requested this loan in order to purchase a milk cow. She will produce cheese and sell it at the same market where she sells her fruits and greens. Initiating a dairy business will increase the income of the family. Nanuli intends to provide better care for the family and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Abir

texts.en:
Abir is a 41-year-old married woman and mother of five children. She works hard to cover most of their expenses. She started this business in 1980. As of now, she has 30 years of experience in this domain. She started this business too early, in order to help her parents in their living, and she's doing the same with her husband through helping him to cover most of their family's expenses.

Abir is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, for the fourth time, in order to increase her business capital by adding new flower collections for the Ramadan Eid's season.

Abir is a courageous woman with a good reputation and a hard worker who seeks perfection all the time. Abir loves her business a lot and hopes to expand it to a wider shop in the future, and to improve her wedding planning sector.

loans.use: To buy more flowers

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 30-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is living with one parent and two siblings. He has been working as a car mechanic since 2008 and has 11 years of experience working in similar fields. He has one full-time employee helping him with the work. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase mechanical machinery in order to facilitate his business operation. He notes that this machinery will help him repair  the cars easily. In the future, he is planning to expand his business into other areas.

loans.use: to purchase mechanical machinery in order to facilitate his business operation.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel, 24 years old, has operated in the transport industry in Nakuru town for the last two years.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan to buy a new motorcycle.  In the future, Samuel hopes to buy a taxi, which has more income compared to a motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 42-year-old single mother of four children.  She is a food vendor.  Grace has been in this business for the last three years. She was recently introduced to KADET and this marks her first borrowing to finance her business.

With this loan, she plans to purchase onions, tomatoes and potatoes. The anticipated profits will be directed into repayment of the loan and to gradually expand her business. Her dream is to become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes and potatoes to sell

loans.name: Ghanem

texts.en:
Ghanem is a 36-year-old Lebanese married man, living with his wife and two children, who are still attending school. He is an experienced construction worker. He is especially talented at completing woodwork projects. He has been working for the past 15 years in this occupation. He works independently in his business. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase more wood for his work. In the future, he is planning to expand his business by opening his own office and working with some construction entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase more wood for his work.

loans.name: Asaph

texts.en:
Asaph is a thirty-eight-year-old man, married, and the father to four children. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in farming and photography businesses for six years. His hardship is the lack of enough capital to expand the farmland, and his vision is to see his businesses gain growth momentum and also to build a permanent house for his family.

Asaph needs the loan facility to enable him to buy beans seeds for planting and also to pay for farm labor.

loans.use: To buy bean seeds for planting and also to pay for farm labor.

loans.name: Rico

texts.en:
Rico is 45 years old and lives in Panalsalan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. He is married with four children. 

Rico works in the fish industry and catches fish for a living. He has been doing this for 35 years. He has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase a fishing boat.
 
Rico has been a member of PMPC for four years.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Justina

texts.es: Justina, de 28 años es una mujer alegre. Vive en compañía de Edwin, su esposo desde hace 12 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos: Mayte, Yesmina y Mayumi, a los que cuidan en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Aymará.  Todas las mañas trabaja en sus sembríos de tubérculos como: oca, papa, mashua y olluco, los cuales realiza gracias a la ayuda de sus padres, quienes le heredaron una hectárea de terreno agrícola. Se siente muy feliz por ello. Ya que ahorra el dinero de arriendo, para comprarse uno propio. “Deseo lograr mis objetivos por mi propia cuenta”, finaliza. Además tiene tiene una vaca y 20 ovejas que enseba para luego venderlas a un mayor precio. Pero como es una mujer trabajadora, en épocas de cosecha, también trabaja como peón recolectando los alimentos maduros; ahí obtiene un dinero extra. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “R.” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Justina, de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus cultivos de papa ”blanca”.
texts.en:
Justina, age 28, is a happy woman. She lives with Edwin, her husband of 12 years. They have three children: Mayte, Yesmina, and Mayumi whom they care for in their own house located in the small village of Aymará.

Every morning, Justina works in her root vegetable fields where she grows oca, potatoes, mashua, and olluca (oca, mashua, and olluca are root vegetables grown in the Andes). She does this thanks to the help of her parents from whom she inherited a hectare of agricultural land. She is very happy about this because she saves money she would otherwise pay for rent in order to buy her own land. “I want to achieve my objectives with my own money”, she concludes. In addition, she has a cow and 20 sheep that she is fattening in order to sell them later at a higher price. As a hardworking woman, during harvest season she also works as a laborer, harvesting ripe crops and, thus, obtaining extra money.

Justina belongs to the “R.” (Rosemary) communal bank. This is her first loan with MFP, and she hopes that, through this collaboration, she will be able to achieve her plans. In addition, she promises to fulfill the payment of her installments. She is thankful to be part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible and supportive persons. Justina receives their support. She will invest the money applied for in the purchase of natural fertilizers to spread among her white potato plants.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of natural fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish and generate more business.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a responsible mother of two children, who aims to become successful in the future. She is 32 years old and married. She is engaged in a hog-raising business to help her husband generate income to satisfy their family's needs. She has been in this business for almost seven years and usually earns profits of P8,000 for every two pigs she sells.

Cristina planned to acquire more pigs to raise but she didn't have enough capital, therefore, she is requesting a loan of P5,000 to buy feed, vitamins, and additional piglets to raise. She said that this loan will help her improve her business and she hopes that it make her business grow in future.

loans.use: To buy feed, vitamins, and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.pt:
