Nasceu na Provincia de Inhambane, Sul de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 5 filhos dos quais apenas 2 ainda frequentam a Escola. Fez a 3ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos seus pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta 3 netos que vivem com ela.

É negociante ha mais de 11 anos vende produtos diversos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 7.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Já teve emprestimo noutros bancos e conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades. Conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 16.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (oleo, arroz, farinha, amendoim, e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.   
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende ampliar o seu negocio, para tal tensiona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in the province of Inhambane, southern Mozambique. She is married and has five children, only two of which still attend school. She completed 3rd grade and stopped because her parents lacked financial conditions. She lives with her family in a house she owns and also supports  three grandchildren who live with her.
She has been selling various products for over 11 years and earns an income of about 7.000mt a month. She uses it to pay for home expenses and saves part of it in her bank account.
She has had loans in other banks and has managed to repay without difficulties. She first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her first loan with Hluvuku. It is for 16.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase goods such as olive oil, rice, flour, peanuts, etc., in order to increase the quantity of her merchandise.
She pledges to repay as scheduled. In the future she plans to expand her business and for that reason she intends to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase goods for selling (olive oil, rice, flour, peanuts, etc.).

loans.name: Eloy

texts.es:
Eloy nació en la provincia de Urubamba pues vive en el poblado de Rumichaca Baja.( La provincia de Urubamba está ubicada al norte de la ciudad del Cusco, a orillas del río Vilcanota, en una zona que se conoce como el “Valle Sagrado” debido a su clima templado, tierra  fértil y abundantes riachuelos, que hacen de este valle uno de los más bellos del planeta.).

Eloy tiene 46 años edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos, él es carpintero de oficio y tiene en su domicilio un pequeño taller de carpintería donde fabrica sillas, puertas, mesas, roperos, ventas y otras cosas más. Ya son 13  años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Él en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como por ejemplo madera, cola de carpintero, clavos y otras materiales. Su sueño de Eloy es abrir un grifo en la ciudad de Rumichaca. 

Eloy es integrante del banco comunal “Nueva Visión de Rumichaca”. Este  grupo está conformado con 19 socios que viven  en la provincia de Urubamba.
texts.en:
Eloy was born in the province of Urubamba and lives in the town of Rumichaca Baja.  (The province of Urubamba is located to the north of the city of Cusco, on the banks of the Vilcanota River, in an area known as the "Sacred Valley."Due to its temperate climate, fertile soil, and abundant streams, this valley is one of the most beautiful on the planet).

Eloy is 46 and lives in a common-law marriage from which he has 3 children.  He is a carpenter by trade and has a small shop in his home where he makes chairs, doors, tables, wardrobes, and other items.  He has had this business for 13 years, and it is going very well thanks to the effort he puts into his work.  He needs a loan to buy materials like wood, wood glue, nails, etc.  His dream is to open a gas station in the city of Rumichaca.

Eloy is a member of the communal bank, "Nueva Visión de Rumichaca" (New Vision of Rumichaca).  This group is made up of 19 members who live in the province of Urubamba.

loans.use: to buy materials like wood, wood glue, nails, etc.

loans.name: Amadu

texts.en: This is 51-year-old Amadu.  He is married and has 2 children, aged 8 years (in the second grade) and 5 years. He has no additional dependents. In 1991, Amadu established his provisions business. He began his business at an early age as he is not educated. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about SLL 450,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000 to increase his stocks in order to meet the needs of his customers. He intends to establish a bigger store to compete with the nearby businesses owned by Lebanese nationals.

loans.use: To buy provisions for his store.

loans.name: Kageni

texts.en: Kageni is servicing her fourth loan after paying back the previous loans well and in good time. Her farming business is doing great. She plans to use this loan to buy more farm supplies, such as wheat seeds and fertilizer, and hire manpower to aid in the farm. She hopes to grow different crops on her farm and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more  farming supplies.

loans.name: Mahouzossou Group

texts.fr: MAHOUZOSSOU est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la troisième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Julienne (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 52 ans. Julienne est mariée à un maçon du nom de Simon. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Julienne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Julienne et son mari. Pour cette raison, Julienne vend des ustensile de cuisine par la technique de distribution, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Julienne s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin et au Nigéria. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Julienne sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe MAHOUZOSSOU, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des ustensiles de cuisine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on the stock of coffee in the business.

loans.name: Idaya

texts.en: Idaya is an IDP from occupied Kelbadjar district of Azerbaijan. She fled to Baku in 1993. She is married, has two children. Her private business she started in 2000. She borrowed five loans totalling $4900 from Normicro Baku branch. Now she plans to borrow $1200.

loans.use: To increase variety of goods

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en: Telesia S. lives in a small Samoan village with her husband and two children.  Her husband is unemployed, and her family faced a lot of financial problems prior to Telesia joining SPBD.  But Telesia decided to join the program and leverage her sewing talent to launch a proper business.   Her business is now six years old, and the income from it supports her family.  She is seeking additional loan funds to purchase materials to keep a consistent supply of clothing available to her customers.  Telesia is a talented seamstress, and she is also an adept businesswoman.  She enjoys exploring new ways to make her customers happy with original material and patterns.

loans.use: Buy material

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
Business Description

Mr. Cesar has been working as a grocer of fruits and cheeses for 20 years now. He learned this trade as an adolescent working for his Uncle and then took this experience to start his own business. He sells his fruits from a bicycle and he travels throughout his neighborhood with his products. He starts working at 8am and finishes at 6pm, with a lunch break from 1pm-3pm, from Monday to Friday and during the mornings on Saturday and Sunday from 8am-1pm.

Loan Use

Mr. Cesar wishes to purchase more fruits, and since he also has experience selling prawns, he would like to expand this area of sales. By doing this, he will be able to better tend to his customers and to meet his high demand which is increasing. With this loan he will be able to expand his business even more.

Personal Information

Mr. Cesar is 41, married and has 4 children, 3 of whom are in school. His home is made of cement and is only a single story and very simple. His older son helps him with his business and his wife takes charge of household chores. He very much wishes to improve himself and his home, so long as business continues to grow and he brings in higher earnings. He also hopes to improve his family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Descripción del Negocio

Don Cesar se dedica hace 20 años al comercio de frutas y queso. El aprendió esta actividad porque desde adolescente trabajaba con su tío y con esta experiencia que adquirió decidió empezar a trabajar el solo. El vende sus frutas en un triciclo y recorre todos los sectores por su barrio. El empieza a trabajar desde las 8:00am hasta 13:00pm y de 15:00pm hasta 18:00pm de lunes a viernes y los sábados y domingos del 08:00am hasta 13:00pm.

Uso del Préstamo

Don Cesar desea adquirir mas frutas, además que el tiene experiencia en la venta de camarón y desea incrementar esta línea de venta. Y de esta manera atender a sus clientes ya que la demanda que el tiene de sus productos esta en crecimiento. Con el crédito el puede lograr expandirse aun más.

Información Personal

Don Cesar tiene 41 años es casado, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 3 estudian. Su casa es de cemento de un piso y muy sencilla. Su hijo mayor es quien le ayuda con el negocio y su esposa se dedica a las cosas del hogar. El tiene mucho deseo de superarse y aspira mejorar su casa conforme su negocio vaya creciendo y tenga más ganancia. Además de mejorar la calidad de vida de él y su familia.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits and other products.

loans.name: Nabi

texts.en: Nabi M. is a 46-year-old farmer who has one milk cow. He is married and has four children. He recently started sell diary products.  When he started his business in 1999, he was selling meat  in the Saatli bazaar. Nabi lives in in the southern Azerbaijani village of Varkhankend in the Saatli region. Nabi is going to purchase one milk cow to expand his dairy production and one calf to begin selling meat production to the local bazaar trades. The estimated cost for one milk cow is 800 USD and for calf is 400 USD.  He plans to pay the loan back in 18 months.

loans.use: To purchase one milk cow and one calf

loans.name: Ilo

texts.en:
Ilo is 38 years old, married with 6 children. Her husband is a farmer. Over the years they have had a hard time in cleaning their farm, especially weeding. They sell vegetables in the market and sometimes in the village, but sometimes its hard because people do not buy much in a day. Through hard work and struggling, Ilo and her family have managed to look after their vegetables well using the right chemicals to keep away the insects.

Ilo is a happy mother and she is always thankful for such a great opportunity given by SPBD so that she can improve her garden.

loans.use: To buy weed-killing chemicals, fertilizers, and other supplies for her vegetable garden

loans.name: Jeyran

texts.en: Jeyran S.  is a 49-year-old farmer who sells dairy products and poultry in the  southern part of Azerbaijan, Bilasuvar region.  She is a dislocated person  who fled from Nagorny Karabakh to Bilasuvar during Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict in 1993. She is married and has 4 children. Poultry and meat are in high demand all across Azerbaijan and people use it  in every day life. Jeyran works very hard to keep her family in good condition, however it is not enough, because prices for products increase every year. As she and her husband are unemployed, selling milk, yoghurt, eggs and hens is not enough and she applied for  a 1200 USD loan to purchase 4 calves for an estimated price 300 USD each.

loans.use: To purchase 4 calves

loans.name: Constância Mário

texts.pt:
Constância Mário C. is married with three children. She lives in the Albazine neighborhood. She joined the program on Nov. 16th, 2006, with a loan of 3000 meticais. She is now in her third loan cycle and will borrow the amount of 5000 meticais, to pay back in five months. She sells her goods in the Xiquelene market. She sells liquor and wines. The funds are to invest in her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Ilse Ackerman, Kiva volunteer.

Constância Mário C., portadora do BI nº 18966591, casada com 3 filhos vive no bairro de albazine entrou no programa a 16/11/06 tomando o emprestimo de 3000 mt agora esta no 3º ciclo vai tomar o valor de 5000 mt para pagar em 5 meses vende no mercado Xiquelene vende Bebidas secas e vinhos o valor é para investir no negócio.

loans.use: increase stock

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en: Mariatu K. is 36 years old and married with 3 children.  Her business of selling refreshments used to be on a very small scale, and then after several small loans, she purchased a second-hand freezer for cooling soft drinks, and it has attracted many customers, especially during summer.  Mariatu would like to expand her business as summer is approaching, and would like a loan of $1,025 to help.

loans.use: Mariatu is trying to meet the anticipated demand for cold beverages, and needs additional capital to accomplish this.

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.es:
Mr. Dionisio is 46 years old and lives with his family in the community of San Ignacio, the capitol of Ticuantepe. He is in the business of producing and selling pitahaya, or strawberry pears. This fruit is produced in high temperatures and long periods of droughts. This is adequate in the community which Mr. Dioniso lives. He dedicates his whole day to maintaining the irrigation and cultivation of the area. Two of his four sons support him in his production of this fruit. The first crop of strawberry pears is taken in the month of April and requires greader care of the sheeths where the fruit is lodged. Everyone in his family works together like a team. His wife does the marketing of various products. This activity is done to pay the family expenses in months where there is no harvest. Thier income is bettered because she has already marketed products to stores in Ticuantepe. IN this method, the family has increased their standard of living. His main desire is to initiate the production of other crops like vegetables, since these products are consumed by many families in Nicaragua.

This story has been translated from Spanish to English by Nikita Ramchandani, KIVA Volunteer.

El señor Dionisio tiene 46 años de edad, habita con su familia en la comunidad de San Ignacio, municipio de Ticuantepe, se dedica a la producción y comercialización del cultivo de pitahaya, el cual es una fruta que se produce en temperaturas elevadas y a largos periodos de sequías, lo cual se asienta de manera adecuada en la comunidad donde habita don Dionisio, le dedica todo el día al mantenimiento y riego del cultivo, dos de sus cuatro hijos le apoyan en el proceso productivo de dicha fruta. La primera cosecha de pitahaya esta por salir en el mes de abril, por lo cual requiere de mayor cuido en las vainas donde se aloja el fruto. Todos los integrantes de esta familia trabajan unidos como equipo, la esposa del señor se dedica a comercializar productos varios, actividad con la cual hacen frente a todos los gastos familiares en los meses que no hay cosecha y los ingresos mejoran cuando la producción esta lista para comercializarla en los mercados y plazas de Ticuantepe. De esta manera es como esta familia ha logrado mejorar su nivel de vida. El mayor deseo del señor es la de iniciar a producir otros cultivos como hortalizas, ya que son productos muy consumidos por las familias nicaragüenses.

loans.use: To buy Organic Guarantees.

loans.name: Evelina

texts.en: Evelina has a business selling pancakes and ice cakes at a busy market in Apia, Samoa. She is a sharp businesswoman who always tries to keep the recipe of her products secret so that it will be in demand with her customers. Business growth is one of her biggest goals for the future. She has requested a loan to increase her business. This will allow her to purchase new ingredients for her new menu and continue her business development while serving many grateful customers.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks for her pancake and ice cake business

loans.name: Zhanna

texts.en:
As a married mother, Zhanna also manages to successfully run her own beauty salon, called “Light”, in downtown Zaporozhye, Ukraine. She started her business 3 years ago. One of the main secrets of her success is a favorable location in a college neighborhood. Many students and professors visit regularly and have become loyal clients. Zhanna loves her work. She hires all her own staff and manages the finances herself. Currently, her monthly net profit is about $500.

Zhanna would like to purchase new furniture and equipment for her beauty salon — chairs, mirrors and manicure devices that will increase the efficiency and quality of her nail care services. To this end, she is requesting a loan of approximately $525 US. With the additional profits, Zhanna plans to continue developing her business so it will provide a stable and consistent income for her family.

loans.use: To help purchase new furniture and equipment for beauty salon

loans.name: Abdumuslim

texts.ru:
Abdumuslim P. is a resident of the Nurek region. He is 24 years old, is married and has 1 child. Abdumuslim raises livestock. He purchases calves at the market, fattens them and resells them at the local market for profit. This business is the sole source of income for his family. Today, Abdumuslim would like to purchase another calf and he needs money to do this. He has decided to take out a 6 month loan.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Пиров Абдумуслим житель района Нурек. Возраст 24 года, женат, имеет 1 ребенка. Абдумуслим занимается животноводством. Он покупает на рынке молодых бычков , откармливает их и перепродает на местном рынке по выгодной ему цене. Эта деятельность является единственным источником дохода его семьи. В данный момент клиент хочет купить очередного бычка.Для чего ему нужны деньги.Поэтому он решил взять кредит сроком на 6 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase calf

loans.name: Norma Suyapa's Group

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Norma Suyapa G.  tengo 29 años de edad, tengo una niña que esta cursando la primaria, mi actividad principal es la elaboracion de chicharras de cerdo, tengo 5 años de dedicarme a este negocio y tambien cuando termino la jornada de venta de chicharras, me pongo a costurar y hago blusas y faldas para damas lo cual me genera mas ingresos para mantener mi hogar y mi hija, actualmente la demanda a crecido y no cuento con el capital suficiante para satisfacer a mis clientes, ya que ahora en nuestra ciudad se juegan partidos de futbol, y la venta de las chicharras son buenas en estos tipos de eventos, es por lo que estoy solicitando su apoyo monetario para poder salir adelante con mis metas.

loans.use: compra de lonja de cerdo, leña, sal, manteca, bolsas, chile.

loans.name: Angelista's Bahati Group

texts.en:
Angelista is a married woman with three children aged 32, 39, and 24. She is a chicken seller. Every day, she works from 6am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $400 from her sales.

Angelista now hopes for a loan to buy more chickens for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member who has business dealing with hardware sales.

loans.use: To buy more chicken for her business.

loans.name: Šaha

texts.en: Šaha is from Miričina, a small place near the town Gračanica. She is 46 years old and has two sons who are going to the primary school.  Šaha sells poultry, and she can earn about 250 KM monthly. She will use this loan in the amount of 1500 KM to buy more chickens for fattening. Her wish is to expand the business with chickens and to extend the hen house. This has been her wish for a long time.

loans.use: To buy more chicken.

loans.name: Nelva Jesús

texts.es:
La señora Nelva Jesús V. D. Luján tiene 58 años y vive en la avenida Campo Bello 216 en el distrito D. Mache provincia D. Otuzco, departamento D. La Libertad Perú.
Ella estudio hasta el cuarto año D. educación primaria, no pudo continuar sus estudios porque en el tiempo en el que estudiaba la escuela tenia solamente hasta ese grado y su madre no la podía enviar a otro lugar para que continúe sus estudios.
Se casó muy joven con Alipio Luján y tuvo un hijo, enviudó y tuvo un segundo compromiso del cual tiene seis hijos, actualmente dependen D. ella dos un varón y una mujer.
Nelva Jesús se dedica a vender víveres y comida, recuerda que empezó con muy poco capital, pero ahora su negocio ha crecido y es en su propia casa.
Recuerda que su primer préstamo con Manuela Ramos fue D. 300 soles para ser devueltos en 4 meses, los invirtió en carne víveres y cerveza, tiene cerca D. nueve años en el banco comunal.
Con este préstamo D. S/ 300 soles, el cual cancelará en 4 cuotas, comprará víveres para surtir su negocio. 
Su gran sueño es tener una linda casa en Trujillo y vivir allí con sus hijos.
Actualmente solamente pertenece a su Banco Comunal Mujeres D. Mache.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nelva Jesus V. D. L. is 58 years old and lives on Campo Bello avenue in Mache, Otuzco in the state of La Libertad, Peru. She studied through the 4th year of elementary school, but could not continue studying because in that time, her school only taught through the 4th graD. and her mother couldn't afford to send her elsewhere to continue her studies. She got married very young to Alipio L. with whom she had one son. She was widowed and re-married; with her second spouse, she had 6 children and currently one daughter and one son are still her dependents. Nelva Jesus sells groceries and food; she started with very little capital but now her business has grown and she operates it out of her own home. Her first loan from the Manuela Ramos organization was for $125 and she repaid it in 4 months; she invested it in meat, groceries, and beer. She has been a member of the village bank for 9 years. With this $125 loan which she will repay in 4 payments, she will purchase groceries to supply her business. She dreams of having a beautiful home in the city of Trujillo and living there with her children. Currently, she only belongs to the village bank in Mache.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of groceries

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 25-year-old Asha I. from Mbeya. She is married and has two children, ages one and six. Asha has been running a tailoring business since 2005. She works at the business for eight hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by her husband. Asha currently earns about $50 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of $250 USD to purchase cloth. In the future, she plans to open another business. Asha thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase cloth

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to build an oven to dry bricks, raises pigs & poultry

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es: Cesar, joven de 19 años de edad, es el hijo mayor y vive en la casa de sus padres con sus hermanos menores. En el Pueblo de Cesar se dedican a labrar la tierra desde noviembre hasta mayo, con sumo cuidado en los sembríos, y el resto del año en pastar ganado, cada fin de semana va de compras a la ciudad y de paso visita a sus familiares. A él le agrada mucho las labores agrícolas, pero lo malo es que no puede confiarse mucho de la chacra porque son temporales, entonces tiene que esperar a la lluvia, para que la  semilla germine. Ha sembrado 2 hectáreas de papa y está preocupado por la falta de lluvia, por ello tiene anhelos de comprar terreno de regadío, para no tener que preocuparse más por la  lluvia o por el hielo, que provocan la perdida de sus sembríos. Es la primera vez que acude a MFP, por lo cual se compromete en pagar sus cuotas en las fechas fijadas. Con el dinero solicitado comprará 6 sacos de fertilizantes y abono para su chacra, además está muy agradecido por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Cesar is a young man of 19 years old. He is the oldest child and lives in his parents' house with his younger siblings. In his village, Cesar works the land from November until May, taking utmost care in planting, and the rest of the year he grazes livestock. Every weekend he goes to the city to go shopping and to visit his relatives. They are very grateful to him for his agricultural work, but the bad thing is that he cannot rely heavily on the crops because they are seasonal, so he has to wait for the rain for the seeds to germinate. He has planted 2 hectares of potatoes and is worried about the lack of rain. He therefore longs to purchase irrigated land, so that he no longer has to worry about the rain or ice, which can cause him to lose his crops. This is the first time that he has come to MFP (Microfinanzas Prisma, a Kiva field partner), and therefore he commits to making his payments on the set dates. With the money requested, he will buy 6 sacks of fertilizer for his small farm. Additionally, he is very grateful for the opportunity this brings him.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for his small farm

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is a member of the Orquideas (“Orchids”) Village Bank. Lucila is 34 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their four children. Lucila lives in Vilcashuaman Province, located five hours from the city of Ayacucho. 

Lucila has a store in her home, where she sells dry goods, fruit and meat. She and her husband also own a car, which they use for inter-provincial transport. 

Lucila needs a loan of 2,550 soles to buy milk, rice and sugar.  Lucila’s dreams are to educate her children and to expand her businesses. 


Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Lucila es socia del Banco Comunal Orquídeas. 
Lucila es conviviente, tiene 34 años y 4 hijos, Lucila vive en la provincia de Vilcashuaman que se ubica a 5 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho, Lucila tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes, frutas, carnes. Además Lucila junto a su esposo tienen un carro con el cual realiza transporte interprovincial. 
Lucila necesita un préstamo de 2550 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leche, arroz, azúcar. 
Los sueños de Lucila son educar a sus hijos, hacer crecer sus negocios.

loans.use: To buy milk, rice and sugar

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị's Group

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị H. (11 03 0026), 35 tuổi, hiện đang sống cùng chồng và 2 con nhỏ. Gia đình chị ngoài làm ruộng còn trồng lúa, hoa màu còn nuôi rất nhiều gà đẻ trứng. Chu kì trước chị đã vay và hoàn trả rất tốt món vay của mình. Chị rất thích hình thức trả tuần của chương trình nên tiếp tục vay 4704000 đồng/ 50 tuần/ chu kì 2 để bổ sung vốn mua cám nuôi gà đẻ. Gia đình chị thu nhập khá ổn định khoảng 200000 – 250000 đồng/ ngày. 
	Anh Trần
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị H., 35 years old, lives with her husband and two young children.  Her family grows rice and fresh produce, and keeps a large number of laying hens.  In the previous lending cycle, she repaid her loan with no problem.  She is very comfortable with the system of repaying in weekly installments, and hopes to again borrow 4,704,000 VND (275 USD), to be repaid over 50 weeks, to invest in buying feed for her chickens.  The total income of her family is quite stable at about 200,000 - 250,000 VND (12 - 15 USD) per day. 
Mr. Trần

loans.use: Feed for laying hens

loans.name: Tujisaidie Group

texts.en:
Mwantab has been a juice and bites seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 2 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $175. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items (eg. juice) for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money.

Mwantab is 24 years old, married, and has two children: ages 6 years and 6 months. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members: Rahma, Sada, Amina and Dalila. Each woman also has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more items (eg. juice) for her business.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Chúc 33 tuổi, gia đình chị có hai con còn nhỏ. Chị là thành viên của Quỹ tình thương từ đầu năm 2008.  Hiện tại hai vợ chồng chị  Chúc đang làm nghề thu mua phế liệu và buôn bán hoa quả. Đây cũng là những công việc đem lại nguồn thu  chính cho gia đình chị với thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn cho công việc thu mua phế liệu và buôn bán hoa quả của gia
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Chúc, 33 years old, has two young children. She has been a member of the TYM Fund since the beginning of 2008. Currently, Mrs. Chúc and her husband work together selling recyclable scrap materials and also selling fruit. These two activities are the family’s main sources of income, earning them 5,000,000 VND (292 USD) per month. In the next round of lending, she hopes to borrow 9,000,000 VND (525 USD) to invest in both the scrap materials and the fruit selling enterprises of the family.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Scrap materials and Fruit selling

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en:
Sarom S. lives in Chi Chrab village, in Takeo province. She and her husband, Ouch Choek, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice and vegetables to earn a living. Ouch is a hard working man.

Although they try to work hard, they still earn less income than needed to support their family. Thus, Sarom decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to earn income. She is 30 years old and the mother of two children, one attends the local school while the other stays at home to do housework. Her husband is presented on the left of photo.

loans.use: Buy a cow for breeding to earn income.

loans.name: Future In Our Hands Group

texts.en:
This is Samuel A. F., Elizabeth M. B., Patrick A., John A. TarawA., Edmon K. and Henry Sesay. They work for a local non-governmental organization called Future In Our Hands (FIOH). This is the first time they are seeking a loan from SMT. Because non-governmental organizations' salaries are usually very small and do not allow one to do something big with their lives, they have  come to seek a loan from SMT to allow them to invest in something meaningful. Some of them will invest their loans in business and others will invest in the education of their children.

FIOH started its operations in 1993 and has it headquarters in Makeni with sub-offices in Mile 91 and Kabala in the north, and Pujehun in the south. FIOH focuses its operations on agriculture and food security. They also provide micro-finance services to local villages in their areas of operations. FIOH is doing well in serving the community people in their areas of operations, however, as a donor driven organization, they are often faced with financial constraints. 

Samuel (front row right), who is heading this group, is the Admin Officer of FIOH. He is forty-eight years of age. He was born in a village called Yele, in the Tonkolili district. He is married with six children between the ages of one and nineteen. His wife is a businesswoman. Samuel has worked as an Admin Officer for FIOH for three years now. He will use his loan to buy building materials for housing. Though he is not expecting to complete the building of his house with this loan, subsequent loans will certainly complete the building of his house.

loans.use: To buy building materials for housing.

loans.name: Bamba

texts.fr: BAMBA D. EST NE A TUIES LE 15 AOUT 1975.IL EST TOLIER DE PROFESSION ET SON ATELIER SE TROUVE PRES DE LA GARE ROUTIERE.IL TRAVAILLE AVEC SES AMIS MECANICIENS. AVEC CE PRET IL VEUT ACHETER DU MATERIEL POUR RELANCER SON ACTIVITE.
texts.en:
Bamba D. was born in Thiès on 15 August 1975. He is a tinsmith by profession, and his workshop is located near the bus station. He works with his mechanic friends. With this loan, he would like to buy equipment to boost his business.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen his tinsmith business

loans.name: Pabouke Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Pabouke est constitué de quatre  femmes mariées toutes monogames  ayant en moyenne  32 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à Hamdallaye,  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3 ème région administrative de la république  du Mali). 
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autre la vente des condiments alimentaires,  des chaussures  et  des pagnes wax.  
Afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et d’augmenter leur profit, elles ont décidé de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  elles sont à leur premier prêt de groupe. 
Avec ce prêt, elles comptent acheter  40 pièces de pagnes  wax,  50 paires de chaussures, 60 paniers de condiments alimentaires. 
Elles s’approvisionnent au marché de Bamako, de Médine à Sikasso ville et dans  les localités avoisinantes.  Les marchandises sont vendues la plupart au comptant, dans les différents  marchés de Sikasso et dans les familles à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 12 500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités et le remboursement du prêt.
texts.en:
The Pabouke Group is composed of four married women who are, on average 32 years old and have three children. The majority of the women live in monogamous families in Hamdallaye, one of the neighborhoods in the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They run diverse businesses, which sell, among other things, food seasonings, shoes, and pagnes (traditional wrap-arounds).

In order to satisfy the needs of their clientele and to increase their profits, they decided to join the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, from whom they received their first group loan. With this loan, they intend to buy 40 pieces of pagnes, 50 pairs of shoes, and 60 baskets of food seasonings. The women get their supplies from the markets of Bamako, Médine, and in Sikasso city and the neighboring towns. The merchandise is sold primarily in cash in the different markets of Sikasso and in families. The clientele is composed of men and women. The women expect that each will achieve an average monthly benefit of 12,500 FCFA of which a part will be used for their families’ needs. The other part will be invested in the businesses and repayment of the loans.

Translated from French by Andrew Whiteman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase various goods

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: Sandra tiene 25 años, su interés es ayudar a su familia con los gastos del hogar y aminorar las preocupaciones de su madre por las necesidades dentro de casa. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de ropa al crédito, visita a gran cantidad de personas   en sus domicilios con la finalidad de recibir sus pedidos, esto lo realiza de lunes a viernes, puesto que los fines de semana, en especial a fin de mes, compra su mercadería en las fábricas de ropa y en el mercado central de su ciudad. Sandra les da la facilidad a sus clientes de pagarle en cuotas pequeñas durante el mes, tiempo en que las visita periódicamente para cobrarles. Todo este proceso es muy cansado, debido a la distancia que tiene que recorrer para sus visitas, lo cual es una inversión en tiempo y dinero que tiene que saber aprovechar debidamente. Su mayor  anhelo es conseguir una tienda donde pueda vender sus prendas y dejar de realizar estos largos recorridos, además de establecerse en un local donde la puedan visitar sus clientas. Este es su 9no crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA, ella está muy contenta en su banco comunal porque existe armonía e identificación con el logro de sus metas. Con los 1800 soles adquirirá la mercadería que requiere, ya que se quedó sin prendas por la falta de capital de inversión.
texts.en:
Sandra is 25 years old. She is interested in helping her family with household expenses, thus ameliorating her mother's worries about the running of the household. For about three years she has been selling clothing on credit, visiting a great number of people at their homes in order to receive their orders. She does this from Mondays through Fridays, utilizing the weekends to purchase her merchandise at the wholesale clothing shops and the central market in her town. Sandra gives credit to her clients who pay her in small installments during the month, when she visits them regularly to collect. This entire process is very labor intensive and tiring, due to the long distances she has to cover in her visits. This is large investment in time and money which she has to manage quite carefully. Her biggest desire is to obtain a shop where she can sell her articles and stop making all those trips, as well as establish herself in a permanent location where her clients can visit her. This is her ninth credit with Microfinanzas PRISMA. She is very happy with her community bank, because there is harmony and recognition of her accomplishments. With the 1800 soles that she will obtain she will buy merchandise, since her stock is totally depleted from lack of funds to replenish it.

Translated from Spanish by Monica Hayden, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en:
Saleh is 22 years old and lives with his wife in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon. Saleh has been working as a car electrician for five years. He is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase car batteries and tools for his work. This is the first time that Saleh has requested a loan.

Saleh is successful in his work because he does it well and charges competitive prices. His clients are his friends, neighbors and tourists. When he first started his business, he had financial issues. Saleh set up as a car electrician because he wanted to have independent and stable work. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase car batteries and tools for his work

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
"Before, it was so difficult to farm. I can't believe this is our livelihood. It’s really hard, working under the heat of the sun. But if you think of your children and their future, you will do everything to earn better to support their needs," says Jocelyn C., the 26-year-old mother of three children.

Jocelyn would like to ask a loan of Php 7,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI). She will use the loan to buy fertilizers. By doing so, she thinks it will be a great help in increasing her harvest.

Now, she continues obtaining the services of CEVI. She obtains loans, training and insurance coverage for herself.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Сафарали

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan
Эрматов Сафарали мужчина , который получает повторный кредит на расширение бизнеса скотоводства. У него сейчас несколько голов баранов и коз. Каждый день Сафарали выпроваживает свой скот на пастбище, где он питается травой. Сафарали с детства инвалид , у него одна рука плохо развита, поэтому  ему по бизнесу помогает его сыновья.
Сафарали покупает скот на рынках сам . т.к.он хорошо разбирается  в породистых мелкорогатых скотах. На полученный кредит Сафарали планирует закупить пять голов молодых овец и корма для них.

loans.use: откорм и продажа скота

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena B. is from the village of Baluarte, Lumbia Cagayan De Oro City. She is 39 years old. Elena is married and has 10 school-aged children. To make a living, Elena  engages in business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail business. The main source of income for the business will come primarily from selling of firewood and buying and selling of green bananas in the local community.

In 2008, Elena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Elena is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Elena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve/expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Baluarte, Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: La señora Beatriz vive con su esposo el señor Evaristo, son una pareja de personas de edades mayores pero muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras. Ellos viven solitos pero cuentan con el apoyo de sus hijos que aun estando casados los apoyan económicamente, también perciben una pensión y atienden su propio negocio de abarrotes de nombre “Abarrotes Betty” que lo tiene establecido desde hace 7 años, y día a día se hacen de mas clientes ya que gustan de tener una muy buena atención a su clientela y los productos que el cliente solicite; por tal motivo están solicitando este crédito para la compra de mas mercancía por mayoreo y así obtener mayor ganancia.

loans.use: Inversion al negocio (compra de mercancia)

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en: Emerita B. is from the village of Kuguita, Mambajao, Camiguin. She is 43 years old, is separated from her spouse, and has three school-aged children. Emerita owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling a variety of products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Emerita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Gullahlly Group

texts.en: Gullahlly is the group leader of Gullahlly group. There are five members in this group. All of them would like to receive money for their business.Gullahlly and Shakeba wants to take a loan for their business of general store.Roya wants to take a loan for her brother business of carpenter. Also Gull Andam wants to take a loan for her brother business of metal shop. Mahtab Gull wants to take a loan for her business of bakery. There very happy with this loan in Afghanistan. And thanks all lenders of AFSG and Kiva in Afghanistan.

loans.use: they are expand and progress for their business

loans.name: Sosima

texts.en:
Sosima is 35 years of age and married to Fernando. They are blessed with four children: Mark John-14 years old high school student;Jeffrey-12 years old high school; Jefferson-12 years old elementary pupil and Jasmine-3 years old.

Sosima is selling a variety of  goods such as ponytails,cuticle remover and threads in their village.  She would like to borrow additional capital amounting PHP5,000. This amount she is requesting will be utilized in purchasing additional goods for her vending activity. She hopes that she could obtain the amount of loan she is asking so that she could further improve their way of living through her business.

loans.use: Additional capital for business

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es: La señora Milagros es una mujer trabajadora y perseverante, vive en la cuidad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali, tiene 44 años, madre de una hija que es mayor de edad, Milagros se dedica a la venta de salchipapas y pollos brostrer, actividad que realiza todos los días de la semana, también vende salchipollo por las noches, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se desempeña como perito forestal. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Carmen Cabrejos” desde hace dos años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que le permitió invertir en gaseosas. Este crédito de 1000 soles  será utilizado para comprar artículos como arroz, azúcar, aceite, papas, pollos y otros insumos más para vender. La meta de Milagros es tener un galpón y dedicarse a la crianza de pollos para distribuirlos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Milagros is a hard-working and persistent woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa, located in the Ucayali region. She is 44 years old, and the mother of one daughter who is now grown. Milagros dedicates herself to selling salchipapas (sausage and French fries) and roasted chickens every day of the week. She also sells salchipollo (fried chicken with French fries) in the evenings. She counts on the support of her husband, who works as a forest ranger. She has been a member of the “Carmen Cabrejos” cooperative bank for two years, having received a first loan of 300 Peruvian soles that allowed her to invest in soft drinks. This loan of 1,000 soles will be used to buy items such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, potatoes, chicken and other ingredients to sell. Milagros’ goal is to have a shed and dedicate herself to raising chickens to distribute to customers.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will use her loan to buy items such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, potatoes, chicken, and other supplies to sell.

loans.name: Bulamubwoka Group Of Mukono

texts.en:
Shaminah N. is the leader of her group in Mukono. She is 30 years old and married with four children — the oldest child is 14 years old and the youngest child is 6. She also cares for one orphan as well, her deceased sister’s child, and pays for all five children’s educations. 

Shaminah sells charcoal and has been doing so for seven years.  She attributes her success in the enterprise to her stall’s highly trafficked location and her good customer service. She is hopeful that the loan of 300,000 USH will allow her to increase inventory and thereby increase sales. One day Shaminah hopes to build and own a residence for her entire family.

loans.use: More inventory for her charcoal business

loans.name: Lusia Awour

texts.en: Lusia Awour K. has been running the Mama Biti Kiosk and selling clothes, shoes and cosmetics to frequent customers for the last six years.  The business is within Kakamega town.  Her business challenges are low demand from customers and insecurity.  She is using the proceeds of KES30,000 to buy more clothes in preparation for the festive season.  In addition, she does farming.  She wants to expand the business and open more branches.  Lusia is married and has four children ranging from four to 18 years old. She describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Piriyev

texts.en: Piriyev A. is 58 years old. He is married and has three children. A. lives in Baku city. He has had a taxi business for 20 years. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy spare parts to improve his taxi business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Moustafa

texts.en:
Moustafa is a man who lives in southern Lebanon with his wife and their child. Moustafa has been working as a mason since 1999. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools and electrical wires for his work. This is the first time that Moustafa has requested a loan. 

Moustafa is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are people from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t have experience so it wasn’t easy for him to build networking, as well as he had learn the new techniques in order to face the competition. Moustafa decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools and electrical wires for his work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her ability to invest in her business

loans.name: Obiya East B Lucy Okello Group

texts.en: Lucy O. is the group representative of this five-member group. She is forty-three years old and married with seven children, all in school. She also cares for three siblings. She owns a retail shop business which she has been operating for over two years. She is using the loan to purchase items to sell, such as sugar, salt, soap, cooking oil, and so forth. She is a hardworking business woman whose dream is to invest more in her business.

loans.use: To buy sugar, salt, soap, cooking oil, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
Isata K. lives in Freetown, the capital city of Sierra Leone, with her husband and her son. She sells rice by the cup, garden eggs (eggplant), bottles of oil, salt and groundnuts at Tengbeh town market in Freetown.

Isata K. has been with LAPO, SL for two years now. With the profit that emanated from her business she has built a house.

With the help of LAPO, SL and Kiva lenders she is asking for a loan of 1,500,000 leones. With  this loan she intends to expand her business by buying more rice, garden eggs, oil, Maggi cubes (a product for enhancing the flavor of soups and stews), salt and groundnuts to sell.

loans.use: To purchase rice, garden eggs, oil, Maggi cubes, salt and groundnuts

loans.name: Alassane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Alassane W. est un maître maçon depuis 1994. Agé de 39 ans, il est marié et père de 3 enfants.  Pour diversifier ses activités et augmenter ses revenus, Monsieur W. s’est lancé dans le transport.  Ainsi, il compte actuellement à  son actif deux taxis (jaune-noire). 
Ensuite, il s’est transformé en taximan et donne l’autre taxi à son proche. Cependant, il sollicite un prêt de 500 000 FCFA pour réfectionner une des voitures. Il compte changer le moteur et quelques pièces afin de mieux se profiter de la traite.
 Il pense enfin que ce crédit pourra  donner  plus de valeurs à sa voiture,  d’accroitre sa part de marché  et de satisfaire les clients qui sont de plus en plus exigeants quant à la qualité de taxi.
texts.en:
Mr. Alassane W. has been a professional mason since 1994. He is 39 years old and is a father of three. He decided to diversify his business activities and increase revenues by entering the transport business, and now he has two taxis in his fleet (yellow and black). Following their purchase he decided to become a taxi driver and lent the other taxi to a close friend. However, he is seeking a 500 000 FCFA loan in order to repair one of his cars; he wishes to change the engine and a few other parts in order to generate better profits from this trade. He believes that this loan would increase the value of his car, increase his market share and satisfy his customers' increasing demands for quality.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: repairing a taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy books

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina V. is requesting for a larger amount of loan through ASHI. This will finance the growth of her hog fattening business. By fattening a larger volume of hogs, and selling them all together after four months, his proceeds will be much larger. With this plan, she will augment the small income of her husband, who is a hired laborer. This will enable her to support the needs of her eight children, whose ages range from three to 25 years old. Although two of the children work as hired laborers, their income is just small and they still depend on their mother for some of their basic needs. 

Despite being poor and having many children to support, Josefina is still optimistic about achieving her goal of graduating at least one of her children from college. For her business, she hopes to make it more stable and profitable for her children to inherit and manage in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets for fattening.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is 52 years old and married with five children between the ages of 15 and 30 years old. His youngest child is still attending school.

He is a farmer from Nyamira town in the South Rift region of Kenya. He has been farming for nineteen years and his main product is maize which he sells locally. He also owns some rental houses and earns income from the monthly rent that he collects. His main challenges in farming are limited agricultural land and capital for expansion.

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 70,000 KES to purchase a cow after successfully completing his previous loan for 50,000 KES. The extra income from this loan will help him pay school fees for his child who is still in school.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita A. is from the village of Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 52 years old. Teresita is married and has an adult child. To make a living, Teresita owns and operates a manufacturing business. The main source of income for the business comes from manufacturing and selling products like "tinagaktak" (a crispy, rice-based dessert) to local businesses and community members. Teresita has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos a month from it. In 2010, Teresita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This will be the first loan taken out by Teresita from GDMPC, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Saveoun's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Saveoun R. is a group leader who has been selected by four members in Boeng Leu village in Kandal province. All the members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Saveoun R. was born in 1981. She and her husband, Mr. Sothy Theib, are farmers who own a small piece of land to cultivate crops to sell to support their family. They have a problem in that their home is too old to live in but they do not have enough money to rectify this. Mrs. Saveoun R. is, therefore, requesting a loan to build her own home. She is the mother of two children who are all too young to work or study.

loans.use: To build her own home

loans.name: Floriza

texts.es: Floriza, de 45 años, es una mujer ejemplar que sola supo sacar adelante a su familia, pues es viuda desde hace 16 años, tiene 6 hijos pero solo vive con el menor de sus hijos y sus tres nietos en su casa propia. Su oficio desde hace 30 años, es la agricultura, cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos para evitar que él se canse mucho en este trabajo y de esa manera pueda agilizar su actividad.De las ganancias que obtiene de la venta de su cosecha, lo derivará para los gastos domésticos, es por ello que le dedica tiempo, y procura que los insectos ataquen sus plantaciones, por lo que cada tiempo coloca trampas. El cultivar piña, plátanos, yuca, maíz y café es bastante rentable para ella, con el tiempo desea renovar sus plantaciones para tener mayor productividad, de igual modo planea instalar una tienda de comestibles en su casa, para generar mayores beneficios económicos. Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y  esta emocionada de continuar laborando en su grupo comunal, porque considera que las personas de su grupo son muy buenas y trabajadoras. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico para nivelar su producción y cosechar granos de café más grandes.
texts.en:
Floriza is 45 years old and an exemplary woman who is able to move her family forward by herself. She has been a widow for 15 years and has six children, but now lives in her own home with her youngest child and three grandchildren. Floriza has been a farmer for 30 years. She has the help of her children which keeps her from tiring easily and speeds up the completion of the work. Using the money she earns from selling her crops, Floriza is able to pay for household expenses. For this reason, she spends time during each planting setting up traps to prevent her crops from being attacked by insects. Floriza grows pineapples, bananas, cassava, corn, and coffee. Since she considers these crops to be profitable, she hopes in time to improve her planting so that she will experience greater production. Floriza also would like to open a food store in her home so that she will have the benefit of more income.

This is the third time she has received a loan from MFP. Floriza is excited about continuing to work with her Communal Bank because the members are considered to be good people and hard workers. The loan she requested will be used to buy several sacks of organic fertilizer so that she can stabilize her production and have a harvest that results in larger coffee beans.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Mujeres Solidarias 2 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Milagros is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres SolidA. 2 & 4 (Solidarity Women). She makes her home in a simple structure with her longterm partner and one child. She says that her most difficult challenge is to add some services to her house, like running water. In the meantime she plans to continue to enjoy sharing with more people like her neighbors and family.

Milagros is excited to be taking her 7th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for over three years, starting with her first loan.

Milagros plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying cosmetics and personal and household products from catalog sales. She will use the profits to buy a refrigerator and a motorcycle to move faster and carry her products easily. She want to have a successful business and be a professional.
 
This associate began with Esperanza because she wanted to have a better life with more opportunities. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

The rural area surrounding Hato Mayor is an area where the economy is dominated by agriculture. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water (none of which is potable).

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics and personal and household products to sell

loans.name: Haseena's Group

texts.en:
Haseena is a very talented woman who earns a living by making and selling shawls in the Pakistani city of Multan, which is famous for its history and warm weather. She is 38 years old, married and has lived in Multan for the last 15 years. She started her business five years ago to help her husband in his business, which also consists of selling shawls. Now they both do the same work but in different areas -- her husband sells in big cities such as Islamabad and Lahore, while she sells locally. 
 
Haseena has applied for a loan from Asasah to buy more shawls to sell to her customers. She also leads the five-person loan group whose members we see here. Her goal is to improve her family's living standards and, over time, expand her small business into a large one.

loans.use: To buy shawls to resell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more jewelry to sell

loans.name: Maane

texts.en: Maane N. cooks rice for sale. She also sells secondhand clothing in Elmina. Maane not received any formal education. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a prison officer. Maane has been selling rice and secondhand clothes for 25 years. She helps her husband with the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy additional foodstuffs to cook for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop.

loans.use: To buy additional foodstuffs to cook for sale

loans.name: Wilson Fernando

texts.es: El Sr Wilson vive en la avenida 2 de agosto junto a su esposa y sus dos hijas en la casa de su madre, es un hombre muy trabajador además un cliente antiguo de Emprender que ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus pagos, Su actividad es la de transporte de pasajeros cuenta con un vehículo propio el cual lo trabaja como taxi todos los días el lleva y trae a sus hijas del colegio , También cuenta con un Bar- Rokola el cual funciona los días viernes, sábados  y domingos que lo atiende por las noches. En si el crédito que necesita es para reparar su vehículo , cambiar motor . El Sr Wilson esta en planes de comprar una casa propia para así brindarles a sus hijitas comodidad.
texts.en:
Sr. Wilson lives with his wife and two daughters at his mother’s house located along August 2nd Avenue. He is a hardworking gentleman who has been a longtime client of Emprender, having demonstrated that he is responsible and prompt with his payments. His business involves providing passenger transportation services, utilizing his own vehicle as a taxi. Every day he takes his daughters to and from school. Wilson also has a jukebox that he operates on Friday, Saturday, and Sunday evenings.

The loan he is requesting will be used to repair his vehicle and replace the motor. Sr. Wilson plans to buy his own house so that his daughters will be more comfortable.

loans.use: Repair his vehicle & replace the motor

loans.name: María

texts.en:
María is part of the communal bank “Luz de Esperanza” and resides in the city of Concepción. María makes empanadas and sells them wholesale to a business, a fixed client. She complete orders and delivers at weekends. María also produces baked goods, such as tarts and candies, when she receives pre-orders. In the summer María makes corn pot pie (similar to chicken pot pie but with a freshly made corn crust) and humitas (corn tamales). For many years María has owned an industrial oven. At first, she purchased it without any intention of using it for business reasons, but when her husband died, about 13 years ago, she began to use it to cook and soon after started selling her products. In the future, María dreams of owning a small restaurant, occupying a space in her home.
With this loan María will purchase materials out of stock and would like to start gathering materials for mid-November, to make panettone bread for Christmas. She has valued the weekly payment structure of Kiva partner, Fondo Esperanza, which helps her remain organized with her accounting. María has benefited from lessons on business administration.
Concepción sits in the mouth of the BioBío River, one of the largest in the country, south of Chile, within the BíoBío region. Concepción has had an important role in the history of Chile, as home to major battles and important settlements, especially during the War of Arauco, and borders the Mapuche territory (indigenous settlement). Currently, the city has an important economic and demographic, administrative, financial and most important commercial relevance for Chile, right after Santiago and Valparaíso.

loans.use: To purchase baking materials

loans.name: Paz

texts.es: Paz B. C. de 59 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Usulután, ella es una persona muy trabajador quien vive junto a su pequeña nieta de 9 años de edad, la cual esta a cargo de la señora Paz. Ella posee una tienda de productos perecederos, la cual esta ubicada en su casa de habitación, negocio el cual le permite contar con todo lo necesario para el hogar y su familia, es por esta razón que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda  contar con el dinero necesario para equipar su negocio con todo lo necesario para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, ya que en muchas ocasiones se ve obligada a perder algunas ventas, ya que no posee los productos que le solicitan, circunstancias las cuales ella desea poder cambiar, para mejorar y salir adelante con su negocio. Paz es una señora muy visionaria quien siempre desea salir adelante e ir creciendo día con día por el bienestar de ella y su hogar, ya que para ella es muy importante poder aportar a su casa y de esta forma poder vivir de una manera tranquila en la cual pueda contar con todo lo necesario para su nieta y para ella.
texts.en: Paz B. C. is 59 years old.  She lives in Usulután department.  She is a very hard-working person who lives together with her 9 year-old granddaughter who is in her care.  She has a store where she sells perishable goods.  The store is located in her home and her business provides her home and her family with everything they need.  Paz is requesting a loan as it will give her the money she needs to stock her business with everything she needs to provide her customers with a better service.  She often has to lose sales when she doesn't have in stock the products which her customers are asking for.  These are circumstances which she would like to be able to alter and improve in order to succeed in her business.  Paz is a very visionary woman who always wants to succeed and grow day by day for her own wellbeing and that of her household.  It is very important to her that she be able to provide for her household and live comfortably with everything she needs for her granddaughter and herself.

loans.use: Purchase of essential goods for her household

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana es socia del banco comunal El Arenal, ubicado en el Distrito de Callería, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 41 años de edad y está casada , tiene 2 hijos menores que todavía dependen de ella.
Lleva 1 año trabajando con Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue de 300.00 soles.
La señora Juana se dedica al servicio de alquiler de cuartos, desde hace tiempo, con los prestamos de Manuela  Ramos está haciendo arreglos  para mejorar la presentación de sus habitaciones y pueda alquilar aun mejor precio.
Con éste préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 soles, lo invertirán en la implementación de un  baño, comprarará un juego de baño, una ducha,  una llave de ducha, pegamento, teflón,un balde de pintura y una bolsa de cemento. 
Con el poco tiempo que lleva en Manuela Ramos, Juana está mejorando partes de su casa, lo cual le genera ingresos para mantener a su familia.
Agradece a Manuela Ramos por el apoyo brindado a su persona y está muy contenta.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana is a member of the Communal Bank “El Arenal”, which is located in Callería District in the Department of Ucayali. She is 41 years old, married, and has two young children who are dependent on her. Juana has been working with Manuela Ramos for the past year. Her first loan was in the amount of 300 PEN.

Sra. Juana has been renting out rooms for some time. Using the loans from Manuela Ramos, she was able to make renovations to improve the appearance of the rooms so that she could rent them out at a higher price.

With this loan of 1000 PEN, she will install a bathroom. She will buy a bath set, shower, shower faucet, adhesives, Teflon, a bucket of paint, and a bag of cement. In the short time she has been with Manuela Ramos, Juana has made improvements to parts of her house that help generate income to support her family.

She thanks Manuela Ramos for the support provided to her as an individual, which has made her very happy.

loans.use: Purchase materials for installing a bathroom

loans.name: Dagoberto

texts.es: Dagoberto D. de 50 años de edad, reside en el departamento de La Libertad, en donde vive junto a su esposa y cinco hijos. Dagoberto posee una panadería propia en la cual ha ido invirtiendo poco a poco, comprando todas las herramientas necesarias para la elaboración del pan, su negocio  es bastante estable, ya que cuenta con varios clientes fijos a quienes les reparte el pan. Su esposa le ayuda con el trabajo de elaborar el pan y así mismo colabora vendiéndolo en la casa de habitación lugar en el cual se encuentra la panadería. Dagoberto solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar toda la materia prima como: harina, sal, manteca, azúcar y otras más para elaborar más pan. Así de esta manera él espera mejorar su negocio y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Dagoberto Dominguez is 50 years old and lives in the department of La Libertad, where he resides with his wife and five children.  

Dagoberto owns a bakery business which he has built over time, buying all the necessary tools for baking bread.  His business is considerably stable since he has several fixed customers to whom he delivers the bread.  His wife helps in the baking process and also sells bread out of the home in which the bakery is located.

Dagoberto is requesting a loan so he can buy ingredients such as flour, salt, lard, sugar and other ingredients.  In this way he hopes to improve and continue developing his business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make bread.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua A. sells plastic bowls at Abura. She has received junior high level of education. Ekua has been selling plastic bowls for three years. She uses the income she generates from her sales to take care of herself. Demand for her goods is increasing and she is requesting the loan to expand her business. She will use the loan to buy other plastic products requested by her customers.  She plans to reinvest her additional income.

loans.use: expand her plastic goods business

loans.name: Buyan

texts.en: Buyan R. is 33 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in Mongolia's Bayanhongor province. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His daughter attends a local primary school. Buyan operates a clothes trading business out of two different containers in his town with the help of his wife. They began their business in 2006, selling a variety of clothing items in a rented container at the local market, with working capital of 1,500,000 MNT, and over the years they managed to establish a successful business in the local community. After years of stable operation, they have expanded their business, and their earnings have enabled them to purchase two containers which they sell their products from. Today their working capital exceeds 6,000,000 MNT. With their business earnings, they were able to not only expand their business but also greatly improve their quality of life. Also, with their business success, they have managed to buy a car for their family. For the future, they plan to build a house in their yard. Buyan is a talkative and open-minded man and is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more clothing as well as consumer goods to sell from his two containers.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing

loans.name: Modesto

texts.es:
El Señor Modesto Batállanos N. es casado y es padre de familia de 2 hijos a los cuales apoya y ayuda en su educación junto a su esposa, es una persona responsable y trabajadora, el cliente y su esposa tienen una tienda de barrio, ademas el cliente se dedica a la cría de ganado porcino para ser comercializado en los diferentes mercados de Cochabamba y el trópico, también trabaja como trasportista en la localidad de Ivirgarzama, en el cual esta hace mas de 2 años como socio activo, el servicio que brinda es rentable por la alta cantidad de personas que solicitan este servicio por la facilidad,  rapidez y eficiencia. El sindicato cuenta con  una parada y turnos para cada afiliado, donde las personas acuden para solicitar dicho servicio
.
Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un préstamo de nuestra institución cuyo destino será la compra de mercadería para una tienda de barrio en la cual su esposa trabajara y le permitirá también mejorar sus ingresos y consecuentemente mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Señor Modesto Batállanos N. is married and has two children. He and his wife are responsible for their support and education. She is a hardworking dependable woman. 

Modesto and his wife run a neighbourhood shop. Modesto also raises pigs to sell in the various Cochabamba and Trópico markets and works in transportation in the Ivirgarzama area. He’s been an active member of the transportation company for more than two years. It’s a profitable job; many people ask for him because he provides straightforward, quick, and efficient service. For each member, the union organizes shifts and a stop so that customers know where to go to get service. 

This is the first time that Modesto has asked for a loan from our institution. He plans to use the money to buy merchandise for his shop where his wife works, and thus increase income and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his store

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Kong R., 50, is a rice dealer in the local market of her Takeo province. She is married with two children who are still living at home.  She and her husband work growing rice and raising animals. She typically makes US$7 of profit each day, and would like a loan to expand her business. In order to increase her profit, she is asking for US$1200 to purchase a stock of rice to resell. (Kong R. is pictured with her husband from home)

loans.use: To buy rice to resell

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a 26-year-old hardworking married man living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda with a dream of building his own house in the next three years. He has been into motorcycle riding for three years and the business is very profitable. Patrick intends to use the loan to buy land.

loans.use: Buying land

loans.name: Norie

texts.en:
Norie E. is from the village of Omonay, Damulog, Bukidnon. She is 44 years old. Norie is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Norie owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, biscuits, beverages & junk foods in the local community. Norie has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Norie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Norie is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & junk foods. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Norie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the  business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snacks

loans.name: Teglorma Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “TEGLORMA” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Kenema, a city in easterh Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Musu K.. Musu is 37 and was born in a town called Tongor. She is currently residing in Kenema, together with her husband and two children. Her husband is a teacher and her children attend school. For 17 years, Musu has been selling rice and palm oil.
