With her share of this loan, she will buy rice and palm oil at wholesale prices to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy rice and palm oil at wholesale prices to expand her business.

loans.name: Badamsambuu

texts.en:
Badamsambuu, 36, is divorced and lives with his mother in Arhangai province of Mongolia. His mother is retired and stays at home. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on a small plot of land that they own. 

Badamsambuu began selling timber and wood in 2000 in the Hangai wood market of Ulaanbaatar and has been operating it continuously since that time. He is a hardworking and honest person. He is trying to save some more money and buy a truck to operate a goods delivery service in the future. He is requesting a loan of 250,000 Mongolian tugrug (MNT) to buy more timber and for maintenance fees for his car.

loans.use: to buy more timber and to pay for car maintenance

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 32 years old and single. He runs a retail shop located in the Tena Estate off outering road, where he has a good flow of customers. He was introduced to KADET LTD by the credit officer in charge of the Eastlands office.

George has been in this business for three years and earns a monthly profit of Ksh 20,000.  He has applied for a second loan of Ksh 29,500 from KADET LTD to add stocks of flour, sugar, cooking oil and sweets to his retail shop. If the loan boosts his business, he plans to open another shop. 

George hopes to operate a wholesale shop. He describes himself as a very hardworking man.

loans.use: To increase his stocks of flour, sugar, cooking oil, and sweets

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen N. K. is 31 years old and a member of Aim Self Help Group registered under Faulu Kenya. He uses his bicycle to transport meat, vegetables and household items to different vendors. He has ten years of experience in the business.  

Being a married man with two children, he puts extra effort in his business so as to earn enough income to meet his family’s needs. He has requested for 20, 000 Kes to buy two bicycles.

loans.use: To buy two bicycles.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita N. is from the village of Canibungan Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 65 years old. Carmelita is married and has seven adult children. To make a living, Carmelita owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a  variety of grocery products in the local community. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Carmelita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 21,000 PHP which will be used to purchase sugar, noodles, dried fish and rice for sale. This will be the 23rd loan taken out by Carmelita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, noodles, dried fish and rice for sale.

loans.name: Leonor Gioconda

texts.es:
Leonor nació en la provincia de Cusco del departamento del Cusco, ella tiene 35 años, es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos.  

Leonor es un ama de casa y alterna sus actividades del hogar con la elaboración de artesanía, ella nos cuenta que la familia de su esposo tiene como actividad a la artesanía entonces ella también ingreso al negocio. Ahora, ella tiene un pequeño puesto de  venta en el centro arqueológico de Sacsayhuaman. Desde el año 1998 se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Ha solicitado Leonor a la Asociación Arariwa un crédito de 1,000 nuevos soles para adquirir materiales como por ejemplo lana y tejidos.  Con los ingresos de la venta de sus productos cubriría las cuotas del crédito brindado.

Leonor es una persona muy conocida por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable y una buena madre al querer brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia. Leonor tiene como sueño comprarse una casa.
texts.en:
Leonor was born in the Province and Department of Cusco. She is 35 years old, married, and has three children.

Leonor is a homemaker and divides her time between her household activities and making crafts. She says that her husband’s family has a craft business and she began working there. Now she has a small vending post at the Sacsayhuaman archaeological site. Leonor has had this business since 1998 and has done very well as a result of her efforts.

Leonor is requesting a loan from Asociación Arariwa in the amount of 1000 PEN to buy materials such as wool and woven fabrics. The income she generates from the sale of her products will be used to repay her loan.

Leonor is a person who is well-known for being a hardworking and responsible woman, as well as a good mother who wants to provide a better future for her children and an improved quality of life for her family. She also dreams of buying a house.

loans.use: to purchase wool and woven fabrics.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 44 years old and married with one child who is currently going to school. She works very hard to provide for him. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like milk, groceries, etc.

Victoria has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as spices, soft drinks, canned goods, etc. 

In the future Victoria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase items to sell.

loans.name: Benkadi  3 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes du groupe BENKADI 3 sont toutes mariées et vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants, maris, beaux-parents, belles-sœurs, à NIARADOUGOU. Âgées d’au moins  30 elles ont  6 enfants en moyenne, elles sont très courageuses et très expérimentées.
Elles exercent la culture du maïs du gombo et du poivron, ces produits sont vendus sur les marchés de Sikasso et dans d’autres communes de la région. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs activité agricoles, les membres du groupe ont donc décidés d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y’a plus de 5 ans. Les prêts antérieurs ont tous été correctement remboursés.
DIARATOU, est la présidente de ce groupe, elle se tient au milieu et en position debout, elle compte acheter, 2 sacs d’urée et 10 sacs de complexe. 
Les intrants seront achetés au grand marché de Sikasso. Après les récoltes en fin de campagne, les produits sont stockés pendant un certain  temps pour qu’ils aient de la valeur avant d’être vendus au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso en détail (souvent en gros) à divers client.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 45.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Les dix femmes du groupe BENKADI 3 sont toutes mariées et vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants, maris, beaux-parents, belles-sœurs, à NIARADOUGOU. Âgées d’au moins  30 elles ont  6 enfants en moyenne, elles sont très courageuses et très expérimentées.
Elles exercent la culture du maïs du gombo et du poivron, ces produits sont vendus sur les marchés de Sikasso et dans d’autres communes de la région. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs activité agricoles, les membres du groupe ont donc décidés d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y’a plus de 5 ans. Les prêts antérieurs ont tous été correctement remboursés.
DIARATOU, est la présidente de ce groupe, elle se tient au milieu et en position debout, elle compte acheter, 2 sacs d’urée et 10 sacs de complexe. 
Les intrants seront achetés au grand marché de Sikasso. Après les récoltes en fin de campagne, les produits sont stockés pendant un certain  temps pour qu’ils aient de la valeur avant d’être vendus au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso en détail (souvent en gros) à divers client.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 45.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.

loans.use: Pour l’achat des intrants agricole.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
This is Alicia, 55, a resident of Queson City, Philippines. She is married to Alberto. With her husband, she manages the family household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Alicia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Alicia earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Alicia hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and to repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery products and inventory items needed in her variety store.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is married and the mother of four adult dependents. She is 62 years old and lives in San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Perlita has a small market at home to earn a living. She sells assorted food items, soft drinks, rice and corn grains and canned goods. She has run her business for three years. She earns 3,000 PHP a month from these business. She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase soft drinks and rice and corn grains to sell.

Perlita has been member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Perlita hopes to gain more income to purchase more products to sell.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, rice and corn grains to sell

loans.name: Elidió

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Elidió le está haciendo falta el portón al frente.
Solicita un préstamo para poder pagarle a la perdona que se encargara de realizar el portón y colocarlo. Ya que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la mejora y que le preocupa la seguridad de su familia. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte del ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo como mesero en un restaurante. 
Desea la protección y seguridad de su familia ya que tiene tres hijos de mediana edad quien les preocupa que les pueda pasar algo por no tener la seguridad necesaria en la casa.
texts.en:
Elidió’s house is lacking a gate at the front entrance.  He’s asking for a loan to pay the person who will make and install the gate because he does not have enough money to carry out this improvement and he’s concerned about his family’s security.

He plans to repay the loan with part of the income he earns working as a Waiter in a restaurant.

He wants protection and security for his family because he has two children of medium age and he’s worried that something could happen to them for not having the necessary protection on the house.

loans.use: to install a wrought iron gate at the front entrance of his house.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 26-year-old young man. He is married and has one son.  He lives in Biet Jala city near Bethlehem city located in Palestine. Mohammad has a project (business) repairing vehicles. He wants to renew the essential basic vehicle repair kit that is used in his work. Mohammed has an amount of money that is not enough to pay in cash, so he needs to take a loan of $3,000 from FATEN. 

When Mohammad has the FATEN loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will pay to have the new vehicle repair kit and use it efficiently to do repairs. This will lead to an increase in the quality of work and an improvement of his income. His family will also have better living conditions. Mohammad is photographed in his project.

loans.use: To pay for a new vehicle repair kit

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 26 years. He is 55 years old, widowed, and taking care of his four school-going children. It's the farm income that he uses to sustain his family.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, John hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Siah

texts.en: Siah is 48 years old and lives in Barnersville. She is married and has four children between 19 and 25 years old. The children are attending school and living at home,  She stopped her education in the 8th grade. She started selling charcoal 25 years ago now. In her community, she is the only one who sells charcoal. She makes lot of profit and is able to save money for herself and her children. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. She plans to build a house and a shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal

loans.name: Agnes' Group

texts.en:
Agnes’s group is comprised of six hard-working women. Agnes is 18 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala North region of Uganda. For the past two years, she has been working hard to manage her small restaurant, which delivers hot meals to local families and businesses. 

To help expand her business, Agnes has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy cooking oil and food warmers and will help Agness to generate greater profits and pay her school fees. Agnes hopes that in the future she will be able to become an engineer. 

Agnes is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Agnes's future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil and food warmers.

loans.name: Serigne Medina

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié.Il gère au grand marché de sa localité un magasin de vente de chaussures, de vetements pour femmes et enfants ainsi que des effets de toilette.Cette homme a beaucoup travaillé pour arriver aujourd'hui à satisfaire les besoins de sa famille et de certains de ses amis.Il pourvoie à leur alimentation, leur frais de santé et d'habillement.Son activité lui permet de payer également les factures d'électricité et d'eau.Pour augmenter son stock de marchandises , il sollicite un pret de 500000F afin d'acheter des caisses de chaussures, des balles de vetement et des effets de toilette divers.Son ambition est d'ouvrir d'autres magasins en ville.
texts.en: This borrower is a married man. He runs a store at the grand market in his area and sells shoes, women's and children's clothing, and toiletry items. This man has worked very hard to be able to satisfy the needs of his family and some of his friends. He provides food and pays for health and clothing costs. His business also allows him to pay the water and electric bills. To increase his stock of merchandise, he is seeking a loan of 500,000 F in order to buy cases of shoes, bundles of clothing, and various toiletry items. His ambition is to open additional stores in the city.

loans.use: To buy cases of shoes, bundles of clothing, and various toiletry items.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio Sison is from Centro 1, Angadanan, Isabela. He is 53 years old. Rogelio is married and has four children. To make a living, Rogelio owns and operates a business of managing food production and sales. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling different kinds of street foods near the market. He has been engaged in his business for four years and earns approximately 300 PHP a day for these activities.

He is now requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase meat, liver and other raw ingredients for his street food business. In the future, he wants to enhance his business to ensure that he can meet all his customers' demands for delicious food, and in that way, he will be able to increase his earnings, too. He also aspires to a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase meat, liver and other ingredients for his street food business.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is 36 years old and a married father of 4 children, aged 7-16, living in Hioma, Uganda. He is a hardworking man and very responsible. His family goal is to educate his children. He is a taxi driver and has been running this business for 10 years. He now wants to venture into a motorcycle business and has already bought one. His dream is to own at least five motorcycles. Ali needs the loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, cucumbers and herbs.

loans.name: Erik Isven

texts.es:
el joven Erik Isven tiene 21 años, vive en unión libre y no tiene hijos,  su actividad principal es la caficultura, con la producción anual genera ingresos para los gastos del hogar y asi mismo darle la asistencia a su finca, Erik tambien se dedica a la agricultura para consumo personal.

Erik utilizara el credito para la compra de un panel de energia solar, ya que por encontrarse la comunidad en donde vive en una zona montañosa, es imposible contar con energía electrica, pero al tener un sistema solar podra iluminarse y facilitarle el trabajo y los que haceres domésticos por las noches.
texts.en:
Young Erik Isven is 21. He is in a common-law marriage and does not have any children. His main line of work is coffee production; with his annual production he is able to generate an income to cover his household costs and maintain his farm. Erik also farms for personal consumption.

Erik will use this loan for the purchase of a solar energy panel. Because he lives in a mountainous area, electric power is out of the question. Having a solar panel will provide light for his household and facilitate work and housework in the evenings.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel.

loans.name: Luisa Marina

texts.es:
Doña Luisa sigue trabajando en limpieza , para el bien comun de la familia, pues es atraves de este esfuerzo que ha venido avanzando, en la mejora de su casa,  su esposo labora en construccion, tambien cuenta  con el apoyo de su hijo que ya trabaja.
Con el credito anterior era para cambio de techo, lo que desvio el credito, y termino muro, que tenia pendiente, devido ah elevados robos en el barrio, y que fue una victima de la delicuencia, robandocele sus electrodomesticos, es por tal razon desea terminar el muro, ya que le falta materiales para cerrarlo todo.
sastifecha al poder reguardar mas su propiedad, con su hermoso muro construido, siendo mas rapido esta mejora con los financiamiento que Afodenic otorga.
texts.en:
Doña Luisa continues to work as a janitor, for the common good of her family, for through this hard work she has been able to move ahead with the improvements to her home.  Her husband works in construction and they also have the support from their son who is also working.
The previous loan was for the replacement of  the roof.  There has been an increase in robberies in the neighborhood of which she was a victim when her electric appliances were stolen.  This has changed her focus to finishing the wall that was pending.  She needs additional materials to be able to enclose it all and be certain that her property is protected by the beautiful wall that has been built.  This improvement can be done more quickly with the help that Afondesic provides.

loans.use: to finish building a wall on her property.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is 47 years old, married, and a father of four children. He is a taxi operator and retail shop owner in Voi. He has been in business for the last two years. His businesses have been successful, and this will be his first loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. He plans to service his taxi cab to ensure that it is in good condition. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his retail shop business by purchasing more stock of flour, sugar, and cooking fat. He hopes to have a new taxi cab in the future, and to have a happy, satisfied family.

loans.use: to service his taxi cab to ensure that it is in good condition.

loans.name: Kayiok

texts.en:
Kayiok is 32 years old and married with two children. He is a wheat farmer who has been doing this for the past nine years, and he says that the returns have been good. 

He knew about KADET from another registered client with KADET, and he joined. He has been a good client who is currently on his third loan which he plans to use to prepare land for farming and buy farm materials i.e. wheat seeds and fertilizers.

He hopes to make profit and use it to re-invest in another business. He is an assiduous man who can do more if funded.

loans.use: To prepare land for farming and buy farm materials

loans.name: Fidelia

texts.es:
Fidelia tiene 43 años edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene siete hijos, ella nació en el distrito de Huarocondo de la provincia de Anta y actualmente vive en el poblado de la Cantuta de la provincia de Urubamba, ella se dedica a la venta de cerveza y chicha de jora, ella también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como gallinas y cuyes. En esta oportunidad Fidelia requiere el préstamo para comprar cuyes, gallinas y maíz para hacer jora. 

Fidelia es integrante del banco comunal “Nueva Vision de Rumichaca”. Este  grupo está conformado con 19 socios que viven  en la provincia de Urubamba. La provincia de Urubamba está ubicada al norte de la ciudad del Cusco, a orillas del río Vilcanota, en una zona que se conoce como el “Valle Sagrado” debido a su clima templado, tierra  fértil y abundantes riachuelos, que hacen de este valle uno de los más bellos del planeta.
texts.en:
Fidelia is 43 years old and is married with seven children. She was born in the Huarocondo in the Anta Province. Currently, she lives in the town of Cantuta in Urubamba Province. She sells corn and chicha de jora [traditional corn liquor] while also raising small animals like hens and guinea pigs. At the moment Fidelia needs this loan to buy guinea pigs, hens, and corn to make chicha de jora.  

Fidelia is a member of the Nueva Vision de Rumichaca communal bank, a group of 19 members who live in Urubamba Province, located north of the city of Cusco on the banks of the Vilcanota River. The area is known as the Sacred Valley for its mild climate, fertile soil, and abundant streams that make this valley one of the most beautiful on the planet.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, hens, and corn to make chicha de jora.

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
El señor Jose Santos es casado, tiene 38 años de edad, cursó los 5 años de educación primaria, tiene 2 hijos 1 de los cuales esta estudiando,se dedica al comercio a la venta de ropa casual para hombre y mujeres, inició este negocio por iniciativa propia y hasta el momento lleva 2 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica al mismo oficio.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderías, y mejorar sus ventas, espera tener en el futuro un negocio prospero.
texts.en: José Santos, 38, is married and completed five years of elementary school.  He has two children one of which attends school.  He is a merchant; he sells casual clothes for men and women.  He started the business on his own initiative and to date has two years’ experience.  His wife who is in the same line of work supports his efforts.  He’s asking for a loan to buy merchandise and improve his sales; he hopes to have a prosperous business in the future.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Etta

texts.en:
Etta is 43 years old and lives in Congo Town; she is married with three children between the ages of 7 to 27 years old, three of them are in school and all live at home.  Etta has been selling dried fish for the past twenty-six years.  

She started this business with money given to her by her husband and she learned this business from friends. Her favorite part about her business is that she makes more profits.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more dried cassava fish for her business.  In future she wants to build a house for her children.

loans.use: To purchase more dried cassava fish for her business.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is married and has three children. His wife is a petty trader. He has had some form of formal education, as he is a middle school graduate. Isaac currently sells provisions and operates motor transport services in Ve-Wudome (near Hohoe) and its surrounding villages. 

Isaac has been working as a product seller for close to ten years. His income is used to help his wife pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. 

He plans on using his loan to purchase an increased quantity of soap, canned drinks, candies, candles, and engine oil for the monthly servicing of his motorbike, thus allowing him to meet rising customers’ demand. 

He hopes to use the profits from his enterprise to develop his business further and ensure that all his children receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of soap, canned drinks, candies, candles, and engine oil for the monthly servicing of his motorbike.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Akouvi est une femme mariée résidant à Baguida avec trois enfants à charge. Akouvi est âgée de 37 ans et est une revendeuse de charbon de bois qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Pour financer son achat, Akouvi nécessite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois en vue de bien revendre et de réaliser plus de bénéfice et relancer son activité afin de pouvoir soutenir au mieux son mari dans les charges de la famille et permettre une bonne éducation scolaire à leurs enfants.
texts.en: Akouvi is a married woman who lives in Baguida with three dependent children. She is 37 years old and a charcoal reseller. She buys her charcoal supply in the market three times a month and resells it in front of her home. Akouvi needs this loan to order and finance the bags of charcoal for resale. The additional income she earns will enable her to continue her business and to best help her husband with the family's expenses. It also makes it possible for their children to get a good education.

loans.use: to buy 4 bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Marie Philippine

texts.fr:
Marie  Philippine a 31  ans, elle est mariée. Le mari  travaille comme maçon. Le couple a 3 enfants âgés de 10, 14, et 16 ans dont les deux aînés scolarisés dans des écoles privées et le dernier dans un établissement primaire public. Des efforts ont té effectués pour pouvoir éduquer les enfants.  Le ménage vit dans une maison héritée des parents.  Le rêve est de pouvoir construire leur propre maison , et d’assurer la réussite des enfants  dans leurs études. 
Marie  Philippine vend des fruits et des produits de la petite quincaillerie. La vente de fruits est une nouvelle activité créée depuis deux mois (activité saisonnière) , tandis que la vente des produits de la petite quincaillerie a débuté depuis deux années , les prêts antérieurs ( 3 prêts)  lui ont permis de développer  ces activités génératrices de revenus depuis qu’elle s’est mariée. Elle travaillait dans une entreprise franche avant.

loans.use: acheter des articles de quincaillerie: cable, rallonges, prises, ampoules, tourne vis

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 41 years of age and married with 3 children. Two are in high school and the last born is in primary school. She is the assistant chairperson of Ngurueini Ngatha Women group and one of the founding members. She is a church elder, a youth counselor and also a local community developer.

Joyce is a business woman; she sells cereals, cooking oil, sugar, salt, bread, soap and detergents. Her business has been performing well but she finds it hard to meet her family’s basic needs. Monthly, her business generates about USD300 but this is not enough to cater to all her family's needs and to buy a water tank.

She needs the tank to save her from walking a long distance to fetch water and she will be able to harvest rain water. She is hard working and paying the loan in installments will not be a big hassle.

loans.use: Joyce wants to buy a water tank

loans.name: Firangiz

texts.en: Firangiz B. owns a clothing store in the small town of Devechi, just south of Khachmaz, located in the North Eastern part of Azerbaijan. Firangiz wants to invest in a greater variety of clothing so that she can attract more customers. She wants to begin marketing to the younger generation in town.

loans.use: To invest in a greater variety of clothing to attract more customers.

loans.name: Marculino Augusto

texts.en:
Marculino, was born in 1967 in Manjacaze province in Gaza. Born to farmers, he studied until the 5th grade. When Marculino was 20 years old he moved to the city of Maputo with hopes of finding a job. He worked in the CFM – Rail roads of Mozambique -, and in his spare time he sold cigarettes, and other products in small quantities in order to provide for the 8 people he sustains. Later, he established himself in the market in Catembe where he is still active. Through HLUVUKU he has made 14 loans which enabled him to strengthen and establish his business. With the loan of 12.150,00 MT, Marculino wants to expand his stock in order to respond to the demands of his clients. In the future, he hopes to move his business to a more visible and larger venue where he will be able to better market his products.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Guachene - Catembe Cliente: Marculino Augusto U. Sector De Actividade: Comércio Valor de Empréstimo: 12.150,00MT (486.00US$) Aplicação de empréstimo: Compra de produtos de primeira necessidade Início: 12/04/07 Fim: 31/03/08 Marculino, nascido em 1967 em Manjacaze provincia de Gaza, filho de pais agricultores estudou ate 5ª classe. Aos 20 anos deslocou-se para a cidade de Maputo afim de procurar um emprego. Trabalhou nos CFM - Caminhos de Ferro de Moçambique como eventual e nos tempos livres dedicava-se a vender cigaros e outros produtos em pequenas quantidades o que mais tarde se tornou na actividade que lhe ajuda a ganhar o pão para sustentar 8 pessoas sob sua responsabilidade. Mais tarde veio instalar-se no mercado da Catembe onde até hoje exerce a sua actividade. Atraves de amigos conheceu a HLUVUKU onde recorreu a um total de 14 emprestimos que lhe ajudaram a fortificar seu negócio. Com o emprestimo de 12.150,00mt, pretende comprar mercadorias para reforçar o seu Stock de modo a responder as necessidades dos clientes. Como prespectiva, pretende transferir o seu estabelecimento para um lugar amplo e visível para melhor expor os seus produtos.

loans.use: To increase stock in his shop

loans.name: Adama

texts.en: Adama L. is married to a carpenter and has five children.  A thirty six years old, she runs a small business selling peppers, beans, sesame seeds and palm oil in the Magburaka market in Sierra Leone.  As her husband does not generate income often, Adama takes more responsibility for providing for the family’s basic needs.  She plans to expand her business and increase her income.  For these reasons, Adama is requesting a second loan from SMT of $175.

loans.use: Purchase addtional inventory of food supplies

loans.name: La

texts.en: Mr. La S. is 60 years old and lives with his wife (pictured) and 4 children in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia. Mr. La S. currently earns $5 a day profit selling wood. He is requesting this $500 loan so that he can expand his business in order to satisfy consumer demand and increase his profits.

loans.use: To purchase more wood for their stock

loans.name: Liliya

texts.en:
Liliya has a small shoe sales business located at the Barabashovo market in Kharkov, Ukraine. In business for seven years, she sells primarily women’s shoes. Liliya is single and supports herself almost entirely with her business. Her goal is to continue growing the business and she would eventually like to open another sales location.

Liliya has requested a loan of $1200 which will allow her to purchase additional shoe inventory. This will be her sixteenth loan from Nadiya Ukraine. She has proven to be an excellent loan client and we look forward to many more opportunities to help her with her business.

loans.use: Liliya would like to purchase more inventory for her shoe store.

loans.name: Meach

texts.en: Mrs. Meach L., age 53, is a garment worker, earning about $4 per day.  Her husband is a farmer, making less than $1 per day.  They have three children, one who is married and works selling gasoline, earning about $50 per month, and two who are unemployed.  She would like to request a loan of $1200 in order to open a stand selling gasoline so her son has a permanent place to sell his gasoline, thereby drawing more frequent customers and increasing his income to benefit his family.  Her husband is pictured in the photo as she was unavailable at the time.

loans.use: To purchase a stand to sell gasoline.

loans.name: Babash

texts.ru:
Babash R. was born in 1974 in the Ahsuniyski region. He is not married. He has been actively involved in the business of animal breeding for three years. He first took out a loan of $600 from Normicro and bough two buffalos. This time, he wants to obtain another loan to expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Рахов Бабаш 1974 года рождения. Уроженец Ахсуниского района. Холость. Три года этот человек занимается скотоводством. Бабаш активно ведет эту работу. Первый раз он взял кредит в Нормикро Ахсуниского филиала 600 долларов и купил два буювола. Теперь он хочеть взять еще кредит, чтобы расщирить свой бизнес.

loans.use: To increase the guantity animals

loans.name: Geronima

texts.es:
Jerónima V. a thirty one year old mother of one is the owner of a popular clothing store. With savings from her previous job she opened the store in order to provide for her daughter who is entering the first grade in the Municipal School of Caaguazú.

Her dream is to continue expanding the store and make it a place where people can come and find any clothes they may want. This is why she is asking for a loan. Jerónima will buy shirts, t-shirts, shorts, pants, underwear for both men and women, along with sandals, shoes, and sports shoes.

loans.use: To buy clothes for her store including t-shirts, shorts, pants, under garments for men and women, blouses, sandals, and sports shoes.

loans.name: Ni Ketut Sari

texts.id:
Ni Ketut Sari is a grandmother who has 4 children and 10 grandchildren. Ni Ketut Sari lives alone with her husband as all of their children has moved out.

To kill the time, she opens a small stall in front of her house. She sells daily necessities such as veggies, traditional snacks made by her neighbors and also various kinds of foods and drinks.

Every morning her husband accompanies her to go to the market to buy for ingredients and merchandise. At 5 am she finishes the morning market shopping and starts to open her stall. She can earn net profit of IDR 20 thousand per day (around USD 2.5). Her stall is doing quite good as it gets a lot of customer.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Ketut Sari seorang nenek dengan 10 cucu karena 4 anaknya semuanya sudah berkeluarga dan tidak tinggal bersamanya. Ni Ketut Sari dan suaminya sudah lanjut usia. Tetapi semangat hidupnya sangat tinggi. Supaya tidak kesepian Ni Ketut Sari membuka usaha dagang dirumahnya. Ni Ketut Sari menjual kebutuhan sehari – hari, seperti sayur - sayuran, kue-kue tradisional yang dititip tetangganya dan berbagai macam makanan dan minuman ringan. Setiap hari, dengan diantar suaminya, Ni Ketut Sari berbelanja di pasar pagi di kotanya. Jam 5 pagi, Ni Ketut Sari sudah sampai dirumah dan mulai membuka warungnya. Setiap hari Ni Ketut Sari mengeluarkan modal hampir Rp. 300.000.- Dan pendapatan perhari bisa mencapai Rp. 150.000.- sd Rp. 200.000.-. Dengan rata-rata keuntungan perhari yang diperolehnya Rp. 20.000,-. Karena ramainya orang yang berbelanja kewarungnya, Ni ketut Sari menjadi semangat untuk bekerja supaya pelanggannya tidak hilang.

loans.use: To add working capital (Menambah modal usaha)

loans.name: Sahdullo

texts.en:
D. Sahdullo is 21 years old. He is a market vendor. He is selling clothing for kids, like socks, in the local market. In spite of his young age, Sahdullo is a rather experienced businessman. He knows what goods to choose and what prices are the most attractive for his clients.
Sahdullo has just married and he is working even harder to support his young family and make savings for their future life. Now Sahdullo needs to increase the working capital in to enlarge his range of goods. With this purpose, Sahdullo requests $950.00 for the term of 6 months. This is the first loan for Sahdullo, and he promises to repay it promptly, and thanks all supporting him.

loans.use: To increase capital and enlarge the range of goods to sell.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Mrs Ana E. runs a grocery store in the district of San Rafael del Sur in Managua, Nicaragua. Thanks to this business and her energy, she has succeeded in improving her economic situation.

She is the mother of two little children. Together with her husband she tries to provide them with everything they need for their development.

She now needs to buy goods in order to commercialise them. Therefore, she requested the support of CEPRODEL in order to obtain the necessary loan to purchase the merchandise she needs from her suppliers. In this way, she will be able to continue to raise her children and maintain her modest home.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Ana E. con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado mejorar su condición económica por medio de su negocio de pulpería el que atiende en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur en Managua Nicaragua.

Es madre de dos hijos pequeños el cual junto con su esposo es esfuerza para proporcionarles las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo. La necesidad atravesada por esta dama es la urgencia de adquirir los productos para comercializarlos. Por ello busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario para la adquirir su mercadería de sus proveedores y así continuar con su ardua labor de mantenimiento de sus hijos y de su humilde hogar donde habita.

loans.use: To purchase goods

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel O. is 43 years old. He is married with seven children. He is a supplier and retailer of local meat like beef, goat meat, mutton and pork to food vendors and local restaurant operators.

He buys his supplies from villages and sells to his customers. With his small working capital, he is not able to buy larger quantities to make enough income.

He wants to use the loan to buy bulk beef, goat meat, mutton and pork to serve his customers good quality meat for their meals. He believes this will provide him with increased income to expand his business and also finance his children’s education.

He belongs to the community group called Decency Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee one another as social collateral to access loans and peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy bulk beef, goat meat, mutton and pork.

loans.name: Oscar Humberto

texts.es:
Oscar is a 62 year old man with two children, who are 20 and 26 years old and live independently. But he always tries to help them in any way he can.

Oscar and his wife live in Laureles Sur neighbourhood of the city. He is a topographer and a painter and his wife runs a small general store from their home. They require this loan to secure their home and shop by building a wall for the front room, where the shop is located.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Don Oscar es un señor de 62 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos de 20 y 26 años que ya son independientes a él, pero Don Oscar siempre está haciendo lo posible para ayudarles. Don Oscar habita en el barrio Laureles Sur, es casado y su esposa es una pequeña comerciante que posee una pulpería en su casa de habitación. Don Oscar trabaja como topógrafo y también es pintor. Está solicitando el préstamo para construir un muro delantero en su casa de habitación, para así poder darle seguridad al pequeño negocio de su esposa y a su casa también.

loans.use: To build a wall in front of the house and the shop

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr:
Ama V. is 40 years old, married and the mother of 3 children. She lives in Assahoun, a village located 50 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. For many years Mrs. V. has worked as a retail merchant of food products. With this second loan, she hopes to increase her stock of peanuts, millets, beans and other foods for resale and increase the capacity of her business. The profits from her work will allow her to better meet the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer.

Ama V. est âgée de 40 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Il habite à Assahoun, un village situé à environ 50 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Madame est revendeuse de produits vivriers depuis des années. Avec ce second crédit, elle souhaite faire davantage de stocks de arachide, de mil, du haricot et autres pour la revente et augmenter la capacité de son commerce. Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To increase stocks of peanuts, millets, beans and other foods for resale

loans.name: Siti's Tujitahidi Group

texts.en:
Siti is a widow with two children, ages 3 and 1. She is a fish seller. Every day, she works from 7:00 A.M. to 9:00 P.M. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

Siti now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for resale. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Pili and Nasra, who also have businesses dealing with firewood sales and clothing sales.

loans.use: To buy more fish for resale

loans.name: Ni Nengah Tarmin

texts.id: Ni Nengah Tarmin seorang ibu rumah tangga yang mempunyai pekerjaan sampingan memelihara babi. Pekerjaan tersebut ditekuninya untuk menambah pendapatan  keluarganya, khususnya untuk meringankan beban suaminya dalam memenuhi perekonomian keluarganya. Sebelumnya, Ni Nengah Tarmin menjalani usaha ini hanya untuk mengisi waktu luang di rumah. Namun setelah mendapat pembinaan dan pelatihan tentang beternak babi dari Yayasan Dinari, Ni Nengah Tarmin ingin meningkatkan usahanya. Untuk mewujudkan hal tersebut, Ni Nengah Tarmin bergabung dengan program Dinari, khususnya program Ternak Babi yang periode pinjamannya selama 6 bulan dan pembayaran pinjaman pada akhir periode. Hal tersebut berdasarkan perhitungan masa pemeliharaan babi selama 4 – 5 bulan dan bulan ke 6, peternak sudah siap menjual babinya. Dengan bergabungnya Ni Nengah Tarmin ke dalam program tersebut, ia berhak mendapat pendampingan  Dokter Hewan dari Yayasan Dinari dan mendapat pelatihan mendalam tentang beternak babi. Pinjaman yang didapat direncanakan untuk membeli induk dan anak babi untuk meningkatkan populasi ternaknya. Ni Nengah Tarmin optimis usahanya akan maju dengan adanya bantuan dana dan pendampingan dari Dinari.
texts.en:
Ni Nengah Tarmin is a housewife. She raises piglets to help the family's economic. She received guidances from DINARI Foundation in the field of pig farming. She is now in a 6 month pig farming program from DINARI Foundation. She hopes she can buy more breeding pigs and piglets to improve her business.


Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy breeding pigs and piglets (Membeli induk dan anak babi)

loans.name: Bocar

texts.fr: Bocar D. est un menuisier expérimenté. Il esr marié et grâce à son activité il entretien bien sa famille. Il fait un chiffres d'affaires de 15000 à 20000 fcfa par jour. Ce crédit lui a permis de renforcer ses activités.
texts.en:
Bocar D. is an experience cabinet maker. He is married and, thanks to his work, he is providing nicely for his family. His sale figures come to 15,000 to 20,000 francs CFA per day. This loan would enable him to boost his business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Carpentry

loans.name: Soeurng

texts.en: Mrs. Soeurng S. is 20 years old and single. She now lives in Rong village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables to earn a living. On her plantation, she faces some problems because she does not have animals to plow the fields. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow her fields. She would use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizers to support her fields to make her crop more productive later.

loans.use: To hire a laborer with two oxen to plow her fields and to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Enely A.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 19-years-old Enely M. from Kyela. She is married with one child, who is one year old. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependent because the child's parents can not take care of him.

Enely has been running a general store business since 2006. She sells rice, cooking oil, soda, soap, matches, and so forth. She works at the business for 9 to 12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by her husband. Enely currently earns about 50 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 775 USD in order to purchase additional stock of sugar, cooking oil, salt, soap and soda. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and range of the stock. Enely thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit through micro-leasing in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women and uses the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of sugar, cooking oil, salt, soap and soda

loans.name: Rose

texts.fr: Mme Rose L. est née le 23 Août 1970 à Lomé. Elle est célibataire avec deux (02) enfants. Commerçante de boissons, de fruits et d’arachides grillés, elle fait toujours preuve d’un dynamisme dans cette activité. Bonne gestionnaire et maîtrisant bien son activité, elle sollicite un financement qui va lui permettre d’agrandir son étalage. Ceci pourra augmenter ses bénéfices et contribuer davantage à l’amélioration de ses conditions de vie et de celles de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rose L. was born in Lomé on August 23, 1970. She's unmarried and has two children. She sells beverages, fruits, and roasted peanuts, and she's always very energetic. A good manager, she excels in her business. She's seeking a loan to enlarge her stand, in order to increase her profit and to better contribute to improving her living conditions and those of her children.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell beverages and fruits

loans.name: San

texts.en: Mrs. San K. is a villager in Knol village in Kampong Cham province. She is a nurse in the local village. Aside from this career, she is also a farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates cassava. On this plantation, she faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to hire laborers to work in the field. In order to deal with this problem, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose and she would use the rest of the loan to buy equipment to take care of the people in her nursing career. Mrs. San K. is a 51-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is a laborer and the other is attending the local school.

loans.use: To hire laborers to work in the field.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a bites (maandazi) seller in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar. She belongs to Mwanzo Mgumu group loan (Group code 2018). Every day she works at her business. She is requesting loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items (cooking oil and flour) for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Asha is 39 years old, married, and has three children: ages 10, 9 and 8.

loans.use: To buy more items (cooking oil and flour) for her business.

loans.name: Zaki

texts.en:
Zaki is a 57-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon with his wife and their four children. Zaki has owned a mini-market for ten years. He requested a loan of $900 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his market. Zaki has been a micro credit client for six years now and has always paid on time. 
His previous loans helped him improve his business and his financial situation. Zaki is special in his work because he has diverse merchandise. In the future, he plans to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his market.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael O. Owuir is a soft-spoken married man and father of two children, both in school. His wife sells fish while Michael drives people around town on his motorbike, colloquially known as a piki-piki. They live in Yolanda slum.

Michael is asking for 10,000 K Sh. to help his wife expand her business so she can sell flour, sugar and salads. He said the challenges come when purchasing the goods, making sure food items have not already expired and making sure they are of high quality.

He would like to Kiva lenders to know that he himself was an orphan and that if profit allows, he will educate his children so they can lead a better life than they are living.

loans.use: To purchase food stock to sell

loans.name: Fitila

texts.fr:
B. Fitila est née vers 1958 à Ekpè dans la Commune de Sèmè-Podji dans le Département de l'Ouémé au Sud du Bénin. Fitila est mariée à NOUATIN Blaise agent retraité de l'Office des Postes et Télécommunication du Bénin. Fitila est mère de quatre enfants mais aucun n'est encore à sa charge. Fitila vend la pâte de maïs. Fitila en effet prépare cette pâte de maïs qu'elle emballe dans des feuilles de teck et la livre en gros aux revendeurs et aux propriétaires de restaurant. Fitila vend également en kilogramme le sel de cuisine ainsi que des plats en plastique. Fitila est dans la vente de pâte de maïs depuis trente (30) ans mais elle a besoin d'appui financier pour renforcer son fonds de roulement afin de bien répondre à la grande demande qu'elle ne cesse d'enregistrer tous les jours. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
B. Fitila was born around 1958 in Ekpè, in the community of Sèmè-Podji, Ouémé County, in southern Bénin. She is married to NOUATIN Blaise, a retired representative of Benin’s postal and telecom department. She is the mother of four children, but none are still supported by her. Fitila sells pâte de maïs (a soft boiled polenta) that she wraps in teak leaves and delivers in bulk to retailers and restaurant owners. She also sells salt by the kilo, as well as plastic plates. She has been selling pâte de maïs for thirty years, but she is in need of financial support to boost her working capital, so as to respond better to the big demand, which is noticeably incessant every day.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of corn and salt, and boxes of plastic plates

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
El señor Andrés vive en casa propia en la calle Francisco Suárez de la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz, tiene un micro bus con el cual trabaja como transporte publico de pasajeros, este es su único medio para generar ingresos y con lo que gana el mantiene a su familia y puede cubrir sus necesidades; el crédito que solicita es para comprar batería y poder mejorar las condiciones de su herramienta de trabajo.

Es cliente antiguo y paga muy bien, por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. Andrés lives in his own home on Francisco Suárez Street in the Tembladerani neighborhood in La Paz. He has a bus which he uses for public transportation. This is the only means to earn income and iwth which he can support his family and cover his needs. The loan he's requesting is to buy a battery and to be able to improve the conditions of his tool for work. He is an old client and pays well; for that reason, he will be able to access a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Schmid, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a battery for his bus

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 48 years old and married with five children. She sells provisions, drinks, and firewood to make a living.

She hopes to obtain a loan in the amount of N70,000 to purchase more firewood, drinks, and provisions to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, drinks, and firewood to sell

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas is a member of Banco Comunal Sumaqcha, which means Beautiful in Quechua. She is single, 42 years old, and has four children.

Felicitas travels to the different fairs in the region where she sells fruit and buys grain. She also buys cheese, small animals, and products which she sells in the markets of the city of Ayacucho.

Felicitas needs a loan of 1,000 soles which she will use to buy grain and cheese. Her dreams are to build her own home using good materials and to buy land in the Ayacuchan forest to plant cacao.

loans.use: To buy grain and cheese

loans.name: Omina

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Омина Игамкулова- женщина 1975-го года рождения,замужем,мать 4-х детей, образование среднее. Муж водитель маршрутного такси, старшая дочь и сын учатся в школе. Заниматься торговлей хозяйственных товаров вот уже 5 лет. Начала свою деятельность с продажи мыла и моющих средств. Постепенно она расширила ассортимент товара, то есть добавила хозяйсвенные товаря для дома и бытовую косметику, а также расширила место деятельности. Сейчас её активы увеличились в два раза, в будущем она планирует добавить в свой ассортимент пластиковую посуду.
texts.en:
Born in 1975, Omina I. is married and has 4 children. She has a secondary education. Her husband is a taxi driver, and her oldest daughter and son are in school. Omina has been involved in sales of household goods for 5 years now. She started her business by selling soap and cleaning agents. She gradually expanded her goods assortment by adding household products for home and cosmetics, and she also expanded her store. Omina’s business assets now doubled, and she plans to add plastic dishware to her goods assortment in the future.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of five boxes of household soap

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy A. manages a small rice farm. She has been doing this since she married Orlando A., who also makes a living as a farmer. Together, they have two children. To date, planting rice and vegetables have helped to sustain their livelihoods.

She is frequesting a loan worth Php 7,000. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and rice seeds. This loan will provide much assistance to her in order for them to grow their business. It will also help increase their income as well.

Nancy has chosen CEVI for its various services. Aside from loans, all CEVI clients have had the chance to participate in trainings and insurance coverage services.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: S. is a low-income woman who earns a living as a local farmer. She is married with three young children who are of school age. She and her husband inherited a plot of their grandparent’s farmland where they cultivate different kinds of natural crops. Since S.’s husband is completely growing their crop, he wants to attain other work in order to supply additional money for his family’s demands but he has no capital. He has discussed with his wife to look for a loan as capital to purchase a villager’s horse, which S.’s husband will use for a taxi service.

loans.use: To purchase a horse

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Susana T. is a business woman. She has selling cooked noodles to sell to people in their village for a business. Anyhow, profit she had for this kind of business augments her husband's income being a hired chainsaw operator but still it can't sustain the daily expenses her four children ages from four to 25. With this problem she faced, she thought of having another business in order to increase their income. In order to pursue her plan, she joined ASHI eight months ago. She loaned for a business capital and she then started her RTW buy and sell business. She sells clothes in their village and after six months, she has able to repaid her loan from the profits she had. Now, she applies for a bigger amount of loan which will be used to finance the growth of her RTW buy and sell business. Someday, when she her business has grown, she will be renting a space open to public for more costumers. She also would like her business to become stable to be able to secure her children financial need.

loans.use: Will be used to finance her selling of Ready To Wear (RTW) clothes business.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Hog raising is how Lolita earns income for her family. She wants to have additional business capital for the maintenance of her hog-raising business. She is also asking for financial support to enable her to buy for a sack of hog feed that her business needs. She hopes to obtain a PHP 4,000 loan from Kiva lenders as additional business capital.

Lolita’s husband, Panfilo, who is a house carpenter, also helps her in her business. They are blessed with seven children and two of them already have their own families. Some of her children are still living with them and they are: Analiza - 23 years old, a high school graduate; Hustle Joy - 20 years old; Sunshine - 18 years old, a high school graduate; Feric Art - 16 years old; and Princes - 12 years old who is now in her second year high school.

Lolita hopes that she will be able to continue to support her youngest daughter in her schooling.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Bou

texts.en: Bou L., 29, is married with a three-year-old child. To make a living, she has been in the city to work as a garment factory worker, earning an income of US $3 per day. Her husband is involved in the agriculture sector, and he is also a construction worker in his province, earning an income of US $5 per day. Their living standard is improved since they have had these businesses. Therefore, Eng is asking for a loan of US $800 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to transport his rice production to sell. By doing so, she hopes her husband will be able to generate more income to raise a good standard of living for the family.

loans.use: buy a motorbike

loans.name: Teng

texts.en: Teng C., 30, is married with two school-aged children. She resides with her husband and children in Sa Ang, Cambodia. To make a living, she has a business weaving Cambodian traditional silk, earning an income of $3 per day in revenue. Also, with her available time from weaving, she is involved in the agriculture sector as a rice field farmer to earn extra income. Her husband helps her with her craft and raises pigs for resale, earning an income of $3 per day. This couple is asking for a loan of $800 to purchase more silk to expand the craft business. C. hopes that her standard of living will be improved when her plan of investment to expand her business is successful.

loans.use: To buy silk to expand the business

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta G., owns and manages a small corn farm in her village. She is 38 years old and has been married for 12 years. She has three children. Her eldest child is 10 years old. She has been doing her best to prosper in her her livelihood in order to help pay the tuition, books and other school fees. 

She is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use her loan to buy all the farming necessities to grow her crops.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en: Clarita G. is 23 years old, living in Barangay Mozzozzin Norte, Sta. Maria Isabela. She is happily married and blessed with a child named Angelica Mae, who is 5 years old and in kindergarten in their village. Clarita is engaged in the retail of rice. Her husband is a local farmer and also a Barangay Councilor in their village. Since her husband does not have regular work, she started her own business as another source of income. Together they are helping one another to provide for their basic needs. Clarita wants to improve her business; thus she is asking to borrow a loan amounting to 5,000 PHP from Kiva lenders. She plans to buy several sacks of rice and other commodities that she can offer to her customers.

loans.use: Additional capital for her rice retailing business

loans.name: Tusobola Development Group Of Mukono

texts.en:
Teopista K. is 40 years old and is the leader of her group in Mukono. She is married and cares for her three children and four orphans.

Teopista has been running a retail shop operation for ten years and generates 70,000 UGX per week from the business. Right now, her capital levels are low and she would like to use the loan amount of 300,000 UGX to boost business and increase levels of inventory.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena M. is from the village of Gaang near Tangub City. She is 40 years old. Elena is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Elena raises crops. The main source of income for her business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Elena has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2008, Elena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. Elena is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Elena from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business for daily needs and to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.
Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Modou

texts.fr: Monsieur Mbacke Modou, célibataire âgé de 23 ans est boutiquier à Bambey. C’est après son apprentissage à l’école coranique qu’il a embrassé ce secteur. Ainsi, à la recherche d’une certaine indépendance et à défaut de qualification professionnelle, Monsieur Modou Mbacke décida d’ouvrir une boutique dans son quartier. Cependant, Monsieur Mbacke demande un crédit de 150 000 frs CFA pour réapprovisionner  sa boutique. Il compte acheter avec le prêt du riz, de l’huile et du sucre qui sont des marchandises très prisées par la communauté. Avec cette première demande de crédit, Monsieur Modou Mbacké espère accroitre ses bénéfices afin d’être bien considérer dans sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Modou Mbacké, aged 23, is single and a storekeeper in Bambey. He launched his business after having studied at the Islamic school. In his quest for some independence and since he mastered no craft, he decided to open a convenience store in his neighborhood. He applies now for a loan of 150,000 CFA francs to resupply his store. He will buy rice, oil and sugar, which are products in high demand in the local community. This is Mr. Mbacké’s first loan and he hopes that it will enable him to increase his earnings and be well regarded in his family.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, oil and sugar

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice P. is currently in the business of selling local alcoholic beverages, beer, and soda, and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer and soda to sell. Joice is 33 years old and is married with a husband that is a soldier. She has 6 children, and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a hotel.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs, as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more crates of beer and soda to sell

loans.name: Confines Del Sur Group

texts.es:
Las socias del Banco comunal “Confines del Sur” son de la ciudad de Angol, ubicada a 2 horas hacia el sur de Temuco, en la Región de la Araucanía. Temuco se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile) y posee una serie de balnearios lacustres y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativa. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existentes en nuestro país.
Ellas se dedican principalmente a la venta de ropa nueva y usada, venta de provisiones y verduras en ferias, a atender bazares, librerías y  peluquerías. 
Noemí, es la presidenta de este BC. En la foto es la única mujer rubia de la 1º fila. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa juvenil y ropa interior, puerta a puerta y confecciona recuerdos para eventos tales como graduaciones, bautizos y matrimonios. 
Noemí invertirá este préstamo en ropa para vender. Con ella vive su hija menor de 7 años , la cual es su gran motivación para trabajar. Su sueño es tener un negocio establecido en su propia casa, para de esta manera alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida. Para Noemí Fondo Esperanza ha significado una oportunidad y herramientas para surgir.
texts.en:
The members of the "Confines del Sur" communal bank are from Angol, which is two hours south of Temuco, in the Araucanía region. Temuco is 670 kilometers south of Santiago, Chile's capital, and it has several lakeside resorts and very showy flora and fauna. It's worth noting that this area is home to 50% of Mapuche, an indigenous people of Chile. Most of the members sell new and used clothing. Some sell groceries and vegetables in the markets, some tend to sales stalls, bookstores, barbershops. Noemí is the president of the communal bank. In the photo, she is the only blonde in the first row. She sells underwear and young adult clothing door-to-door; she also makes souvenirs for events like graduations, baptisms and weddings. Noemí will use the funds to buy clothing to sell. Her 7-year-old daughter, who is the motivating force in her life, lives with her. Her dream is to have an established store in her home so that she can reach a better quality of life. For Noemí, Fondo Esperanza has meant an opportunity and the tools to surge ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan M. is from the village of Malaubang Ozamiz City. She is 46 years old. Susan is married and has 8 adult-aged children.

To make a living, Susan sells clothing and shoe products to the local community. Susan has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Susan joined GDMPC to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Susan is requesting her first loan from GDMPC, for 10000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Elba Luz

texts.es: Elba Luz C. M. de 28 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Morazán. Vive junto a sus dos hijos, una niña de 9 años la cual se dedica a estudiar, una bebé de 15 meses de edad, y su abuela de 68 años de edad, quien le ayuda con el cuido de sus hijas y los quehaceres del hogar. Elba se dedica a la elaboración de empanadas, las cuales son un platillo típico hecho a base de plátano, con el cual se forma una masa y se hace una bolita que se rellena ya sea de leche o de frijoles y luego se fríe y al servirlas se les agrega azúcar. Las empanadas son hechas en su casa, proceso en el cual su abuela le ayuda, ya que hacen una cantidad bastante razonable, las cuales comercializa en una escuela del lugar con todos los jóvenes de educación media. Así mismo las vende en su casa con ayuda de su abuela y Elba se encarga de venderlas a parte de la escuela de forma ambulante por colonias y cantones. Elba se esfuerza mucho por vender todo su producto cada día, ya que es esta la única fuente de ingresos que posee, así mismo porque ella es la única que sostiene a su familia y se encarga de todos los gastos del hogar. Es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo a Integral, a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de plátanos, leche, frijoles, azúcar  y aceite, lo cual es la materia prima de su negocio.
texts.en:
Elba Luz C. M. is 28, and she lives in the Morazán department. She lives with her two children. She has a nine year old daughter who goes to school and a 15 month old baby. She also lives with her 68 year old grandmother who helps her take care of her daughters and do the household chores. Elba makes empanadas. This is a typical dish made with a banana base, which is formed into dough. It is shaped into a small ball and has a milk or bean filling. Then it is fried and served with sugar on top. The empanadas are made in her house. Her grandmother helps with the process because they make a fair amount. She sells them to middle school students at a school in her area. She also sells them at home with help from her grandmother. Elba is in charge of selling them away from the school as a traveling vendor in neighborhoods and cantons. Elba puts forth a lot of effort to sell all of her product everyday because it is the only source of income that she has. She is the only one supporting her family and paying all of the household expenses. That is the reason she is asking for Integral for a loan. With the loan she will be able to buy a larger quantity of bananas, milk, beans, sugar, and oil. These are the raw materials of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bananas, milk, beans, sugar, and oil

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: La señora Rosa Maria tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos de 22 y 26 años de edad, que trabajan de manera independiente. La señora tiene un negocio de compra-venta de frutas y verduras. Cabe señalarse, ella dio inicio a este negocio desde hace 14 años, ella empezó en este negocio comprando pequeñas cosechas de limones, las cuales en ese tiempo vendía en el M. con su mama. Luego decide iniciar con su propio negocio. Ella actualmente está solicitando un crédito en Fundación León 2000 para ser invertido en la compra de naranjas de ½ manzana, las cuales ya les hace falta solamente unos dos meses para empezar a sacar cosecha. Su tiempo de sacar cosecha es de aproximadamente 4 meses y medio. Su sueño siempre ha sido contar con suficiente capital propio para no depender de los créditos para poder sufragar los gastos, sin embargo no se queja de los beneficios del financiamiento ya que le ha permitido diversificar sus inventarios.
texts.en:
Ms. Rosa Maria is 45 years old. She is married and has two children who are 22 and 26 years old. They work independently. She has a business buying and selling fruits and vegetables. It is worth noting that she started this business 14 years ago. She began by buying small harvests of lemons, which at that time she sold in her mother's market. Later she decided to start her own business. At present, she is asking for a loan from Fundación León 2000 to be invested in purchasing oranges from a 3,500 sq. meter lot. These will be ready to start harvesting in about two months. The harvesting time is about 4 and a half months long. Her dream has always been to have enough of her own capital to not depend on loans to be able to pay for expenses. Nevertheless, she is not complaining about the benefits of financing since it has allowed her to diversify her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital
